 title : The whitedog Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The features of WhiteDog System are: </p>

<p>Framework for the object sharing applications. i.e. shared paint board or chat application. Annotation based design. Put @Share annotation to the method you want to share its execution. Put @Share annotation to the field you want to synchronize its state at session start. Pluggable protocol. Currently, UDP multicasting(JGroups) and in-VM(ClassLoader) are supported. WhiteDog System runs on Java5 and depends on AspectJ1.6. </p>

<p>Now Ivy repository is available: http://whitedog.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ivyrepository/ You can use Ivy repository from your ivy by adding following settings to your ivysettings.xml </p>

<p>NewsJan.20 Ivy repository available. Aug.4  WhiteDog now supports state synchronization at starting session. Jun.26  Custom peer factory (PeerFactory) and current message sender (peer) identification (Session.getCurrentPeer()) are supported (in trunk). See chat sample for details Jun.24  Basic peer management (iterate/add event/remove event) is now supported in JGroupsSession implementation (in trunk) Now working forAdditional work relating ivy (publishing each module. source or javadoc artifacts) Projects</p>

<p>whitedog WhiteDog core classes which doesn&#39;t include any session implementation.  whitedog-jgroups JGroups session implementation.  whitedog-local Local session implementation.  whitedog-sample-paint Sample shared paint application.  whitedog-sample-autosessionpaint Sample shared paint application that uses automatic session management aspect(jp.whitedog.AutoSessionAspect).  whitedog-sample-localdoublepaint Sample locally shared paint application that has two shared paint area. That uses IN-VM(ClassLoader) session.  whitedog-sample-chat Sample chat application.  This application explains how to use peer management (and state synchronization)</p>
 title : The xchat-mono Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>X-Chat Managed Plugins. This plugin allow you create plugins for x-chat using Mono and  any Mono Enabled Compiler incluing C# and VB.NET. </p>

<p>How it worksCopy xchat-mono.so in your xchat plugin directory(e.g cp xchat-mono.so /usr/lib/xchat-gnome/plugins/) Copy xchat-mono.dll in your mono xchat directory(e.g cp xchat-mono.dll $HOME/.config/xchat/mono/): Copy your Plugins(.dll) in Xchat Mono Plugins(e.g cp xchat-mono-banshee.dll $HOME/.config/xchat/mono/plugins/): How to installYou can simplify the installation process running: </p>

<p>make sudo make install sudo make install-cil make install-plugins Note: you will need install libc development files and Mono development, in Ubuntu/Debian these packages are: &#39;libc-dev&#39; and &#39;mono-devel&#39; </p>

<p>How to compile and use managed pluginsCompile the plugin: gmcs -r:xchat-mono.dll MyPlugin.cs -target:library -out:MyPlugin.dll Install the plugin in $HOME/.config/xchat/mono/plugins/ directory   </p>

<p>Need help?Please post your question in the Discussion group at http://groups.google.com/group/xchat-mono or email me: thepumpkin1979 at gmail dot com</p>

 title : The diplomacy-strategy-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Short DescriptionThis is a standalone java applet that helps designing diplomacy board game strategies. It allows to edit graphically strategy tree with multiple branch. It doesn&#39;t provide hints or  analysis, it only provide a visual representation of a strategy tree. </p>

<p>online vesion - Follow the link to test the tool  on-line. </p>

<p>IntroductionDiplomacy is a tough game. It puts forwards the difficulty to be confident in a conflictive situation, and all the benefits that can be retrieved when an team raise. Moreover the strategic dimension underlies all the exchanges between the players. I have written this tool to allow a player to build a strategy schema. </p>

<p>Play diplomacy at: http://www.diplomatie-online.net </p>

<p>Funny conception tipThis tool is based on a database of countries, name shape and adjacency graph. I have build an editor to help me to create all these data. Provided I&#39;m a single programmer I used Powerpoint extensibility to build an editor. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>For each country I draw the shape of all places where an army can be drooped. Notice that in Spain there is only one country, but there is one place for tanks an two coasts for fleets. On each place with a resource center I draw a circle to locate where the resource center icon will be drawn. Then on each place I draw a rectangle to locate where the army icon will be drawn. Finally for each place I write the place&#39;s name in the web text replacement field of the shape. </p>

<p>I draw each county shape on the map and I place circle and square geometry in each one to control. </p>

<p>All these data are gathered and processed thanks to the macro entitled &quot;cool&quot; (how, I should change that now). &quot;cool&quot; write a file in &quot;c:\output.xml&quot; that can is included in the applet package. </p>

<p>http://diplomacy-strategy-editor.googlecode.com/files/diplo-applet-editor.zip </p>

<p>The adjacency data has been entered by hand... I was really long, if you need it it is provided with the sources. </p>

<p>Screen shots and basic useThe top tool palette contains the map, flags, fleets and armies. Drag items from the tool bar to the working area.  </p>

<p> </p>

<p>First drag a map from the tool bar to the working area.  </p>

<p>It is possible to translate the working area by using the mouse middle button and moving the mouse. It is also possible to zoom in and zoom out by pressing the mouse right button and moving the pout up and down.  </p>

<p>Now lets drag a few troops and resource center&#39;s flags. Notice that the tanks can only  be dropped on the ground and fleet only on the sea. A nice shape highlights the country that is under the mouse to ease the placement. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>It is possible to remove items from a map by dropping them into the recycle. It highlights to show that the army will be removed. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Create an attack order by dragging an army over the attacked army of an adjacent place, with pressing the CTRL key. It creates an arrow that symbolizes the attach order. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Create support order by dragging an army over the supported order or the supported army. The army or order highlights to let you know that the support order will be created. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Now, let&#39;s show the power of this tool. Lets create the strategy tree.  Take the map of the working area ad drag it to a lower place with pressing SHIFT. A new map is created and linked to the initial one.  The application allows to create as many fork as required. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Finally let&#39;s save the work by using the save disk button.</p>

 title : The drools-flex-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutThis project is a full blown IDE for the Drools Rule Engine written in Adobe Flex. Although, the actual front-end can be adopted to work for any language.  </p>

<p>GoalThe goal of this project is to create a viable alternative to author rules online rather than offline in Eclipse, text files, or some other uncouth method.  </p>

<p>ReasonsThe reason to choose Adobe Flex is that it compiles into a flash file that can run on any browser or any IDE via Adobe AIR. The other reason is that Flex allows for a very rich user experience.  </p>

<p>The reason to focus on Drools Rule Engine is that it&#39;s a leading open source Rules Engine and lacks in a sophisticated web based rule authoring UI.  </p>

 title : The Lilian - sequential data toolkit Open Source Project on Open Hub

 summary : <p>gconf-schema-editor was created to facilitate the creation and maintenance of schema files for gconf.</p>

<p>gconf schema files are used by Gnome programs to provide a default choice for program options stored in the gconf database.  They also serve to describe the structure of a particular gnome application&#39;s preferences tree.</p>

<p>gconf-schema-editor lets you dynamically manage these files, so no more long typing sessions.</p>

<p>This project is really only of interest to developers as end-users have little need (other than curiosity) to mess with pre-installed schema files.</p>

 title : The jeditor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>this is the light web editor,this&#39;s useful for web 2.0. </p>

<p>the demo url:jeditor demo </p>

<p>简要文档: </p>

<p>1.JEditor类构造方法参数:target,width,height; </p>

<p>target:为目标form表单元素 
<br/>width:为编辑区域宽度 
<br/>height:为编辑区域高度 </p>

<p>2.属性列表 </p>

<p>status:boolean类型,状态.如果为false,可能编辑器处于上传状态,请在表单提交前检查此状态 </p>

<p>3.方法列表 </p>

<p>setValue():设置初始化编辑区内的代码.必须为HTML代码. </p>

<p>getValue():返回编辑区内容. 
<br/>insertImage(src,width,height,align,alt):src为图片路径,width为图片宽度,height为图片高度,align为图片对齐方式,alt为图片的alt属性. 
<br/>insertText(str):在编辑器当前光标位置插入str字符串. 
<br/>insertHTML(html):在编辑器当前位置插入html代码. 
<br/>实例代码: </p>

<p> </p>

<p>var je = new JEditor(&#39;editor1&#39;,500,300); </p>

<p>je.setValue(&#39;testing&#39;);</p>

 title : The jitir-rich-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In this project, we have built several Ajax-based JITIR systems to help report writers. We have experimented with several different ways in which words and phrases from the users document are used to form search engine queries. </p>

<p>The idea of Just-in-Time Information Retrieval (JITIR) is to automatically retrieve useful information for a user based on the users current context; see, e.g., (Budzik and Hammond 1999; Rhodes 2000). The user typically shouldnt have to explicitly enter queries; rather, queries are automatically composed and submitted to a search engine based, e.g., on the content of the document that the user is currently editing. This means that there can be, e.g., a panel of of regularly refreshed search results that the user can consult, if he should wish to.  </p>

<p>Notice: The source code will be updated to GWT 1.7 in the coming few months and the application might deploy to GAE.</p>

 title : The macvim Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>MacVim is a port of the text editor Vim to Mac OS X. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>MacVim supports multiple windows with tabbed editing and a host of other features such as: </p>

<p>bindings to standard OS X keyboard shortcuts (⌘Z, ⌘V, ⌘A, ⌘G, etc.), transparent backgrounds, full-screen mode, multibyte editing with OS X input methods and automatic font substitution, ODB editor support, and more.  Most importantly, MacVim brings you the full power of Vim 7.2 to Mac OS X. </p>

<p>Note: MacVim is in no way connected with http://macvim.org.  That site is no longer being maintained and only provides outdated binaries of the old Carbon port of Vim. </p>

<p>Snow LeopardMacVim now builds as 64 bit by default on Snow Leopard (10.6).  I simplified the build process as well, so check out the Building wiki page on how to build your own binary. </p>

<p>The stable build seems to run fine on Snow Leopard, but please consider using a snapshot instead as they are built specifically for Snow Leopard (the snapshot also runs on Leopard). </p>

<p>DownloadThere are two official binaries of MacVim to choose from: </p>

<p>Stable: The latest stable release is MacVim 7.2 stable 1.2 which was released on the 21st of August 2008.  It is a universal binary which runs on Mac OS X 10.4 and 10.5.  Mac OS X 10.6 (&quot;Snow Leopard&quot;) seems to work fine as well but I strongly suggest using the latest snapshot build on Snow Leopard. Snapshot: A new snapshot is released every month or so and contains several features and bug-fixes which have not yet been included in the stable build.  The latest version can be downloaded here. If the download fails for some reason then try using the download mirror. </p>

<p>You may also build your own version from the source code.  Please consider contributing to the MacVim project if you are able. </p>

<p>MacVim is distributed free as charityware (type :h license inside MacVim for details).  If you find MacVim a useful addition to your life please consider helping needy children in Uganda. </p>

<p>Getting startedThe book A Byte of Vim is freely available online and is suitable for newcomers as well as more experienced users of Vim.  Another freely available online book is Vim Recipies which serves as a cookbook where you can look up different ways to perform a specific task. </p>

<p>There are also several Vim tutorials available online, such as this Vim introduction and tutorial.  Once familiar with the basics you may benefit from using the following article on Efficient Editing With Vim as a quick reference.  Before diving into all that material, you may want to read the article &quot;Why use Vim?&quot; which dispels common misconceptions about Vim and also provides examples which illustrate some of its many features. </p>

<p>Vim comes bundled with a tutor which can be quite helpful to go through since it encourages you to experiment as you read. At the moment it requires some trickery to get going, but once there it should be easy to follow.  The tutor is a text file which needs to be copied to a folder where it can be modified.  To copy the tutor to your home folder, open MacVim and type (make sure you are in normal mode first by hitting Esc): </p>

<p>:!cp $VIMRUNTIME/tutor/tutor ~/then hit enter. This will place a file named tutor in your home folder.  Now, to start the tutor simply open that file in MacVim, e.g. by pressing ⌘O to show the file open dialog and then browsing to the tutor file. </p>

<p>How to get helpThere is a fairly active mailing list called vim_mac where you can post questions about MacVim and request new features. Before posting a question, you should consult the FAQ, search the vim_mac archives, and consult the built-in Vim help by typing :h macvim inside MacVim. </p>

<p>Since the binary releases always are a couple of versions behind the source code it is also possible that any problems you encounter may already have been fixed.  Check the change log for the latest updates to the source code. </p>

<p>Help me!If you find a bug, then please file an Issue report but first make sure that it has not already been reported by searching for old Issues. Unless you are absolutely sure that you have really found a bug you should probably post a question on the vim_mac mailing list first. (Note that there are several people answering questions on the mailing list whereas there is only one of me responding to Issue reports.)</p>

 title : The mighty-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Mighty: The Managed/Mini IDEMighty has suffered bitrot from long neglect. Will be rewriting from scratch, shortlyUseful StuffFAQ License RoadMap IntroductionThe original use case for Mighty is best illustrated by the following user story: </p>

<p>As a programmer who happens to own an Asus Eee PC, I want a lightweight code editor (e.g. low real-estate grabbing ala scribes or notepad++) with intellisense-style code completion and discoverability/exploratory functionality so that I can do some meaningful .Net h4xing in a loonix environment. </p>

<p>One of the most liberating things for me, as a .Net programmer, is the fact that modern .Net IDEs (VS2005+, #dev, MonoDevelop) have decent code-completion/intellisense via reflection/real-time code parsing. How much less time do you spend not having to look at API documentation since starting to program in this environment? Don&#39;t you wish there was a code editor with this functionality but without the resource/screen-size requirements of these environments (for me, a multi-monitor setup is a must because these IDEs have so much crap in them) existed? </p>

<p>Mono&#39;s WinForms implementation has finally matured to the point that it is feasible to implement a real, useful and cross-platform managed code editor so that, finally, .Net programmers won&#39;t be chained to a handful of screen-real-estate-hungry IDEs in order to be able to do useful (read: has intellisense/code completion capabilities) development. </p>

<p>Mighty aims to be that editor.</p>

<br/>  var elem = document.getElementById(this.f);

<br/>  }
<br/>}

<br/> var elem = document.getElementById(this.f + &#39;_title&#39;);

<br/>   elem.innerHTML = gadgets.util.escape(title);

 title : The ryijy Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ryijy Stitch DesignerFinnishOhjelma auttaa kuvan muuttamisessa ryijyn tai ristipistotyön suunnitelmaksi. Ohjelmalla voi pienentää kuvan resoluutiota ja vähentää värejä yksinkertaisen käyttöliittymän avulla. Lopullisen kuvan voi tallentaa tai tulostaa värikartan kanssa. Ristipisto-ohjelma -toiminnot rajoittuvat toistaiseksi ruutumallin luontiin kuvasta ja pieneen muokkaamiseen sekä tulostamiseen värien ja symboleiden kanssa. <p>EnglishSimple free software for helping to design a pattern for rya rug or cross stitch from an image. Program allows cropping and resizing the image as well as reducing and replacing colors. Image conversion uses smart color reduction algorithm to use as few colors as possible. Final image can be printed or saved to file with grid or color map. Also own color palettes from DMC colors or from images are supported. </p>

<p>Features: </p>

<p>Resize and crop image Reduced color palette selection: RGB, DMC or own custom palette Own thread palette New color palette creation from images  Automatic or manual color reduction Drawing with palette color to the image Printing and saving with grid, color map and symbols Contrast and saturation adjustment </p>

<p>Requirements: </p>

<p>Windows 7, Vista or Windows XP .NET Framework 2.0 (on Windows XP)</p>

 title : The simple-map-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The srl-editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionSRL (Simple rule language) is a regular expression based language developed to perform fact extraction from plain text. It is designed to operate as a two stage process by firstly extracting a set of predefined entity classes (named entity recognition) and then using these entities to fill in template slots using contextual rules. As an example, SRL is currently being used in the BioCaster project at the National Institute of Informatics for identifying disease outbreaks and their locations from news reports. </p>

<p>One of the key objectives of SRL has been to enable domain experts to develop their own lightweight text mining systems with minimal support from linguists and computer scientists. SRL uses a powerful yet easy-to-understand regular expression language designed specifically for handling tokenized text streams. SRL rules are often written using a simple combination of string literals and word classes (such as a list of country names) to define the matching context. If complexity is required the rules can easily incorporate constraints based on approximate matching, orthography, word distance etc.  The SRL Editor, written in platform independent Java, supports user design of SRL rule sets using a graphic user interface (GUI) aiming for rapid development and test cycles.  </p>

<p>The SRL Editor aims to supply built in support for hand-crafted rule testing and revision, e.g. to find text segments where no rules are matching or to find rules which do not match any text. To enable fast creation and evaluation of rules the SRL editor allows the user to attach a corpus to the rule set, so that all matching contexts to a rule can be found rapidly and the user can instantly see if the rule is useful and correct. Future versions will aim to support improved rule revision mechanisms based on statistical metrics.  </p>

<p>Once SRL rule sets have been developed it is possible to run these in command-line mode on un-indexed text collections.  </p>

<p>DownloadsSRL is available for download here: Version 1.0 Release Candidate 1 </p>

<p>DocumentationThe SRL Manual is available here </p>

<p>A brief video introduction is available and can be downloaded here. There is also a complete description of the language. </p>

<p>For those who wish to use SRL as a library within their own projects there is an introduction to the structure of the SRL library, a code example and the Java-Doc generated documentation. </p>

<p>Language SupportTokenization for languages other than English is supported through Lucene, including: Portuguese, Chinese, Czech, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Russian and we are working to include improved algorithms for Thai and Japanese.</p>

 title : The 2iv35-2008-2009 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The 3d-heart-simulation Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The package was written to explore the electrical wave propagation in a minimally realistic fiber architecture model of the left ventricle (LV). Experimental results (C. Eyster, 1957) indicate a nested, layered geometry for the fiber surfaces of the left ventricle, where fiber directions are approximately aligned in each surface and gradually rotate throughout the thickness of the ventricle. Numerical and analytical results have highlighted the importance of this rotating anisotropy and its possible destabilizing role on the dynamics of scroll waves in excitable media with application to the heart. Motivated by a first principles derivation by Peskin (Peskin, 1989) of the anisotropic diffusion tensor of the LV wall, we implemented a minimally realistic model of the left ventricle that adequately captures the geometry and anisotropic properties of the heart as a conducting medium while being easily parallelizable and computationally more tractable than fully realistic anatomical models. Studies using such a minimal model are complementary to fully realistic and anatomically-based computational approaches, allowing the addition of successively realistic features, thereby providing unique insight into the basic mechanisms of formation and obliteration of electrical wave instabilities.</p>
 summary : <p>the source code and simulation file of mcu development board from http://www.51embed.com.</p>

 title : The ahkab Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A SPICE-like electronic circuit simulator and library written in Python.</p>

<p>Supported simulations: </p>

<p>Numeric simulations:
<br/>- Operating point, with guess computation to speed up the solution.
<br/>- DC analysis.
<br/>- AC analysis.
<br/>- Transient analysis, available differentiation formulas: implicit Euler, trapezoidal, gear orders from 2 to 5
<br/>- Periodic steady state analysis of non-autonomous circuits, time domain shooting and brute-force algorithms. 
<br/>- Pole-Zero.</p>

<br/>- small signal analysis
<br/>- extraction of transfer functions and singularities</p>

 title : The artificial-morphogenesis Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome to the artificial morphogenesis project.  </p>

<p>This software was started by Oliver Winks whilst working on his PhD at the University of Sussex. The software is a basic 2D simulation of differential genetic networks and cellular development, it is designed to be flexible and extendible so that it can be used in as many projects as possible related to artificial morphogenesis. At the moment it is very simple, but as it is extended for the various projects I will undertake throughout the course of my PhD it will hopefully become a very useful (not just to me but others as well!) tool. </p>

 title : The asrs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ASRS - Adaptive Swarm Robots SimulationOverviewThe ASRS was created and designed in a graduation project for the Computer Engineering course at CUFSA - Faculdade de Engenharia Engenheiro Celso Daniel located at Santo Andre, SP, Brazil. The project&#39;s main objective is to develop a component embedding computational swarm adaptive capabilities for behavioral control and decision taking, that can be used together with real robots and its simulation as well. In the first stage, the component is going to be used together with a simulation program. In later steps, tests using real robots will take place.   </p>

<p>Breve Simulation EnvironmentA 3D open source simulation environment for multi-agent systems. </p>

 title : The aurorarnm Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Aurora Road Network ModelerAurora Road Network Modeler (RNM) is a set of tools for operational planning and management of travel corridors (road networks comprised of freeways and surrounding urban arterials) and analysis of their performance. It is based on the Aurora Object-Oriented Framework for Simulation and Analysis of Flow Networks and is implemented in Java. </p>

<p>Currently, Aurora RNM consists of three modules. </p>

<p> Simulator is a graphical application with interactive user interface that runs traffic simulations on road networks. Traffic flow and density are computed using the macroscopic Cell Transmission Model. It also computes such traffic characteristics as speed, VMT, VHT, delay and productivity loss and generates flow, density and speed contour plots making it convenient to compare with the real traffic data collected by systems such as PeMS. The user can create simulation scenarios by means of events that change user-specified configuration parameters of the road network at user-specified times.  Configurator is a graphical application with interactive user interface whose purpose is to produce XML configuration files for the Simulator. It can be used to build road networks from scratch; edit existing road networks by deleting or reassigning network components or adding new network components; efficiently provision road parameters such as fundamental diagrams and split ratios; and input demand profiles.  GIS Importer is a graphical application with interactive user interface that extracts road information from the GIS .shp and .dbf files and saves it in the XML format of Aurora configuration file. This configuration file can be refined in the Configurator and then used by the Simulator. It is recommended to use GIS Importer together with the open source OpenJUMP software used for geometric filtering of GIS data.</p>
 title : The eXperto Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Sistema de punto de venta, CRM y ERP., </p>
 title : The basketball-gm Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The overall goal of this project is to create a sports simulation game like Baseball Mogul, but make it free, cross platform, and about basketball. </p>

<p>An auxiliary goal is for me to learn some new things (Python, GTK, Glade, SQLite).  So, the code might not be the greatest and development might be a little slow because I am a beginner in all of those technologies.  But I am trying :) </p>

<p>Send an email to dumbmatter at gmail if you think this project sounds interesting. </p>

<p>2008-08-08: Version 0.1 is released.  Try it out.  If you think it looks interesting and you can code, email me.  There are a lot of things that can be improved. </p>

<p>2008-08-03: All the goals for 0.1 are now complete except for the trade AI and a little bit of polish.  Expect a release later this month. </p>

<p>2008-07-27: Right now I am working towards an 0.1 release that will include basic functionality, but the AI will be weak, the UI won&#39;t be polished, etc.  But it will be a good framework to test and build on.  The only major components left are finances (ticket and TV revenue, etc.), trades (UI is there but AI is not), and playoffs.  But if you checkout the latest source, it should run on most Linux distros and do everything except the three things I just mentioned, if you want to play around with it.  Regular season, roster management, free agents, draft, stats... all that stuff is in some rudimentary working form.</p>

 title : The bell407 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The biocity Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Important: I am moving to Sourceforge. Check out the new website. I&#39;ll keep this old page up for a while, however. </p>

<p>This is a simulation program written in C++ and meant for studying populations that follow rules. It can be though of as a continuous analog to Conway&#39;s game of life, in a rough sense. </p>

<p>Organisms are objects in the computer&#39;s memory and they can move around and interact, grow and die. There are many possibilities for studying ecology and evolution, as well as artificial intelligence. </p>

<p>The user interface is extremely minimal and knowledge of C++ is required for meaningful work that differs from the programming that it so far contains. </p>

<p>Please be aware that it is in prelease mode, and while the source code is available, there is no instruction at the moment on how to use it. I shall rectify this situation in due time. In the mean time if you need more information, please email me. Thus, it is not meant to be used by anyone at the current time. If you&#39;d like to try you&#39;re more than welcome, of course. </p>

<p>For now, check out the YouTube Video of it in action. Sorry for the low quality! </p>

<p>NewsSunday, April 20, 2008: Added the option to turn graphics on or off in the configuration file: &quot;graphics: 0&quot; is off, &quot;graphics: 1&quot; is on. </p>

<p>Also I want to move this page to Sourceforge so I can have more control over the website. I submitted my request today. </p>

<p>Want To Help?Are you interested in modelling biology with computer simulation? I am inviting all such individuals to email me at: </p>

<p>automorphism (at) gmail (dot) com </p>

<p>If interested in being a volunteer developer for this project. The project is coded in C++ and is kept in a git repository. Git is not hard to learn if you&#39;re willing, though. You don&#39;t even have to know how to program, as I am also looking for beta testers, especially for other operating systems. Some of the immediate goals of this project are: </p>

<p>Easy configuration of different environments Plugin type interface for defining new environment rules Good documentation Lots of testing on other systems Thanks to the kind people (particularly Petr Baudis) at repo.or.cz, anyone can now fetch a copy of the git master branch of this project (updated frequently) by using this command: </p>

<p>git clone git://repo.or.cz/biocity.git </p>

<p>Or through the slower http protocol: </p>

<p>http://repo.or.cz/r/biocity.git </p>

<p>See summary page.</p>

 title : The boxfish Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Boxfish is a web-based application that allows you to create a sort of visual spreadsheet where each value is represented by a box and is movable inside a sheet. A document, called docbox, can have many sheets, called sheetboxes; inside each sheetbox you can define values, called unitboxes. A unitbox can be static, i.e. string or number, or dynamic, i.e. expression or range. When your docbox has been created, you can &quot;animate&quot; its values through the timeline instrument, synchronized with the range and expression unitboxes. In the timeline you can define events at fixed time, every n steps or random. Everything your docbox must do is defined inside a XML file.</p>

 title : The cjlibrarycs4 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>CJLibrary CS4 contains many useful ActionScript 3.0 APIs for Flash CS4 and Flex SDK 4. </p>

<p>Files with .as3proj extension are ActionScript 3.0 projects that should be opened with FlashDevelop 3. </p>

<p>There&#39;s also a Google Group for discussion about CJLibrary CS4: http://groups.google.com/group/cjlibrary-general </p>

<p>Documentation </p>

<p>How to check out the latest source files from the SVN repository </p>

<p>The Emitter Particle FX engine is now an individual project </p>

<p>Go to the Emitter project homepage </p>

<p>CJLibrary CS4 includes: </p>

<p>CJMath - Mathametical shortcuts and common functions. CJUtils - Common Array operations. Symbol Base Classes (idv.cjcat.display) - Useful symbol base classes and document classes. Carousel (idv.cjcat.display.carousel) - 2.5D carousel engine. FSMachine (idv.cjcat.fsm) - Finite state machine. DynaShape (idv.cjcat.display.dynashape) - Dynamic shape drawing API. Shapes (idv.cjcat.display.shapes) - Common basic shapes with adjustable parameters. ZSorter (idv.cjcat.display.zsorter) - Z-depth sorting utilities based on the new Flash 3D drawing API. Filters (idv.cjcat.filters) - Filter classes wrapped from PBJ (Pixel Bender Filter Byte Code File). Fenozix (idv.cjcat.physics.fenozix) - Simple 2D particle physics engine. And more... For those who wish to use idv.cjcat.utils.ByteArrayCodec to create your own filter class. </p>

<p>You&#39;ll need a PBJ (Pixel Bender Byte Code File) file. </p>

<p>Also, you have two options to obtain its PBJ String: </p>

<p>Using the PBJ String Generator, which can be found in the Downloads section. Using the idv.cjcat.utils.ByteArrayCodec class</p>

 title : The codificador-de-linha Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Codificador de Linha is an environment for the simulation of nine different line code (LC) algorithms. The LCs studied in this work are 2B1Q, 4B3T, AMI NRZ, AMI RZ, HDB3, Manchester (IEEE), Miller, Polar RZ and Unipolar NRZ. Each codification technic is applied to an input chain of fifteen bits provided by the user. As each input bit is specified, the resulting computation is shown in real time on the the software&#39;s user interface.  The Codificador de Linha was developed in the Java programming language. The Graphical User Interface for the application was implemented with the usage of the Java Swing technology.</p>

 title : The cpp-cooperation-evolution-gp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>C++, OpenGL, Genetic Programming, Cooperation, Distributed Systems, Emergence   </p>

<p>OverviewIn this project, a family is defined as a group of organisms that  behave in a similar manner. Each individual in a family is equipped with sensors, actuators and a mechanism for leaving markers that can be detected by the other  individuals in its family. Families are evaluated in a 2-dimensional  environment E, for a duration of t time units. At the beginning  of each evaluation run, the environment contains n particles of some collectible resource that needs to be gathered and  carried back a specific place (the drop). In the screenshot below,  the system is in its initial state. Each line in the list is  a program that specifies the behaviour of a single family of ant. None of these have been evaluated in the environment yet.  </p>

<p> </p>

<p>The goal is to evolve cooperative behavior that brings back 
<br/>a maximum amount of collectible to the drop site, starting 
<br/>from any randomly created environment. The behavior of
<br/>each individual in a family is specified by a typed program. </p>

<p>For example (from an individual organism&#39;s perspective):</p>

<p>(1) If I&#39;m carrying a resource particule, and I&#39;m at the drop off point, then I should
<br/>drop the resource. However, if I&#39;m carrying and I&#39;m not at the drop, then I should head
<br/>towards the drop, and on the way, I should drop flags that communicate to the other 
<br/>individuals of my family informations about the location of the remaining resource particles.</p>

<p>(2) If I&#39;m not carrying, then I should check to see if there is any collectables where 
<br/>I am. If there are, I should pick up one item. If there aren&#39;t, check and see if there are
<br/> collectibles within sensory perception field. If affirmative, go to location, otherwise
<br/>check for markers from other individuals, and follow the trail. If there are no
<br/> markers in sensory field, none move randomly.Every ant in a given family behaves the same way, but every family will code a different behavior. The best behaviors (see below for more on the objective function) will then be rewarded by having a higher chance of reappearing in the next round of evaluation. The example algorithm above is simple algorithm and seems to make sense. But is it really the best one? Does the manner by which ants use their capacity to produce and sense pheromones in that algorithm fully optimize the total gathering of food (team work). Might it not be more efficient if instead of carrying the food straight home, the ants dropped it on the way for other ants to pick up ? Or used a strategy that was more complicated ? </p>

<p>Crossover </p>

<p>The purpose of crossover is the production of a genetically diverse population of behaviors. Because each behavior is coded as a tree, it is imperative that the crossover operator that is used forces the production of syntactically valid offspring. </p>

<p>There are two ways of induring syntactic validity: either by reparing faulty trees that are produced by random crossover or setting rules of formation that prohibit the formation of faulty trees. </p>

<p>It is the second approach that was chosen for this task. The specification of the typed language called Antze that was used can be downloaded here is because during the evolution process In order to evolve behavior that were complicated, ....evolving valid program trees using type theory </p>

<p>The Language </p>

<p>$PICKUP: (ENV\xx ENVOBJECT)\xx ANT\rarr ENV\xx (ANT\xx ENVOBJECT)$
<br/>$DROP: ENV\xx (ANT\xx ENVOBJECT)-&gt;(ENV\xx ENVOBJECT)\xx ANT$
<br/>$MOVELEFT : (ENV\xx ANT)\rarr (ENV\xx ANT)$
<br/>$MOVEFRONT : (ENV\xx ANT)\rarr (ENV\xx ANT)$
<br/>$MOVERIGHT : (ENV\xx ANT)\rarr (ENV\xx ANT)$
<br/>$TURNRIGHT : ANT\rarr ANT$
<br/>$TURNLEFT : ANT\rarr ANT$
<br/>$PRODUCEPHEROMONE : ANT\rarr (ANT\xx ENVOBJECT)$
<br/>$SENSEPHEROMONE : (ENV\xx ANT)\rarr bool$
<br/>$SENSEFOOD : (ENV\xx ANT)\rarr bool$Each ant can only move forward, to the left or to the right. Likewise, an ant can only sense for food to its right, left or front. The environment is toroidal (north wraps to south and east wraps to west). The environment can do the following: </p>

<p>$GIVEOBJECT : ENV \rarr (ENV\xx ENVOBJECT)$
<br/>$ADDOBJECT: (ENV\xx ENVOBJECT)\rarr ENV$In order to avoid behavior evolution that overfits a specific environment, every time a new environment is created, the food distribution and quantity is different. There is no most efficient algorithm that applies to all the environments. </p>

<p>The Evaluation function </p>

<p>Each family is evaluated in E by the objective function Fg within tg time units. At the beginning of the run, E contains f0E units of food and ft-1E at the end. For each families, Fg returns a real value proportional to (ft-1E-f0E)/ nF where nF is the number of ants in the family. The population size (the number of families being evaluated) is \lambda </p>

<p>The Software: </p>

<p>The ants behavior is coded in a tree like structure called a CDNAStatement. These are program tree, but they also happen to represent the genotype of the ants. AntEvolver evolves CDNAStatements. It then evaluates each CDNAStatements using an objective function whose primary input is the amount of food a family of ants whose genotype is a particular CDNAStatement gathers. A fitness based non-deterministic selection process is then applied, a bit of mutation is shaked up in the mix and vodka. I mean voila. Using the software </p>

<p>There are three modes: </p>

<p>Ant Simulation mode </p>

<p>In this mode a CDNAStatement (program tree) can be seen in action in the environment. In this mode, the settings for the size of the environment grid and the number of ants can be set by choosing  View -&gt; Setting in the main menu. There is also a slider rule that allows the setting of the pheromonal strength. The  file-&gt;open/file-&gt;save features allows the opening and the saving of DNAStatement files (.ant extension). The Play button on the right toolbar will start the simulation, while the Pause button will pause it. When the simulation is paused, the indicator in the toolbar giving the amount of food left in the environment is updated (not while it is running). Make sure that the simulation is paused before changing any settings while a simulation is running. </p>

<p>The I button on the left toolbar (simulation should be paused) will reset the environment The Grid button on the left toolbar will toggle grid view The Pheromone View Button on the first Resizable bar will toggle pheromone Viewing · The G button on the left toolbar (simulation should be paused) will open DNAStatement in the Tree mode </p>

<p>Tree mode </p>

<p>In Tree mode, the CDNAStatement is displayed in a Tree View control. It can be edited by selecting the new statement and right clicking on the tree item that is to be replaced. Hitting the refresh tree button will then validate the new tree. Make sure the tree is refreshed after a compound else statement is introduced in the tree. </p>

<p>Evolve Mode </p>

<p>Creating a new GP is done by selecting File-&gt;New-&gt;Evolver on the main menu. To start the evolution of the GP, simply enter the generation number to which it should evolve in the EvolveTo edit box on the second top toolbar and press the play button. Each GP is represented as an entry in the main view, and double clicking on its ID number will open it in Tree Mode. When a GP is selected it can be either: </p>

<p>Saved as an ant file: File-&gt;save, Ant Simulated directly by pressing the Play Individual button (top toolbar) Viewed as a tree by double clicking on it.</p>

 summary : <p>Simulation of CPU  Scheduling Algorithm</p>

 summary : <p>CRANES (Context- &amp; Resource-Adaptive Network-Embedded Sensors) is an extension framework for the JiST/SWANS (Java in Simulation Time / Scalable Wireless Ad hoc Network Simulator) discrete event simulator and aims to provide a simulation framework for wireless sensor networks.  title : The cs6310-p2-team3 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Software architecture issues come into play when non-functional requirements force design trade-offs.  title : The csr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Le projet CSR(Conception de Systèmes Réactifs) a pour objectif de simuler des robots virtuels dans un environnement généré dynamiquement. </p>

<p>Chaque environnement incorpore une stargate, des clefs pour l&#39;ouvrir, des endroits de ravitaillement en carburant qui peuvent être piégés... et l&#39;objectif de chaque équipe de robots est de trouver les clefs et ouvrir la stargate. </p>

 title : The dhtest Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The Le Lièvre et la Tortue Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The digestive Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Google Code page for group 2, Simulation Engines. (Group Digestive, Interaction Design Methodology.) </p>

<p>To be able to compile the source </p>

<p>1. Download the latest version of the game </p>

<p>2. Copy &quot;bin&quot; and &quot;media&quot; from the OgreSDK into the &quot;Test&quot; folder. </p>

<p>Replace all EXCEPT the &quot;resources.cfg&quot; files in the &quot;debug&quot; and &quot;release&quot; folders. </p>

<p>3. Open the .sln file </p>

<p>4. Right-click project -&gt; properties -&gt; select debugging and under working directory,  </p>

<p>for all configurations, set the working directory to &quot;./bin/$(ConfigurationName)&quot; </p>

<p>The code should now be ready to compile. </p>

<p>To run precompiled game </p>

<p>1. Download and extract Pre-Compiled.rar </p>

<p>2. Go into /bin/release/ </p>

<p>3. double-click &quot;Test.exe&quot; </p>

<p>4. Play. </p>

<p>How to play </p>

<p>Use W,S,A,D, up, down left, right arrows to control the camera, one can rotate by using Q and E. </p>

<p>Choose camera by pressing C, pressing many times toggles the different modes. There is free camera and ship camera to select between. If ship camera is selected then the controls apply to the ship and not the camera. </p>

<p>A black hole can be added by pressing B, however upon doing this the game ends and the game have to be restarted in order to play again. </p>

<p>NOTES </p>

<p>Due to some coding the last few hours a bug was encountered in the sound system. If the game is run from inside visual studio, as either debug or release, then it works nice. However, if the pre-compiled is run, then the sounds appear choppy and lacks both 3d spatilization and attenuation the sound also appear to run &quot;faster&quot;. We had no time to locate this bug and sincerly appologizes for any inconvenience. </p>

<p>UPDATE: </p>

<p>The reason to it sounding so bad in precompiled mode is most probably that the a.i planes starts and stops their motors very very many times per second, creating that high pitched noise. If the lines under </p>

<p>SimulationGameState.cpp -&gt; SimulationGameState::setupScene() -&gt; under &quot;crazy Ai test&quot; </p>

<p>if those two lines are commented out then the sound should work properly. </p>

<p>The code had been updated however we have noticed a considerable variation in quality on different computers. If there is a problem with the sound even inside visual studio then one might change the following line to increase quality, however, even this depends on the drivers and the type of your soundcard so try and see what works best. </p>

<p>Change:  In SoundManager.cpp -&gt; SoundManager::Init() -&gt; mSoundDevice = alcOpenDevice( NULL ) </p>

<p>to either mSoundDevice = alcOpenDevice( &quot;Generic Hardware&quot; ); </p>

<p>or mSoundDevice = alcOpenDevice( &quot;Generic Software&quot; ); </p>

<p>The sound works on both my laptop and my home computer, however it does not work on some of the other members computers. If there is some trouble then email me and I&#39;ll se what I can do. Worst case is that it dont work at all, and in that case ill bring my laptop and give you a demonstation. This only further emphasises the fact that openAL is a lesser sound system compaired to others.</p>

 title : The drkarnaugh Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The dylab Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is part of a larger project called DyLab, which offers a component based system for testing and prototyping soft tissue models on an ordinary PC and also for rapid development of new applications belonging especially to the area of organ and organ system simulators. </p>

<p>The whole system consists of three layers:  DyLab framework,  Dylab components and  DyLab applications,  all highly configurable with simple text configuration files. </p>

<p>This subproject provides the platform independent framework, which defines interfaces for components and provides funcionality for their integration and cooperation. The framework is based on thread-safe operations, so it can be easily integrated into a multi-threaded environment. </p>

<p>The project DyLab is implemented using the C++ language and it was compiled and tested only on Windows platform, so far. However, it was designed with support for other platforms in mind as well.</p>
 title : The BoB Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>BoB is an IRC bot written in c# for the .net framework.  It provides the basic requirements for maintaining an IRC connection and the associated data.  The functionality can be extended via plugins written in any .net enabled language.</p>
 title : The dylab-modules Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project is part of a larger project called DyLab, which offers a component based system for testing and prototyping soft tissue models on an ordinary PC and also for rapid development of new applications belonging especially to the area of organ and organ system simulators. </p>

<p>The whole system consists of three layers:  DyLab framework, Dylab components and  DyLab applications, all highly configurable with simple text configuration files. </p>

<p>This subproject provides a set of re-usable components, which are orginezed in the modules (DLL files on Windows platform). They implement some behaviour, technique or driver. Certain combination of these components can be used to simulate almost any scenario.  </p>

<p>The project DyLab is implemented using the C++ language and it was compiled and tested only on Windows platform, so far. However, it was designed with support for other platforms in mind as well.</p>
 title : The SpikeCluster Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Matlab-based software for clustering neurophysiological data.  Includes a modular architecture for incorporating algorithms/data formats, methods for comparing and characterizing automated algorithms and visualization/validation tools.</p>
 title : The e170-microbial-simulation Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>function hw9 </p>

<p>%E170 Homework 9 Group Project %The following model uses six matices, N1OLD, N2OLD, N3OLD, N1NEW, N2NEW %and N3NEW to hold the population information. The Old matrices hold the population density %until a complete New matrix is calculated </p>

<p>%Flow Chart %Step1 Zero OLD and NEW matrices. %Step2 Set initial conditions and boundary conditions. %Step3 Calculate number of new individuals, place them into NEW arrays %Step4 Use Gaussian model to distribute new individuals in NEW matrices %Step5 Add the NEW matrices to the OLD matrices and zero the New matrices %Step6 Take population information for selected points. %Step7 Update time.  (End of time loop)(Return to Step3) </p>

<p>%Variables TMAX=10;           %TMAX is the maximum time (sec) M=1000;            %M is the number of time increments DT=TMAX/M;         %DT is the time increment (sec)   N=19;              %NxN is the cell matrix DX=10/N;           %DX is the length of the side of a cell                    N10=1;             %Initial N1 population for populated cells N20=1;             %Initial N2 population for populated cells N30=1;             %Initial N3 population for populated cells g1=2; g2=-0.5; r1=2; r2=1.2; p12=0.3; p21=-1.5; p31=0.7; p32=0.5; </p>

<p>N1OLD=zeros(N,N);    %Step1.  Initialize the P matrices.  These will contain the populations of N1NEW=zeros(N,N);    %each cell N1(x,y,t), N2(x,y,t)and N3(x,y,t).  Generally, the OLD matriceswill hold information N2OLD=zeros(N,N);    %for t, while the New matrices willhold information for t+1 N2NEW=zeros(N,N); N3OLD=zeros(N,N); N3NEW=zeros(N,N); N1PLOT=zeros(M); N2PLOT=zeros(M); N3PLOT=zeros(M); T=zeros(M); </p>

<p>G=zeros(N,N);       %Precalulate G for i=1:N </p>

<p>for j=1:N 
<br/>G(i,j)=0.5;                                     %for problem 2 
<br/>%G=cos(((i-1)/19)pi/2)sin(((j-1)/19)pi)      %for Problem 3 etc 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>%Step 2:  Initial Condition: Populate N1, N2 and N3 into OLD matrices 
<br/>                    for i=1:N;          %Initial Population for N3 </p>

<p>for j=1:N; 
<br/>N3OLD(i,j)=N30; 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>for i=1:10;          %Initial Population for N1 </p>

<p>for j=1:10; 
<br/>N1OLD(i,j)=N10; 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>for i=5:19;          %Initial Population for N2 </p>

<p>for j=5:19; 
<br/>N2OLD(i,j)=N20; 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>for k=1:M;         %time loop     %Step 3.  Calculate new individuals %Initially we will use Eulers %Later, we will implement RK4                     for i=1:N </p>

<p>for j=1:N 
<br/>%  we would insert the growth coefficient equation here 
<br/>N1=N1OLD(i,j); 
<br/>N2=N2OLD(i,j); 
<br/>N3=N3OLD(i,j); 
<br/>N1NEW(i,j)=DT(g1*N1-N1*p12*N2-r1*N1*N1/N3); 
<br/>N2NEW(i,j)=DT(g2*N2-N2*p21*N1-r2*N2*N2/N3); 
<br/>N3NEW(i,j)=DT(G(i,j)-N3(p31*N1+p32*N2));              
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>%Step 4 
<br/>%Use Gaussian model to redistribute new individuals into the 
<br/>%NEW matrices 
<br/>%Only positive values should be distributed 
<br/>                                        </p>

<p>%Step 5 
<br/>%  Add New Matrices to OLD matrices 
<br/>%  zero New matrices 
<br/>                for i=1:N for j=1:N 
<br/>N1OLD(i,j)=N1OLD(i,j)+N1NEW(i,j); 
<br/>N2OLD(i,j)=N2OLD(i,j)+N2NEW(i,j); 
<br/>N3OLD(i,j)=N3OLD(i,j)+N3NEW(i,j); 
<br/>N1NEW(i,j)=0; 
<br/>N2NEW(i,j)=0; 
<br/>N3NEW(i,j)=0; 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>N1PLOT(k)=N1OLD(10,10);             %Capture data at x=10,y=10 for each time increment N2PLOT(k)=N2OLD(10,10); N3PLOT(k)=N3OLD(10,10); </p>

<p>end                % end of time loop (k) </p>

<p>%Plotting Varibles     %Build T,xx,yy arrays needed for plotting 
<br/>for i=1:M   
<br/>T(i)=DT*i; 
<br/>end 
<br/>    </p>

<p>for i=1:N 
<br/>for j=1:N 
<br/>xx(i,j)=i*DX; 
<br/>yy(i,j)=j*DX; 
<br/>end 
<br/>end </p>

<p>%Plot surface plot of steady state densities for problem 4 
<br/>    %plot3(xx,yy,N1OLD) %title(&#39;Prey Population&#39;)     %plot3(xx,yy,N2OLD) %title(&#39;Predator Population&#39;)     %plot3(xx,yy,N3OLD) %title(&#39;Resource Population&#39;)     %We need labels and titles </p>

<p>%Plot time history of all species at x=10, y=10 for problem 5 
<br/>    subplot(3,1,1);  plot(T, N1PLOT); subplot(3,1,2);  plot(T, N2PLOT); subplot(3,1,3);  plot(T, N3PLOT); %we need labels and titles       </p>

<p>%following is old code as a model </p>

<p>%Capture plotting data Step 5 
<br/>%subplot(3,1,1:2) 
<br/>%plot3(xx,yy,POLD); </p>

<p>%xlabel(&#39;meters&#39;) 
<br/>%ylabel(&#39;meters&#39;) 
<br/>%zlabel(&#39;pollution density in kg/m^2&#39;) 
<br/>%subplot(3,1,3) 
<br/>%plot(T(1:i),MON(1:i)) 
<br/>%F(i)= getframe; 
<br/>%Plotting Outputs </p>

<p>%movie(F) </p>

<p>%plot3(xx,yy,POLD) </p>

<p>end             %end of function</p>

Ephi is being developed by an amateur. For more information please see http://www.mare.ee/indrek/ephi/</p>

 title : The fleet-command Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Fleet Command is a game engine for powering massive multiplayer online economy and combat simulation games. It features: </p>

<p>Races: predefined races can be created, or players can be given the possibility to contribute their own race. Buildings: players can construct cities, military bases, etc. Vehicles: vehicles can be used for transportation, warfare, etc. Components: requirements for constructing buildings and vehicles. Resources: resources are needed for making components, feeding the population, running vehicles, etc. Organisations: players can unite themselves into organisations, granting them a better chance for success. Research: a research tree can be defined unlocking new components or organisational possibilities. Maps: players will be able to navigate and build in 3-dimensional maps. Trading: Resources, vehicles and buildings can be traded with other players. Communication: Communication between your outposts, vehicles and other players requires infrastructure. Intelligence: Finding other players and gathering information on them requires infrastructure.</p>

 title : The gladiatus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>For those who cannot read Vietnamese, please visit our wiki: http://code.google.com/p/gladiatus/w/list </p>

<p>Ngày tàn của Ma GiáoBuổi tiệc nào cũng sẽ tàn, guild Ma Giao hôm nay lên đây để ra mắt các bạn cũng như là để được nói những lời cuối cùng với anh chị em chơi ở S1 nói riêng và cộng đồng chơi Gladiatus ở Viet Nam :D </p>

<p>Lời đầu tiên xin gửi đến anh chị em là: Kô &quot;chít&quot;, nếu kô, bạn sẽ bị &quot;chít&quot; :)) Dịch word-by-word sang English là: Do not cheat, otherwise you will be dead :)) </p>

<p>Đúng vậy, hầu như những thành viên của Ma Giao mà là &quot;nightmare&quot; của những bé cùi mía nay đã bị banned... Từ nay về sau, các bạn sẽ ko còn có cơ hội để bị... gõ nữa Happy Có trách thì trách tại sao Sở Lưu Hương kô nương tay :)).. Hi vọng các bạn sẽ dần quên những cái nick như: quocvu, none, Mig, instcode, golem, btnguyen, iam_valkyrie, Tomato... và ráng cày bừa để có thể bụp những kẻ thù còn sót lại của chính mình... </p>

<p>Nhân đây, những ai thường xuyên bị instcode gõ thì cũng đừng buồn, nếu mình kô gõ thì cũng có người khác gõ thôi :)) </p>

<p>Gladiatus HelperTiếp theo, đây là phần thú vị nhất mà các bạn chắc chắn nhiều bạn sẽ quan tâm... Đó là toàn bộ những &quot;in-house&quot; softwares của guild Ma Giao được phát triển trong suốt quá trình chơi gladiatus nay sẽ công bố cho anh em sử dụng, hoàn toàn miễn phí và... at your own risk :))... </p>

<p>Bộ tools này bao gồm: </p>

<p>Gladiatus Helper (easy arena, easy training, battle simulation, auction timer, market buying...) Gladiatus Automatic Bots (auto training, auto attacking, auto protection...) Các bạn có thể vào ngay địa chỉ: http://gladiatus.googlecode.com/svn để download ngay những gì có thể download được... Nhưng để chạy được thì các bạn cần theo những giới thiệu và hướng dẫn trong bài tiếp... </p>

<p>Project Home: http://gladiatus.googlecode.com </p>

<p>Giới thiệu:1. Gladiatus Helper:Đây là bộ scripts ở client (web browser) nhằm hỗ trợ người chơi có những chức năng hữu hiệu trong quá trình chơi gladiatus, gồm những module sau: </p>

<p>Overview: Xem thử chỉ số của mình hiện giờ là ra sao, xem chỉ số của những người khác hiện giờ ra sao... Arena: Simulate thử xem mình có khả năng thắng một chiến binh khác bao nhiêu %, damage họ gây cho mình khoảng bao nhiêu, mình gây cho họ bao nhiêu damage... Market: Xem tỉ lệ food bán ở chợ là bao nhiêu tiền trên 1 đơn vị máu để mua food với giá rẻ nhất có thể... Auction: Xem thời gian còn lại của auction là bao nhiêu (chính xác đến từng giây Big Grin )... Quest: Xem mình đang cần phải làm công việc gì, thời gian công việc còn lại là bao nhiêu, tự động lấy quest mới... </p>

<p>2. Automatic Bots:Training Bot: Tự động lựa đi training ở mức đơn giản, luôn giữ cho số expedition point còn lại ko vượt quá số lượng tối đa, tự động chăn ngựa ngủ nghỉ, tự động nâng cấp những basic stats khi có đủ tiền, tự động nhậ̣n quest... Attacker Bot: Tự động gõ một player bao nhiều lần trên ngày :D, tự động gõ 1 player mỗi giờ rồi chăn ngựa... Ghi chú: Những ứng dụng trên sử dụng một loạt các Bot APIs để viết, các bạn hoàn toàn có thể xem những API hiện có trong GladiatusBot.py để tự viết ra bot mới. </p>

<p>3. Tiểu sử:Ban đầu, instcode sau khi google &quot;gladiatus helper&quot;, hắn đã tìm ra 1 greasemonkey script rất đơn giản để xem simulation cho 1 trận đấu sử dụng trang gladiatus simulator (mà bây giờ là http://playerutils.com/), vậy là hắn ta bắt đầu bưng về cho anh em để họ tìm cách mổ xẻ và để phát triển tiếp... Dẫn đầu bởi btnguyen, bộ 3 người gồm thêm none và iam_valkyrie đã liên tục chửi cái greasemonkey script ở trên ghẻ và đã xoá nó hoàn toàn, những gì còn sót lại chỉ là ý tưởng... Thế là Gladiatus Helper ra đời version đầu tiên... Trong giai đoạn này, btnguyen liên tục add những killer features như &quot;múc&quot; link, character overview, training timer, arena timer... mà tồn tại cho đến bây giờ... Shortcut links để training và quest description/rewards đánh dấu sự xuất hiện của instcode trong Gladiatus Helper, nhưng tiếc thay phần HTML/javascript code của anh đã bị chửi thậm tệ và đã bị thay thế hoàn toàn bởi none... instcode dần dần mất bóng trong những release tiếp theo của Gladiatus Helper... Và rồi chuyện gì đến cũng đã đến, btnguyen cho ra trang AuctionWatcher mà hiện giờ đang nằm trong phần trang chủ của guild Ma Giao, nhưng đáng tiếc là crontab có resolution quá lớn cho nên helper này lệch giờ đấu giá cả núi :D.. Bực mình, none nhà ta đã ra tay và viết ngay một cái auction watcher rồi tích hợp vào trong Gladiatus Helper... Version 0.4.0 ra đời ở server chính làm trang web gladiatus simulator ngừng hoạt động, instcode ngay lập tức nhảy vào để viết lại phần simulator và cho nó online ở Google App Engine: http://gladiatus-helper.appspot.com/ Tomato requested chức năng tự động nhận quest, iam_valkyrie ngay lập tức xông vào ngoáy ngoáy những dòng code, thế là một cái chức năng tự động nhận quest đã ra đời dù bug cả đống mà sau này instcode phải sửa lại :D Tối tối, anh em ra chợ mua food về nhậu, vậy là instcode đã ra tay viết phần Market Food, nhằm mua food với giá rẻ nhất... Thế là anh lao vào sửa Gladiatus Helper, nhìn đống code như đống rừng, anh lập tức refactor lại đẹp đẽ trước khi chèn thêm 1 module Easy Market như bây giờ... Ngày qua ngày, instcode liên tục bị bọn ác mạnh hơn gõ (điển hình trong giai đoạn này là những bác ở guild LOL: Halama, Togan và nguong), mỗi lần anh mất cả xô máu... Thế là anh đã nghĩ cách viết 1 auto protection bot nhằm hạn chế tang thương... Và rồi anh em trong guild Ma Giao vì cơm áo gạo tiền, nên phải làm việc, từng &quot;nhân vật&quot; của họ bị bỏ bê kô ai chăm sóc... instcode một lần nữa ra tay và làm tiếp phần &quot;auto training bot&quot; nhằm hỗ trợ anh em trong những lúc kô đi cùng nhân vật mình được... Version 0.4.0 ra đời ở server Vietnam hầu như giết hết khá nhiều features của Gladiatus Helper, mặc dù vậy, phần simulator vẫn được updated... Và bùuuuuummmmmmmmm.... Hầu như mọi account đã bị banned, thế là Gladiatus Helper và Gladiatus Automatic Bots bây giờ đã được public ở đây!...  Các bạn có thể tham khảo wiki để biết cách cài đặt và sử dụng: </p>

<p>Vietnamese: http://code.google.com/p/gladiatus/wiki/InstallationVietnamse English (đầy đủ hơn): http://code.google.com/p/gladiatus/wiki/Installation </p>

<p>P/S: Nếu ai có khả năng và muốn phát triển tiếp để sử dụng hoặc cung cấp cho cộng đồng, xin gửi mail về instcode at gmail dot com, mình sẽ hỗ trợ trong khả năng có thể.  </p>

<p>Khuyến khích các bạn phổ biến bộ scripts và tools này cho những người chơi Gladiatus, và xin các bạn tôn trọng bản quyền của tụi mình! Cám ơn! </p>

GridMe  is implemented in Java as a set of plugins for the Eclipse platform. This can greatly simplify modeling tasks for non-programmers and improve overall experience with the environment. A typical usage scenario of the GridMe system can be described as following: </p>

GridSweeper, an open-source project begun during Summer of Code 2006, will provide scientists with a straightforward interface for running simulation batches.</p>

 title : The hobbes-engine Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Lemmings ProjectThe Lemmings Project aims to evolve cultures of social critters. Our aim is to investigate hypotheses about evolution, cultural diversification, feedback loops between culture and environment, the evolutionary importance of niches and subcultures, and ultimately the factors that enable self-organization. </p>

<p># That there is a recurrence relation tying environment and culture. # Neither culture nor environment can ever converge upon a permanently stable state until the environment is exhausted. # Cultural Diversity derives directly from local environmental differences. Homogenization of factors across localities reduces diversity (e.g. diffusion of a factor across the entire environment will wipe out any diversity in cultural features sensitive to that factor). # After a dramatic event, the time to stabilize on a new population is an exponential function of the proximity of the environmental perturbation to the bottom of the cultural feature stack. (e.g. very fundamental disruptions will cause a much larger portion of the species-space to be explored). </p>

<p>Species: a set of features.</p>

 title : The i-spoc2008 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This page is going to be used as a medium of communication during Google Summer of Code 2008 (hoping my application is accepted) </p>

<p>A full pdf version of proposal.  </p>

<p>Proposal Abstract : </p>

<p>Computer simulations are becoming more and more popular as an excellent tool to illustrate and unravel complex phenomena from social science.  The ISPOC framework face that turn by providing a convenient way of sharing, commenting and verifying computer simulation allowing a peer review process which is the essence of a progress in modern science. </p>

<p>My project consists of three new features that will improve the service using three different perspectives. I plan to add a new functionality, increase availability to wide public and improve the ISPOC credibility among researchers.  </p>

<p>I will add a new functionality by providing a fully automatic and effortless way of uploading simulation results. These outcomes will be gathered in a public resource pool that will allow comparing, testing and presenting results in an attractive form as charts and diagrams.  </p>

<p>I will increase the availability by creating a framework that will enable easily deployment of java applets which are the most accessible form of simulation to people who are not very skilled at configuring, compiling and installing software. </p>

<p>I will improve the credibility of the ISPOC by handling the tender question of legal rights protection by providing a tool that will make adding a license statement an obligatory yet effortless step during the simulation upload.  End-users will be also provided with detailed description of what can they legally do with downloaded simulation.</p>

 title : The j-sim Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>J-Sim (formerly known as JavaSim) is a component-based, compositional simulation environment. It has been built upon the notion of the autonomous component programming model. Similar to COM/COM+, JavaBeansTM, or CORBA, the basic entity in J-Sim is components, but unlike the other component-based software packages/standards, components in J-Sim are autonomous and are realization of software ICs. </p>

 title : The jcopvr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This driver is a Windows version of the JCOP Simulation ifdhandler (see JPCSC for more information). It enables a PC/SC client software on Windows 2000 to talk with the JCOP simulator. </p>

<p>Filesjcop_vr.sys: kernel-mode driver. jcop_proxy.exe: user-mode application. As it seems to be difficult for me to invoke socket functions (or TDI functions) from a kernel-mode driver, the user-mode application invokes Winsock functions to mediate interaction between the kernel-mode driver and the JCOP simulator. </p>

<p>NoticeWorks only for Windows 2000: This driver is developed as a legacy smart card driver and needs a help of Smart Card Helper service which has been deprecated from Windows XP SP2. T=1 is not fully supported: As this driver is a virtual driver, it has minimal error free operations. No error de</p>

 title : The jgrafcet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Grafcet is a language that allows modeling of automation systems, mainly control systems. Its graphical character, defined with simple rules, becomes attractive for modeling of sequential behaviors and more complex dynamic of systems. This project aims to supply a framework to help the definition of structures and simulation of Grafcet models. In the first stage of the project, it will be defined the representation of the model and basic mechanisms of interpretation. In the second stage the objective will be to supply a visualization layer, that facilitates to the creation and maintenance of models of graphical form. It is also of interest of the project to supply a core of class with small footprint, aiming at the use in embedded systems. </p>

<p>Source code is in portuguese.</p>

 summary : <p>jRescue is a RCRSS witten in java.</p>
 summary : <p>JTSS is a jade based traffic simulation system. It origns from my doctor project. It is designed for ITS simulation and any other micro traffic simulation sutiations. </p>

<p>It consists of lower simulation system which based on Jade http://jade.tilab.com/ and upper display system which maybe Qt Jambi http://trolltech.com/products/qt/ based or xith3d http://xith.org/ based. The simulation system send data to display system by UDP multicast tech which decouple two system well. </p>

<p>In fact jtss is still under development. I will try my best to release first alpha version in few weeks. </p>

 title : The kindohm-life Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A home-grown AI experiment.  Agents live our their &quot;lives&quot; hunting and breeding.  The inspiration for this project is just to see what could be done with no AI or simulation framework to start with.  It&#39;s just for fun. </p>

<p>There are two components: the executable and the library.  In theory the library could be used outside the scope of this project but it wasn&#39;t written for that purpose.  </p>

<p>The executable is a simple command-line app.  The app starts up with a help screen that describes the commands you can perform.  Create a new board, give it a height and width, and add in some herbivores and carnivores.  You can control the verbosity of the simulation events by turning on/off messages about certain activities such as deaths, births, or mutations.</p>

 title : The kspectrum Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>kspectrum is a code that will compute high-resolution spectrum (ka vs nu) from public line-by-line databases, for any thermodynamical conditions (temperature, pressure), and for any gas mixture, with a full control of the accuracy over the results. </p>

<p>These spectrum can be used, for instance, in order to produce k-distribution data sets that are very appreciated for radiative transfer simulations. </p>

<p>This code can be used in order to generate entry data for radiative transfer simulation codes, in various research fields, such as planetary atmospheres (climate studies, simulation of atmospheric general circulation), combustion, etc. </p>

<p>The main idea of kspectrum is that the uncertainty over the resulting spectrum can be specified by the user. The absorption coefficient at each wavenumber will be computed within the specified accuracy limits: the contribution of each known energetic transition will be taken into account, no matter how much computation time it requires. As a consequence, kspectrum does not need line profile truncation or line selection techniques, and no ad-hoc corrections have to be brought depending on the local thermodynamic conditions or species concentrations. Moreover, physical phenomenons such as doppler broadening (resulting in a Voigt line profile), sub-lorentzian profiles and collision-induced absorption are taken into account, within the limits of the present knowledge in spectroscopy. </p>

<p>This code has been tested for Earth and Venus atmospheres, and is known to provide very accurate results (specifically for the Earth, since gas spectrum are well known). </p>

<p>kspectrum is written in fortran 77, and will run on any linux cluster that uses mpich. </p>

<p>INSTALLATION </p>

<p>First, the name of your fortran 77 compiler has to be defined within the F77 environment variable. For instance, add the following line to your .bashrc file: </p>

<p>&gt;export F77=&quot;g77&quot; </p>

<p>if you are using the GNU fortran 77 compiler. Then use &quot;source .bashrc&quot; to take modifications into account. Adapt the previous commands to your situation. If you do not define the F77 variable, your fortran 77 compiler&#39;s name will be asked when compilation commands are executed. </p>

<p>Next,the user should download the most recent archive &quot;kspectrum1.0.4.tgz&quot; and installation script &quot;install_kspectrum1.0.4.bash&quot; in the same directory. Then use the following command: </p>

<p>&gt; ./install_kspectrum1.0.4.bash </p>

<p>The installation script will unzip the archive, creating the main kspectrum directory. It will also compile and run a small program into the /data directory for creating example input data files. </p>

<p>The user should refer to the manual (can be downloaded from the project page or found into the /Doc directory) in order to compile the main executable and to run simulations. The main steps are: </p>

<p>- install MPICH on every system that will take part of your cluster, if you do not already have set up a cluster. </p>

<p>- to edit the &quot;Makefile&quot; file and set the compiler name and compilation options that fit your compiler / system. </p>

<p>- to edit the &quot;includes/max.inc&quot; file and set variables values (although default values should be fine) </p>

<p>- use command &quot;make all&quot; in order to compile the executable. </p>

<p>- install Line-by-Line public databases into the /data directory. </p>

<p>USE </p>

<p>Use command &quot;mpirun -np # kspectrum.exe&quot; to run a simulation, with # the number of processes that have to execute the code. The number of processes should be equal to the number of physical cores of your cluster, plus one. </p>

<p>MODIFICATIONS </p>

<p>Whenever a source file is modified, command &quot;make all&quot; should be use to recompile the modified files. </p>

<p>Whenever an include file is modified, command &quot;make clean all&quot; should be used in order to recompile the executable from scratch. </p>

<p>RESULTS </p>

<p>Results files are located into the /results directory. Each file contains three columns: the wavenumber in inverse centimeters, the absorption cross-section of the gas mixture at that wavenumber, in square centimeters per molecule, and the absorption coefficient of the gas mixture at that wavenumber, in inverse meters. </p>

<p>Results can be used by the &quot;kdistribution&quot; code in order to produce k-distribution data sets. In order to install &quot;kdistribution&quot;, follow the same steps than for KSPECTRUM: </p>

<p>- download the main archive &quot;kdistribution1.0.4.tgz&quot; archive and &quot;install_kdistribution1.0.4.bash&quot; installation script, on the same directory (for instance, at the same level you downloaded &quot;kspectrum1.0.4.tgz&quot; and &quot;install_kspectrum1.0.4.bash&quot;). Please note version numbers should be identical for ksectrum and kdistribution, otherwise format issues will occur. </p>

<p>- run &quot;install_kdistribution1.0.4.bash&quot; in order to unzip the archive. This script will find &quot;kspectrum&quot; if both codes are installed at the same level, and will make appropriate links in this case. </p>

<p>- read the documentation file &quot;/Doc/manual.pdf&quot; to compile and use &quot;kdistribution&quot;.</p>
 summary : <p>LANDIS-II is a forest landscape simulation model that simulates forest succession, disturbance (including fire, wind, harvesting, insects, climate change), and seed dispersal across large (typically 10,000 - 10,000,000 ha) landscapes. LANDIS-II tracks the age and spatial distribution of discrete tree and shrub species and has a flexible spatial and flexible temporal resolution. </p>

<p>LANDIS-II advances forest landscape simulation modeling in many respects. Most significantly, LANDIS-II, 1) has flexible time steps for every ecological process, 2) optionally allows for the incorporation of ecosystem processes and states (eg live biomass accumulation) 3) uses an advanced architecture that allows rapid model development and easy distribution and installation of model components. </p>

<p>LANDIS-II manages and executes discrete extensions (modules or plug-ins). Each ecological process is programmed as an independent extension that interacts with the landscape through an explicit interface with the core LANDIS-II program. The user specifies which extensions will be used to best simulate the forest dynamics of interest. LANDIS-II allows scientists to easily develop and share their own extensions. </p>

<p>LANDIS-II was developed at the Forest Landscape Ecology Laboratory at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, the USFS Northern Research Station, and the Conservation Biology Institute.</p>

 title : The lbm2d Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>All comments are welcome to help improving the code. </p>

<p> This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. </p>

<p> This program focuses on the boundary condition treatment of lattice Boltzmann method (LBM). modified Filippova and Hanel method(thereafter as F-H model) has been added to this program. </p>

<p> a Matlab code is used to read a geometry picture, output 2 data files needed for LBM2d (indicator.dat and rate_file.dat). </p>

<p> LBM2D will write data files in the finite element scheme, which can be read and presented by Tecplot.</p>

 title : The learnphysics Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The goal of this project is to make learning physics more fun for high school students and beyond, by developing simulations and demos to go along with a typical Mechanics curriculum. Each simulation will focus on a specific physics concept, with the intent of making this concept clear and understandable to the user. Simulations will be supplemented with text explanations, and each simulation will be part of a coherent progression of physical concepts. </p>

<p>The end result will be a website, where each simulation can be viewed, with descriptions and explanations integrated into the page. </p>

<p>The blog can be found here: http://rcosphysics.blogspot.com/ </p>

<p>The current schedule can be found here: http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=ptChr3Aw403aMz2TlENh9WA</p>
