 title : The sphinx-modeler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The sphinxmodeler Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The story of Sphinx</p>

<p>I have been an addicted object modeler since 1990 when I acquired a copy of Rose 1.0. In those days we used Booch notation to communicate architecture or design views. In 1996 I was fortunate to participate in the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Object Technology User Group (OTUG) and collaborated with that community to produce Unified Method 0.8, UML 0.91, and 0.92
<br/>&amp;nbsp;specifications which was later revised and submitted to the OMG. During that time I created a UML modeling tool written in the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Delphi programming language. It was likely the first tool to implement the UML meta-model. Sadly my hard disk crashed at the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;time and the code was unrecoverable (really would have been good to submit to open source for historic purposes).</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;In 2000 I discovered the WikiWikiWeb and suddenly embarked on the realisation that after all these years, I was actually using
<br/>&amp;nbsp;various modeling tools (incl. Rose) as a nothing more than a glorified drawing tool. That was when I decided to fuse the concept
<br/>&amp;nbsp;of the original Wiki design principles and modeling together. The result was a collaborative modeling environment where diagrams
<br/>&amp;nbsp;and Wiki markup were treated no differently. The diagrams were able to morph when rendered depending on the resolution of the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Wiki link.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;Within 3 months I developed a Wiki based on Struts and EJBs (yet another mistake in my career) and an agile modeling tool based
<br/>&amp;nbsp;on Java web start technology. That modeling tool was known as Sphinx. The &#39;self.amigo&#39; package name used in Sphinx is a tribute
<br/>&amp;nbsp;to Grady, Jim and Ivar; otherwise known as the Three Amigos.</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;Whilst these days I am forced to use tools like RSA on various consulting assignments, I still use Sphinx for all other uses.
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Sphinx was modeled on the early (and more stable) editions of Rose without all the unnecessary software baggage. To this day, I
<br/>&amp;nbsp;still recall an email exchange with John Vlissides encouraging me to port Sphinx to Eclipse. I never did! My Delphi UML tool and
<br/>&amp;nbsp;my 3 month Collaborate Modeling Wiki sprint had taken its toll; I never developed another modeling tool again. However, I did
<br/>&amp;nbsp;entertain the proposition for 10 seconds when I discovered the Google Web Toolkit.</p>

<p>The self runtime library
<br/>&amp;nbsp;Note, this is a very old runtime library that I have evolved since 1996. I rarely use it now because the Apache Commons project
<br/>&amp;nbsp;has made it obsolete. However, there are some interesting maths routines like EllipseEquation, LinearEquation and
<br/>&amp;nbsp;QuadraticEquation that I needed to write when I developed the UML modeling tool. I hope exploring this codebase proves to be an
<br/>&amp;nbsp;education exercise. I also hope that you come to realise just how much todays software developers stand on the shoulders of open
<br/>&amp;nbsp;source. When I wrote this software there was no Apache Commons, there was no graphic element framework, there was however the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;JDK.
<br/>&amp;nbsp;
<br/>&amp;nbsp;During the process of preparing this code for open source, I thought I would take the time
<br/>&amp;nbsp;to quickly walk through my work over the many many years. It is truely bizarre, each source
<br/>&amp;nbsp;file tells a story like I&#39;m flipping through a personal photograph album. Whilst I share the
<br/>&amp;nbsp;code, you are perhaps missing out on the most valuable part, the journey.</p>

<p>best wishes
<br/>ash</p>
 title : The libevent - an event notification library Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The libevent API provides a mechanism to execute a callback function when a specific event occurs on a file descriptor or after a timeout has been reached. It is meant to replace the asynchronous event loop found in event-driven network servers.</p>

 title : The Level 3 Fingerprint Image Toolkit Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The streamtr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>STREAM - Static Thermodynamic REgulAtory Model of transcription, is a bioinformatics application for researchers, who want to model the transcriptional regulation of a specific gene and predict its transcriptional output in different situations. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>IntroductionSTREAM is the first publicly available framework for modeling, visualizing, and predicting the regulation of the transcription rate of a target gene. </p>

<p>Understanding transcriptional regulation of a gene in detail is a crucial step towards uncovering and ultimately utilizing the regulatory grammar of the genome. Modeling transcriptional regulation using thermodynamic equations has become an increasingly important approach towards this goal. </p>

<p>Given the concentration of a set of transcription factors as well as the transcription factor binding sites in a regulatory DNA region and the concentration of the target gene, STREAM will optimize its parameters to generate a model that best fits the input data. This trained model can then be used to </p>

<p>validate that the given set of TFs is able to regulate the target gene and predict the transcription rate under different conditions (e.g. different tissues, knockout/additional TFs or mutated/missing TFBS).  Please subscribe to the blog to stay informed about updates and papers. </p>

<p>Screenshot </p>

<p>SpecificationSTREAM is implemented in Java and is provided as an platform independet .jar file. </p>

<p>STREAM currently uses the thermodynamic model introduced by Reinitz et al.1, but the framework is flexible and can be used in conjunction with other models implemented in Java. STREAM offers several optimization methods including gradient descent and simulated annealing for adjusting the internal parameters of the model to best fit the user&#39;s input data. </p>

<p>STREAM can be executed using a graphical user interface (GUI) as well as via the command-line. The GUI offers the same functionality (e.g., multistart options of the optimization or automatic cross-validation evaluation) as the command-line tool, but in an intuitive and dialogue-based fashion. Both the command-line and the GUI version can save the current result and settings of the program into a &quot;.stream&#39;&#39; file, which makes saving and modifying previous experiments simple.  </p>

<p>PublicationBauer, D.C. and Bailey, T.L, STREAM - Static Thermodynamic REgulAtory Model for transcriptional regulation. Bioinformatics, in submission.  </p>

<p>MoreMore information about the program and its background as well as the usage is available here. </p>

<p>References(1) John Reinitz, Shuling Hou, and David H. Sharp. Transcriptional Control in Drosophila. Complexus, 1:54–64, 2003.</p>

<p>The Current  version of TAOM4E 0.6.3 provides basic features to model stakeholder goals, actors, goal analysis, requirement and architecture phases, and agent code generation. More features are being added, such as support for failure modelling and test generation.   </p>

 title : The ticc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ticc (Tool for Interface Compatibility and Composition) is a tool for the prototyping and verification of distributed designs. Ticc provides the following features: </p>

<p>Modeling of design components, and of their interaction.  Each component can specify both its behavior, and the behavior it expects from other components. Modeling capabilities include shared state (via shared and private variables), one- and bi-directional communication and synchronization (via synchronization actions). Benefit: concise, natural modeling of asynchronous systems with shared state and flexible communication patterns.  Composition and compatibility checking. When components are composed, Ticc checks that they interact correctly. Ticc is capable of propagating the input constraints of components upon composition. Benefit: the consistency of the design is assured.  Simulation and Verification. Ticc can check CTL properties of designs, as well as simulate them. Ticc relies on symbolic methods for the efficient analysis of large state spaces. Benefit: the correctness of designs with respect to specifications can be checked.</p>
 summary : <p>TimMLA multi-aquifer, analytic element modelTimML is a computer program for the modeling of steady-state multi-aquifer flow with analytic elements and consists of a library of Python scripts and FORTRAN extensions. TimML may be applied to an arbitrary number of aquifers and leaky layers. The head, flow, and leakage between aquifers may be computed analytically at any point in the aquifer system. The design of TimML is object-oriented and has been kept simple and flexible. New analytic elements may be added to the code without making any changes in the existing part of the code. TimML is coded in Python, a free, open-source, powerful programming language; use is made of FORTRAN extensions to improve performance. TimML is free and open-source software and is released under the GNU Lesser General Public License. </p>

<p>Download options include the TimML program and the manual. The manual contains full instructions on how to run TimML. The objective of the manual is to provide enough information for someone familiar with the analytic element method to use (and possibly modify) the program. Running TimML and especially modifying TimML requires some knowledge of Python. Python is very easy to learn. A number of free tutorials are available from the Python website. </p>

<p>TimML version 3.4 is out! TimML 3.4 has interactive graphical output that allow you to evaluate the results of your TimML model graphically and easily.  </p>

<p>Note that since version 3.3, TimML requires installation of the matplotlib and shapely packages. Detailed installation instructions are given in the manual. TimML also runs on MacOSX. A compiled FORTRAN extension can be obtained from Mark Bakker. The FORTRAN file is available under the source tab if you want to do it yourself.</p>

 title : The cherrywado Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>CherryWadoAboutCherryWado is a WADO server written in python, using the CherryPy web framework. </p>

<p>DICOM images are handled with the OFFIS DICOM toolkit command line utilities. </p>

<p>For information about DICOM and Web Access to persistent Dicom Objects see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DICOM. </p>

<p>DependenciesCherryPy flup Python Imaging Library (PIL) DICOM Toolkit - dcmtk DownloadNon-members may check out a read-only working copy anonymously over HTTP. </p>

<p>svn checkout http://cherrywado.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ cherrywado-read-onlyInstallation and configurationOur WADO server doesn&#39;t make any assumption about how / where you store DICOM files. Therefore, in order to use it, you need to tweak accessdata.py to specify a way to retrieve the requested DICOM object. </p>

<p>You can test the server as follows: </p>

<p>$ python wado.py test </p>

<p>CherryWado uses FLUP to ease deployment with lighttpd or Apache. </p>

<p>Here is a lighttpd.conf snippet for your convenience: </p>

<p>$HTTP[&quot;url&quot;] =~ &quot;&quot; {
<br/>    fastcgi.server = (
<br/>        &quot;/wado/&quot; =&gt; (
<br/>           &quot;wado&quot; =&gt; (
<br/>              &quot;bin-path&quot;         =&gt; &quot;/path/to/wado.py&quot;,
<br/>              &quot;socket&quot;           =&gt; &quot;/tmp/wado.sock&quot;,
<br/>              &quot;check-local&quot;      =&gt; &quot;disable&quot;,
<br/>              &quot;disable-time&quot;     =&gt; 1,
<br/>              &quot;min-procs&quot;        =&gt; 1,
<br/>              &quot;max-procs&quot;        =&gt; 10,
<br/>           ),
<br/>        ),
<br/>    )Make sure you have &quot;mod_fastcgi&quot; in server.modules! </p>

<p>LicenseCherryWado is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. </p>

<p>See http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 for the full text. </p>

<p>AuthorsEmanuele Rocca, Marco De Benedetto</p>

 summary : <p>docserver is a linux document server for developers.</p>

<p>As a developer, you always have a lot of html documents at hand: jdk api, hibernate docs, spring docs, webwork docs ..., each has thousands of small files. docserver is a small http server running on your laptop which serves two purposes:</p>

<p>1. Let you use documents quickly, in a consistent way
<br/>2. Keep document in compressed file so to save the disk space</p>

<p>It listens a specified port on your laptop, and you can view the documents with any web browser. It has a very small memory footprint, and runs very fast.</p>

 title : The gfs-server Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GFS Server was born in January 2008 as a side project.  I wanted to create a socket server for Flash and Flex clients in a minimal amount of time.  Using existing projects like Apache Mina (and others) I was able to essentially glue together a socket server that worked well originally based off of the Apache Mina sample code. </p>

<p>With GFS Server you can host multi-player chat rooms and games easily. </p>

<p>Keep in mind this was a project born in my spare time and written to be up and running in very little time.  There are many sharp edges and best practices that can and should be incorporated into the code base as time permits.  In general, the code probably needs a lot of tender loving care.  I&#39;ve been asked by more than one person to open source this - so here it is. </p>

<p>This project uses several open source code from several different developers.  Unless otherwise specified the GFS Server code is licensed under the GPL 2.</p>
 summary : <p>Google Feed Server is an open source Atom Publishing Protocol server based on the Apache Abdera framework. Google Feed Server provides a simple back end for data adapters, which allows developers to quickly deploy a feed for an existing data source such as a database.  </p>

<p>Google Feed Server also provides the Feed Server Client Tool (FSCT), which lets developers perform create, receive, update, and delete (CRUD) operations on a Feed Server feed. </p>

<p>For information on Google Feed Server, see the following Wiki articles on this site: </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>Inside the Google Feed Server Atom Publishing and Google Data API Overview Payload In Content Source Code Walkthrough Setting Up a Development Environment DatabaseConfigurationForAFeed Apache Abdera Information Private Gadget Administrator&#39;s Guide</p>
 title : The google-feedserver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Gperftools-httpd is a simple HTTP server, based on thttpd, that enables remote profiling via Google&#39;s pprof (see google-perftools).</p>

<p>This code is not from Google.  It is a copy of thttpd 2.25b
<br/>but then adapted to be a tiny minimal HTTP server
<br/>that can be linked into any program to serve
<br/>profiling information for pprof.</p>

<p>It has been chopped up significantly compared to the original.</p>

<p>After running make (which assumes you have the google-perftools
<br/>libraries installed in /usr/local/lib or a standard place like /usr/lib),
<br/>you can profile an arbitrary program with:</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;LD_PRELOAD=/usr/local/lib/libghttpd-preload.so ./a.out</p>

<p>and then while it is running, execute:</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;pprof a.out http://localhost:9999/pprof/heap</p>

<p>The preload library starts the HTTP server at the first call
<br/>to malloc.  Alternately, you can link with -lghttpd and call ghttpd()
<br/>during program initialization (e.g., in main).</p>

<p>You can change the port number by setting the environment
<br/>variable GHTTPPORT:</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;GHTTPPORT=12345 LD_PRELOAD=libghttpd-preload.so ./a.out</p>
 title : The gperftools-httpd Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The prolog-server Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Prolog Server is simple server application that defines a protocol to remotely instantiate a prolog engine, set a theory and perform queries. </p>

<p>The protocol provides a set of simple commands: </p>

<p>CREATE ENGINE  Create a new prolog engine. </p>

<p>USE ENGINE  Use an existing engine. </p>

<p>SET THEORY theory . Sets a theory for the current engine. </p>

<p>GET THEORY Prints out the current theory. </p>

<p>VERSION Print the current server versione </p>

<p>SOLVE </p>

<p> Performs a query on the engine. </p>

<p>SOLVE NEXT Returns the next aviable solution. </p>

<p>The server utilizes the tuProlog engine:  http://alice.unibo.it/xwiki/bin/view/Tuprolog/</p>

 title : The thps-decicated-server Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>In the simplest sense, THPS Dedicated Server is a dedicated server for the Tony Hawk&#39;s Pro Skater, Tony Hawk&#39;s Underground, and later series of video games. It is designed from the ground up from clean reverse engineering techniques used to understand the network code of the series by it&#39;s modding community. Currently the only way to run a multi player server for any of the series&#39;s games is to have a human player run the game and administrate it themselves. Not only that, but the included server feature set in-game is quite limited. Through the dedicated server we hope to not only allow unmanned servers, but to extend the feature set and overall multi player experience of the series. Some specific goals we have set are to not only make our server mirror the capabilities of the traditional THPS server but to greatly surpass them by integrating a powerful and flexible server scripting system. </p>

<p>The server will be written from the start to be extremely portable and to work on many platforms. We are using ANSI C and the GNU tool chain for the entirety of the project development. The server will either be reliant on WinSock or Berkeley sockets, depending on it&#39;s platform and the rest will be either original coding or functions found in the standard C runtime. The project is relatively simple and we expect to keep it very minimalistic in it&#39;s core feature set, but to make it expansible through a scripting plugin system. We haven&#39;t decided on a scripting system at this point as that is a later goal of the project, but likely candidates include Python, Lua, or a custom syntax designed by us. </p>

<p>One prospective goal may be to make our server work with multiple game platforms such as allowing Playstation 2 based players to play with PC based players. This has already been done otherwise so it is likely to be a feature of the server at a later stage of development. We also expect to allow such advanced capabilities like parsing player chat for scripting or server commands, allowing designated server administrators, permanent bans, and a wide variety of other possibilities. </p>

<p>To sum it up, we are hoping to make the online experience much greater and to utilize the true capabilities of the game&#39;s network engine by expanding it&#39;s feature set. By keeping the project open source we hope to encourage other creative ideas to enhance the multi player experience and perhaps revive a once thriving online community.</p>

 title : The velo-server Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>VELO is an Open Source User Provisioning Software. VELO, pronounced like &quot;jello&quot;, helps company by automating many administrative tasks associated with user account setup and maintenance. </p>

<p>In a technical term, User provisioning refers to the creation, maintenance and deactivation of user objects and user attributes, as they exist in one or more systems, directories or applications, in response to automated or interactive business processes. </p>

<p>User provisioning software may include one or more of the following processes: </p>

<p>Change propagation, Self Service Workflow, Consolidated user administration, Delegated user administration, and Federated change control. User objects may represent employees, contractors, vendors, partners, customers or other recipients of a service. </p>

<p>Services may include electronic mail, inclusion in a published user directory, access to a database, access to a network or mainframe, etc.</p>

 summary : <p>VideoPad is a simple, client-server based video conferencing system. Users connect and send audio/video data to the central server which distributes received data back to them. This way a client doesn&#39;t have to have large upload bandwidth to communicate with other people.</p>

<p>VideoPad is like IRC: the server has channels, users can join them and talk to other people on the same channel.</p>

 summary : <p>Aliwal GeocoderYour data, on a map
<br/> </p>

<p>This tool pins your data onto a map, helping you visualize the where factor. No need to upload your data to an internet map, bring the map to your data instead. </p>

<p>You don&#39;t need coordinates either, Aliwal Geocoder can figure them out from regular addresses. Start with global satellite image and then zoom in to street level details. Each map pin has popup balloon filled with the details you choose. Tags provide filtering, to help you slie and dice your maps.  </p>

<p>It&#39;s easy to get your information into Aliwal Geocoder, it can work with coordinates or addresses. It can import text files from Excel or read KML files . There&#39;s even an example query for SQL Server experts. </p>

 summary : <p>NewsAppleIIGo has been renamed OpenEmulator. Please refer to the following link to access the new project: </p>

<p>http://code.google.com/p/openemulator </p>

<p>AboutAppleIIGo is an Apple II family emulator. It aims to: </p>

<p>Model the computers of the Apple II family (Apple I, Apple II, Apple II+, Apple III, Apple IIe, Apple IIc, Apple IIc+, Apple IIGS and clones) and many of its peripherals as accurately as possible Run on many platforms Be resource efficient Activity Log </p>

<p>FeaturesCross-platform through wxWidgets, OpenGL and PortAudio Cycle-accurate CPU, video and disk controller emulation Analog sound amplifier emulation Hardware Apple 5.25&quot; and 3.5&quot; Disk Drive emulation Native SmartPort and UniDisk 3.5&quot; emulation Support for DSK, D13, PO, NIB, V2D, VDSK, 2IMG, HDV, FDI disk image file formats Memory expansion support for language card, Saturn 128k RAM Board, Apple IIe 64k card, RamWorks, Apple II Memory Expansion Card TeamMarc S. Ressl (lead developer) Vladimir Ivanoff (accurate CPU emulation) Dirk Thierbach (Cross-platform and software components assistance) Nick Westgate (Disk II emulation, emulation ideas) Screenshots</p>
 title : The ardrumo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Ardrumo is completely free open source software, but to help defray the cost of Matt&#39;s drum lessons, please consider donating to the project. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>BackgroundThis is a software MIDI interface designed to accept serial data from an Arduino board and convert it into MIDI drum data in OS X.  The application acts as a bridge between sensors connected to the Arduino board and applications such as GarageBand or Logic without requiring additional MIDI hardware.  All data is transferred directly over the USB connection and no additional power source is needed. 
<br/>ConceptI wanted to make an inexpensive electronic drum setup that could be used with GarageBand.  There are some great projects out there that describe how to output MIDI from an Arduino board (see References below), but these require additional hardware (e.g. MIDI modules, MIDI interface, etc).  Since most people don&#39;t have extra MIDI hardware, I decided to just write some software to accept serial data from an Arduino board and make a virtual MIDI instrument that would be recognized by GarageBand.  Here is the idea: 
<br/> 
<br/>ImplementationMy homemade drum kit is pictured below.  Each pad is a circle of Duralar (i.e. thick mylar) sandwiched between two pieces of foam (from Pearl Art Store).  Attached to the Duralar circle is a piezo sensor extracted from its plastic casing.  Everything is then just glued together.  Each pad cost about $3.00 to make. 
<br/> 
<br/>Click on the image below to see a video of Ardrumo in action: 
<br/> 
<br/>Pad Construction
<br/>Bill of Materials
<br/>Arduino prototype board  $35 pad materials x 6 $6 piezo transducer (1500-3000Hz) x 6 (Radio Shack part #273-073) $12 Total $53 
<br/>If you can&#39;t find piezo sensors at Radio Shack, you may be able to get them from DigiKey or Jameco. Assembly Instructions
<br/> 
<br/>Wiring
<br/>The wiring is very similar to todbot&#39;s.  I borrowed his image and modified it below (hope he doesn&#39;t mind).  I didn&#39;t bother using a Zener diode as todbot suggests.  It may be safer to do so, but I haven&#39;t blown out the Arduino board yet. 
<br/> 
<br/>DownloadMac OS X Universal Application
<br/>Compatible with OS X 10.4 (Tiger) and 10.5 (Leopard) (see below for troubleshooting).  This also assumes you  have installed the Arduino drivers and have a working connection between your Mac and Arduino board (how else would you load the sketch below?).  If you don&#39;t have an Arduino board, you can still run the application and click the on-screen triggers to see how it works.  To use it, plug in your Ardruino board with drum triggers attached, start GarageBand (or another MIDI-compatible application), and launch Ardrumo. 
<br/>Screenshot
<br/> 
<br/>Latest Version
<br/>Ardrumo (Universal) (beta v100.2) (February, 16, 2008) 
<br/>Updates RXTX Java library.  Thanks to Jenna Fox for suggesting the solution to the permissions issues mentioned in Troubleshooting section below.  With the latest RXTX library, these permissions corrections should not be needed. Previous Versions
<br/>Ardrumo (Universal) (beta v100.1) (November 8, 2007) 
<br/>Fixes problems with PowerPC machines. Ardrumo (beta v100.0) (November 2, 2007) 
<br/>Initial release. Source Code
<br/>SVN repository 
<br/>NetBeans-compatible Java project directory Arduino Sketch
<br/>ardrumo.pde Load this sketch into your Arduino and connect up to 6 piezo sensors. 
<br/>     </p>

<p>Known IssuesThere are several known issues that will be addressed in the next release. Stay tuned!  
<br/>Planned features/bug fixes include: 
<br/>Bug: Correct double triggering Work in progress: the Threshold knob is not wired up yet Feature request: Save &quot;scenes&quot; feature Feature request: MIDI channel support AcknowledgementsJava Libraries
<br/>Ardrumo uses the following Java libraries.  Many thanks to the developers! 
<br/>MMJ Java Midi Subsystem RXTX for Serial Communication DKnob Component References
<br/>This project was inspired by the following projects, especially todbot&#39;s: 
<br/>http://todbot.com/blog/2006/10/29/spooky-arduino-projects-4-and-musical-arduino/ http://itp.nyu.edu/physcomp/Labs/MIDIOutput http://members.cox.net/ampage/triggers.htm TroubleshootingArdrumo has been tested with Mac OS X 10.4.8 (Tiger) and 10.5 (Leopard) on both PowerPC and Intel-based Macs. 
<br/>Users who run into unrecognized serial port errors should correct permissions by doing the following: 
<br/>Under Finder click on the &quot;Go&quot; Menu Select &quot;Go to Folder...&quot; Type &quot;/var/&quot; Finder will open var folder. Right click on folder named &quot;lock&quot; and select &quot;Get info&quot; (some users have reported a missing lock directory.  If it is missing, you will need to create it) Open drop arrow titled &quot;Sharing &amp; Permissions&quot; I set all privileges to: &quot;Read &amp; Write&quot; Close Info Go to the Var folder on the finder and open the &quot;spool&quot; folder Right click on folder named &quot;uucp&quot; and select &quot;Get info&quot; Open drop arrow titled &quot;Sharing &amp; Permissions&quot; I set all privileges to: &quot;Read &amp; Write&quot; Close Info DONE (This information from (bacadd) here) 
<br/>SupportIf you use Ardrumo and like it, please drop me a line:  mschaffgmailcom  I&#39;m happy to answer questions or take suggestions for improvements. 
<br/>For feature requests or general Ardrumo/Arduino community discussion, please post a message here.</p>
 title : The aurora-mixer-drivers Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Project to host native drivers for the Aurora usb audio controller. </p>

<p>StatusMixer HardwareSee http://www.auroramixer.com. </p>

<p>OS XDriver may or may not work. This was developed with a working knowledge of the FTDI serial chip and the MIDI framework for OS X. I (Joe the OS X dev) never had a unit in possession so this driver is untested. </p>

<p>Mainly, if the serial converter does not fragment the packets when sending down the USB channel, the driver should work just fine. If there is fragmentation, well, it won&#39;t work correctly at all.  </p>

<p>If fragmentation is the case, an error checker and packet buffer will have to be implemented in the recievedData method. This is trivial bcs the Aurora only send one kind of MIDI packet of fixed size. If it is ever upgraded to send SYSEX data or use MIDI Running Status messages, then it because a much more difficult problem, because of variable packet lengths and also message interruption (SYSEX&#39;s of &#39;Realtime&#39; are allowed to interrupt other messages). </p>

<p>OS X  Windows  Linux   Author  Y  Y  ?   Status  Untested  Untested  ?  </p>

<p>This project is not associated with the developers of the Aurora Mixer hardware and solely those whom are authors of the software included on this page.</p>
 title : The daily-digest Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A tool which will email you a daily digest of RSS feeds.  </p>

<p>Sends you an email containing all updated RSS items since last run.  Manage rss feeds from the command line. Define your own CSS styles for output email The aim is to create an easily readable email that will work on portable devices that can cache emails when in wireless range and browse emails when outside of wireless range (say, for instance, an iPod Touch). </p>

<p>It is written in Python (2.5.1) using only standard libraries, so it should work on any system that can run Python. It has been successfully tested on OSX and Windows XP. Windows users will probably need to install Python 2.5.1 or greater.   </p>

 title : The encfsvault Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionEncFSVault provides a replacement for Apple&#39;s FileVault. The EncFSVault provides seamless integration into the login system for Leopard and has also been back ported to Tiger. You can also chose to have EncFS encrypt other directories or removable drives, see the EncFS MacFusion section for more information. </p>

<p>EncFSVault only provides the mechanism for the FileVault not the actual encfs program or fuse libraries. They must be installed before using the EncFS based FileVault. You can find more information on MacFUSE on Google Code and the EncFS packages are the download section. EncFSVault is not limited to the version of EncFS listed in the downloads section. You should be able to use any version of EncFS provide it&#39;s compatible with the version of MacFuse that you have installed.  The EncFS package in the downloads section is compatible with MacFuse 1.1.0 and higher. </p>

<p>Screen ShotHere is a screen shot of Zod&#39;s encrypted home directory running on Leopard. </p>

<p> </p>

 title : The fidgen Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>NEWS2009-07-13New bug fix release to be compatible with Java 6. Also removed the non-GPL compatible CC license restriction on generated markers. </p>

<p>2008-12-09This project has been shortlisted for the Brit Insurance Designs of the Year 2009 awards </p>

<p>Please watch the exhibition video for further background information </p>

<p>Fid.Gen is a general purpose generator for designing and tailoring custom fiducial markers to be used in reacTIVision based projects. The layout of the markers is physics driven and realised by a network of springs. There are numerous parameters to adjust the size &amp; complexity of the markers. </p>

<p>Download from the links in the side bar or check out the Processing source version from SVN. Please see the Usage page for a &quot;complete&quot; user guide... </p>

<p>Any issues or suggestions should be filed via the Issues feedback form or email. </p>

<p>Screenshots</p>

<p>selling unique organic shirts with all proceeds donated to the reacTIVision project.</p>

 title : The freetorrent Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>french Free (libre) and opensource community project with bittorrent support (based on Drupal) </p>

<p>Freetorrent est un projet basé sur le partage et la promotion des logiciels libres et des contenus libres sous Licence Libre ET sous Licence Libre de Diffusion (LLD) (pour tout système : Microsoft Windows™, Gnu/Linux, Mac OS, xBSD, ...). Freetorrent propose de rassembler et de rendre ces médias disponibles par l&#39;intermédiaire du réseau Peer to peer en utilisant le protocole Bittorrent et souhaite ainsi créer une dynamique communautaire culturelle libre, pour tous, par tous.  </p>

<p>Finalité de freetorrentfournir un service communautaire culturel gratuit et libre. Objectifs de freetorrentproposer un projet social et citoyen basé sur la culture libre, l&#39;échange de savoirs et le développement culturel  créer une dynamique communautaire culturelle libre, pour tous, par tous administrer un espace culturel communautaire rassembler et rendre des média sous licences libres disponibles par l&#39;intermédiaire du réseau Peer to peer en utilisant le protocole Bittorrent construire un vaste catalogue en ligne de média sous licences libres, classés, commentés et régulièrement mis à jour : tutoriels, livres, films, vidéo, revues techniques, supports littéraires (poésie, théâtre, roman...) proposer la mise à disposition d&#39;espaces de discussions organiser la rédaction collaborative d&#39;infos et d&#39;articles de fond proposer de l&#39;information sur le libre échange (ou &quot;échange libre&quot;), et participer à sa diffusion témoigner de la diversité du monde du Libre et de son dynamisme proposer à ses visiteurs de devenir ponctuellement ou régulièrement acteurs du site Objectifs opérationnelscumuler un tracker bittorrent et un portail communautaire, réfuter et refuser l&#39;aspect &quot;bittorrent = warez&quot;, travailler l&#39;aspect esthétique, travailler la communication et le partenariat, ...  Fonctionnement actuelTracker bittorrent est actuellement basé sur Btitracker de la Btiteam. </p>

 title : The gitso Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>AboutGitso is to support others.Gitso is a frontend to reverse VNC connections.  It is meant to be a simple two-step process that connects one person to another&#39;s screen.  First, the support person offers to give support.  Second, the person who needs help connects and has their screen remotely visible. Because Gitso is cross-platform (Linux, OS X and Windows) and uses a reverse VNC connection, it greatly simplifies the process of getting support. </p>

<p>Gitso 0.6 (Feb 21, 2010)Complete rewrite of processes. Stop VNC Processes (Windows) Support loading remote hosts file. Command line switches --dev --listen --connect IP --list list_file --version --help manpage for (Linux) Support for .rpms Native VNC listener! (OS X) Better process management, user gets notified if connection is broken. Licensing Updates (across the board). Many bug fixes. Release History </p>

<p>DownloadsMac OS X: 10.5 (Leopard). Note: If you downloaded Gitso (for Leopard) on Feb 21 or 22, there was a bug that has been fixed that prevented Gitso from starting. Please redownload. 10.6 (Snow Leopard). Windows: Windows XP and higher. Linux: Ubuntu. Fedora. OpenSUSE. Platform Independent. You will need to manually install the following: x11vnc vncviewer wxPython </p>

<p>Using GitsoInstructions Building GitsoInstructions Screenshots</p>

<p>          </p>

<p>Based OnOS X Chicken of the VNC 2.0 b4 (Source) OS X uses OSXvnc 3.0 (Source) Windows Windows uses TightVNC 1.3.10 (Source) Roadmap0.8Support for display names, instead of IP only. Enable NatPMP (needs testing) Add localizations (patches exist). Add preferences for low-res/optimizations. Add preferences for SSH Tunneling and ports. Upgrade VNC (Windows --&gt; TightVNC 2.0 &amp;&amp; Linux --&gt; vnc4server?) Get Gitso into a Ubuntu repository: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/319444 https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PackagingGuide Linkshttp://podcast.ubuntu-uk.org/?p=157 (~ min 28 - 35) http://tinyapps.org/weblog/misc/200810110700_gitso_remote_support.html http://linuxerie.midiblogs.com/archive/2008/09/25/gisto-passer-les-routeurs-avec-vnc.html http://www.luthi.eu/blog/2008/10/remote-support-made-simple-with-gitso http://mac.softpedia.com/get/Utilities/Gitso.shtml http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1202905 http://forum.ultravnc.info/viewtopic.php?t=14092</p>

 summary : <p>gpuTracker provides gpu accelerated blob tracking for multi touch user interfaces (and other blob tracking needs for that matter).  title : The imk-tiger Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IMK-Tiger is a replica of Mac OS X 10.5&#39;s InputMethodKit (IMK), an object-oriented, RPC-based input method framework. Advanced as IMK is, it is only available on Mac OS X 10.5 and above. For input method projects that still need to support OS X 10.4 users, IMK-Tiger offers a simplified way of backporting.</p>
 title : The Stackful Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The itivo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>iTiVoiTiVo is a Mac front-end to your Series 2, Series 3, and TiVoHD device.  It will download shows to your mac, and convert them to many popular formats / devices. </p>

<p>Features include: </p>

<p>Formats include h.264, mpeg-2, mpeg-1, decrypt-only. Target devices include iPhone, iPod, AppleTV, Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, PSP, youtube. &#39;subscriptions&#39; to your regular shows: downloading them whenever new episodes are available. Automatically perform an &#39;iTunes sync&#39; to your device when the download is completed. Automatically remove commercials from downloaded shows. Generate metadata appropriate for use by tools such as pyTivoX. Create subtitle files (.srt) from the closed caption info. Support for different encoders, including HandBrake, Mencoder, FFmpeg, ElGato Turbo. Full control over encoder options. A download queue for batch processing. Scheduling of when the queue will be processed. Automatic discovery of Tivos using Bonjour. Automatic updates. Reporting on tivo&#39;s Hard Drive usage. </p>

<p>With appropriate configuration, you can plug in your iPhone to your computer to recharge overnight.  In the morning, you will find all your favorite shows from your tivo loaded onto it. </p>

<p>DownloadDownload the image file.  Drag the iTiVo application to your Applications Folder, and run it from there.  Full Installation Document here. </p>

<p>iTiVo is free to use.  The source is available for anyone to browse and contribute to. I would appreciate bug reports in the &#39;issues&#39; tab above. 
<br/>ScreenshotsMain Page </p>

<p>Preferences Pane open, with tivo info, and formats dropdown </p>

<p>Support / FAQThere is a main help page.  Please read it and the FAQ if you&#39;re having problems.  If nothing answers your question, either post a bug report under &#39;issues&#39; above, or post to the TiVo Community forum. 
<br/>historyThis program is a continuation of the tivodecode manager program by David Benesch.  The old program was unsupported and had issues under Leopard and with Tivo3&#39;s.  However, this is not a full-time supported program.  It has many bugs, and may not do what you want.  Use at your own risk. </p>

<p>LinksUnderlying ToolsAs mentioned, iTiVo is simply a pretty front-end for a lot of tools written by other people.  Those tools (and relevant source code) are: </p>

<p>tivodecode is used to &#39;decrypt&#39; shows downloaded from the tivo. mencoder (part of the MPlayer package) is used to convert the shows to smaller files. etv-comskip is the mac port of the comskip project.  Used to figure out where the commercials are in the program. HandBrake provides an alternative encoder with its own ups and downs. t2sami is used to generate subtitles from closed caption info. </p>

<p>Other Useful ToolspyTivoX  is for doing the reverse of iTiVo (uploading or streaming any media file from your computer to your TiVo). MetaX will let you add information fields and tags (metadata) to the files you download with iTiVo.  You can add movie posters, additional useful info from imdb, or whatever. Tivo Tools Roundup maintains a long list of other tivo tools you may want to check out for your mac, including alternatives to iTiVo. TivoDecodeManager was the program from which iTiVo was derived.  It should run without issues on Tiger. If you want to view stuff you downloaded using &#39;decrypt&#39; as the format, you can try VLC, MPlayer OSX Extended (quicktime-like replacements) or Plex (a FrontRow replacement).</p>
 title : The j-vhs-flv-player Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>j-vhs flv player for mac &amp; pc is a free flv player working with os 8.6, os 9, os X, windows 98, windows NT 4.0, windows 2000, windows XP and windows Vista. Play your flash video files from your desktop in 2 clics.</p>
 title : The jpegtoavi-osx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>original project (sourceforge.net) </p>

<p>Installation (must have Developer Tools installed): </p>

<p>tar zxf ~/Downloads/jpegtoavi-1.5-osx.tar.gz cd ~/Downloads/jpegtoavi-1.5-osx/ make all sudo make install </p>

<p>It installs in /usr/local/bin and /usr/local/man/man1 </p>

<p>Please note: the original code is not mine; however, I&#39;ve made these changes to compile jpegtoavi on OS X: </p>

<p>Added endian.h as OS X&#39;s endian.h doesn&#39;t define &quot;BYTE_ORDER&quot; Added &quot;#include &quot; to jpegtoavi.c to define &quot;off64_t&quot; Initialized &#39;fd&#39; on line 209 of jpegtoavi.c (fixes compiler warning) Added the &quot;fnested-functions&quot; switch to the Makefile (fixes compiler warning) Added &quot;rm -f jpegtoavi&quot; to make target &#39;clean&#39; </p>

<p>All credit for this tool goes to the original author, Phillip.  Contact information for the original author can be found in the README file. </p>

<p>For a further usage example, please see: Manifest Density (manifestdensity.net)</p>

 title : The leptonica Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Leptonica LibraryThe library supports many operations that are useful onDocument images Natural images Fundamental image processing and image analysis operationsRasterop (aka bitblt) Affine transforms (scaling, translation, rotation, shear) on images of arbitrary pixel depth Binary and grayscale morphology, rank order filters, and convolution Seedfill and connected components Image transformations with changes in pixel depth, both at the same scale and with scale change Pixelwise masking, blending, enhancement, arithmetic ops, etc. Ancillary utilitiesI/O for standard image formats (jpg, png, tiff, bmp, pnm, gif, ps) Utilities to handle arrays of image-related data types (e.g., pixa, boxa, pta) Utilities for stacks, generic arrays, queues, heaps, lists; number and string arrays; etc. Examples of some applications enabled and implementedOctcube-based color quantization (w/ and w/out dithering) Modified median cut color quantization (w/ and w/out dithering) Skew determination of text images Segmentation of page images with mixed text and images jbig2 unsupervised classifier Border representations of 1 bit/pixel images and raster conversion for SVG Postscript wrapping (levels 1, 2) of images for device-independent output Connectivity-preserving thinning and thickening of 1 bit/pixel images Search for least-cost paths on binary and grayscale images Barcode reader for 1D barcodes (very early version as of 1.55) Implementation characteristicsEfficient: image data is packed binary (into 32-bit words); operations on 32-bit data whenever possible Simple: small number of data structures; simplest implementations provided that are efficient Consistent: data allocated on the heap with simple ownership rules; function names usually begin with primary data structure (e.g., pix) Robust: all ptr args checked; extensive use of accessors; exit not permitted Tested: thorough regression tests provided for most basic functions; valgrind tested Ansi C: automatically generated prototype header file Portable: endian-independent; builds in linux, osx, mingw, cygwin, windows Nearly thread-safe: no non-const global vars Documentation: large number of in-line comments; web pages for further background Examples: many programs provided to test and show usage of approx. 1600 functions in the library Open Source Projects that use Leptonicaphp  (scripting language for dynamic web pages) tesseract (optical character recognition) jbig2enc (encodes multipage binary image documents with jbig2 compression)</p>
 title : The librgs Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>An easy to use 2d game engine that provides a framework for creating old console-like games.</p>
 title : The libsrvrmgrd-osx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Apple OS X Servers run a command and control daemon on port 311 which uses XML to send and receive commands and report status. This is the native protocol used by Apple&#39;s own Server Manager application and talks over HTTPS. Using this library it&#39;s possible to get status updates from a server and send commands to restart services etc. </p>

<p>This code can be run from Linux (theoretically any OS with Python 2.5), Mac OS X and it should run with Windows also. It can talk to server versions of Panther, Tiger, Leopard and Snow Leopard (Older Versions May Work But I Have No Access To Them).</p>
 title : The loro-launcher Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>About LoroLoro is a new application currently only for Mac OSX Tiger. Loro bridges the gap between the keyboard and several of Tiger&#39;s functions such as searching and file browsing. Loro can also search the web and open applications. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>A typical Loro window </p>

 title : The Lekho: a unicode bangla(bengali) editor Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Lekho is a Bangla (Bengali) unicode editor. Runs on X11 (linux/unix,FreeBSD etc.) and windows. Uses QT. See webpage</p>
 summary : <p>News03/11/2009:  An update is in the works to address the problem below AND get msatcommander working in OS X Snow Leopard, where it currently does not work.  This required that I rewrite the back-end code using a new GUI framework, so it was time consuming and i apologize for the delay </p>

<p>12/22/2009:  It has been reported to me that the pig-tailing of primers on the OS X platform is causing problems (i,e. no primers are being tagged).  This issue may easily be overcome by choosing NOT to pigtail primers.  If this is unacceptable, please use version 0.8.1, instead.  However, be aware that you will not benefit from bug fixes introduced in 0.8.2.  </p>

<p>I will be looking into fixing the issue shortly... </p>

<p>8/21/09:  0.8.2 binaries are in the download area.  See Changelog for fixes and an enhancement. </p>

<p>8/21/09:  New changes uploaded to SVN, updating the code (mostly for windows) to deal with Python 2.5, BioPython 1.51, and wxPython.  Additionally, added mispriming library to remove issues where microsatellite repeats were selected as proper primer binding sites. </p>

<p>FeedbackIf you have constructive feedback (likes, dislikes, enhancements), please send an email to the list-serve.  All suggestions are welcomed and will be considered.    </p>

<p>Purposemsatcommander is a python program written to locate microsatellite (SSR, VNTR, &amp;c) repeats within fasta-formatted sequence or consensus files.  msatfinder will search for all di-, tri-, tetra-, penta-, and hexa-nucleotide repeats (with options to search for fewer repeat types and combinations of repeat types). </p>

<p>msatcommander will also design and tag primers using primer3 as its primer design engine (see References for citations).  Many thanks to the primer3 team, in general, and Steve Rozen, in particular.  Additional information regarding primer3 may also be found on the primer3 wiki. </p>

<p>CitationFaircloth, BC.  2008.  MSATCOMMANDER:  detection of microsatellite repeat arrays and automated, locus-specific primer design.  Molecular Ecology Resources 8:92-94.  doi:10.1111/j.1471-8286.2007.01884.x. </p>

<p>I would be more than happy to provide you with a pdf of the above, if needed. </p>

<p>Supported OSsNOTE:  msatcommander will not work on OS X &lt; 10.4.x </p>

<p>Apple OS X 10.4+Binary  Notes/README   Windows XP (SP2)  Binary  Notes/README  Unix-like OSs  SVN Checkout or tarball  Notes/README  </p>

<p>Differences from other programs searches for all mono-,di-,tri-,tetra-,penta-, and hexanucleotide repeats  repeats may be combined across user-specified distances (bp)  designs primers for located repeats  tags and tests primers with m13R, CAG, or custom tag.  The &#39;best&#39; primer is reported to the user  adds GTTT pigtails to the un-tagged, &#39;best&#39; primer reported to the user  offers a convenient GUI for a majority of users  outputs results in csv format, for easy importation to spreadsheet software Inputmsatcommander will read FASTA-formatted files of single or multiple sequences.  These files may end in &#39;.fsa&#39;, &#39;.fasta&#39;, or &#39;.txt&#39;. </p>

<p>OutputFor array searching, the user may select and name a specific output file.  When searching, designing, and/or tagging primers, the user must select or create and select a directory to contain the output.  In this case, the output consists of the following: </p>

<p>microsatSearchOutput.csv (contains microsatellite search results) primerCombined.csv  (optional; contains combined microsatellite search results) a primer3 directory formatted text files for each designed primer primerNoTag.csv (contains untagged primer sequences) primerTag.csv (optional; contains tagged primers)  </p>

<p>Reporting BugsPlease report bugs via the issues tab.  If you have a question about something that may be a bug, please send an email to the list-serve. </p>

<p>Aboutmsatcommander is written in python and makes use of the biopython and wxPython modules.  msatcommander uses primer3 as its primer design engine.  Primer3 source is C and Perl.  Primer3 was written by Steve Rozen and Helen Skaletsky.  primer3_core binaries (provided within the msatcommander binaries) are built specifically for each architecture (OSX or WindowsXP).  The primer3 OSX binary is universal.</p>

 title : The omron-osx-driver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Omron has a really nice pedometer, but the software is Windows-only. I want to write a reverse-engineered USB driver. </p>

<p>Here&#39;s what it looks like, courtesy of Amazon:  </p>

<p>Starting points: </p>

<p>The device is model number HJ-720ITC,  Reports on USB as &#39;HHX-CABLE-USB1&#39; Product ID 0x0028, Vendor ID 0x0590 </p>

<p>Preliminary plan: Run the bundled &#39;Omron Health Management Software&#39; under VMware/Parallels, trace the USB I/O, and reverse engineer away. Given the limited features, this should be do-able. </p>

<p>Others are interested too: http://www.mattcutts.com/blog/my-favorite-pedometer-omron-hj-720itc/ </p>

<p>Current state: The code walks the USB tree, opens the Omron and gets report zero. Next step is to experiment more with report downloads and start parsing the output. I&#39;m also going to contact the company to see if they&#39;ll release any protocol information. </p>

<p>Update 5/4/09: Kyle Machulis has documented the related Omron protocol, and it&#39;s a mess. Raw HID required, due to the hackish nature, and it may never work on OSX! See </p>

<p>http://qdot.github.com/libomron </p>

<p>And the code repository at </p>

<p>http://www.github.com/qdot/libomron </p>

<p>Update 9/15/09: Kyle has added support to his library, please see http://github.com/qdot/libomron/tree/hj-720it </p>

<p>For now, this project is idle, so Kyle&#39;s code is the place to go. </p>

<p>See wiki for more resources.</p>

 title : The usseg Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>主要目标及要求实现一个针对二维超声的图像分割程序 （此尚为初步功能实现，非发布版本） </p>

<p>能够读取RAW, mhd, mha, vtk, jpeg, bmp, tif, tiff, png等多种格式2D医学图像 拥有友好的GUI，具备完善的交互操作，如选取种子点，改变窗位(右击Viewer窗口调出)等 可导出分割后图像，及相应面积数据，显示在窗口下放状态栏 实现几种分割算法，目前以Level Set系列算法为主，并且易于扩展(2008.04.02) 导出PDF格式报告，对比各种分割算法结果及统计各区域面积(2008.04.03) </p>

<p>使用说明：调取图像-&gt;在灰图选种子点(每区域2－3个较为理想)-&gt;Process </p>

<p>目前情况添加PDF格式报告导出功能，包含原始图，每钟分割算法结果图及面积。(2008.04.03) </p>

<p>添加Geodesic Active Contour, Shape Detection分割算法；经整体重构，更易于添加新算法。(2008.04.30) </p>

<p>OSX下编译完成，不过VTK的universal编译有点问题，目前仅可运行于i386架构。（2008.03.30） </p>

<p>使用ITK实现图像分割, ITKfltk2DViewer和RGBViewer实现显示及交互，VTK实现vtk格式导出, FLTK实现GUI。  </p>

<p>完成基本GUI, 2D图像读取，Canny level set算法分割及交互，分割后mask的存储。 </p>

<p>提示，可通过选多个种子点，在很大程度上提高分割质量。 </p>

<p>通过增大域值，扩大增长区域。 </p>

<p>待改进内容重构Viewer, 融入进主窗口中 最好将2DViewer和RGBViewer合并，即同时实现交互和显示overlay 实现更多算法，如Voronoi 改进输出，使之可以输出原图+overlay 2008.03.18 以FLTK作为GUI, 一来是考虑最初开发的方便，二来也兼顾多平台，将来考虑转为Qt等 面积计算 2008.03.19 算法GeodesicActiveContour添加 分割结果PDF报告导出 2008.04.03 Process后，可再加新seeds，而不用clear 2008.04.03 Temp文件储存问题 2008.04.03 不能覆盖文件问题 2008.04.04 分区域面积计算 2008.04.04 增长区域过小问题 2008.04.03 实际距离设置 2008.04.04 在图中为各区域编号，排除过大或过小区域 2008.04.30 算法Shape Detection添加 2008.04.30 编译建议见此 </p>

<p>任何问题请联系Email: alanhoucts(at)gmail.com </p>

<p>msn:alanhou(at)sohu.com</p>
 title : The vicpack Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>vicpack is a command-line tool for converting regular images (PNG/GIF/TIFF/JPG) to C64 format. It exports to the most common formats like multicolor, hires, MCI, FLI and others. It can also generate runnable programs using the ACME assembler, available from http://www.esw-heim.tu-clausthal.de/~marco/smorbrod/acme/ </p>

<p>vicpack only does lossless conversion. It is made for pixel artists who work in Photoshop (or similar), and want to know that what they see is what they get. </p>

<p>If you want lossy conversion to multicolor, maybe these programs will meet your needs: </p>

<p>http://noname.c64.org/csdb/release/?id=52822 http://noname.c64.org/csdb/release/?id=30789</p>
 title : The vidnik Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Record video segments using your iSight camera and upload them to YouTube. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Featured download; The first release of Vidnik, version 0.13.0 </p>

<p>http://vidnik.googlecode.com/svn/images/Vidnik.zip </p>

<p>Vidnik is the quickest, simplest, way to make movies using the built - in camera on your Macintosh and upload those movies to your YouTube account. </p>

<p>WARNINGI&#39;ve gotten early reports, for some people, that the movies Vidnik makes work fine on the Macintosh, but when encoded by YouTube, the sound is a fraction of a second behind the picture. I&#39;ve reproduced the problem. </p>

<p>I&#39;m looking in to this. </p>

<p>Quicktime is producing MPEG-4 encoded movies with an edit list. The first displayable frame of the movie is a  b-frame, not an i-frame. Other transcoders and players, when they encounter such movies, drop the initial sequence of b-frames from the video. I&#39;m making a change to Vidnik detect that the first displayable frame is not an i-frame, and rewrite those movies, such that the first frame is an i-frame. I&#39;ll test, then upload a new version. </p>

<p>-- David Phillip Oster May 16, 2008 2:43 PM PDT</p>

 title : The vocito Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Vocito is a desktop UI for GrandCentral for the Mac. It allows you to easily dial anybody from your desktop. Using GrandCentral it will dial the remote phone and your local phone simultaneously, and connect you together. </p>

<p>Please note that Vocito does not work with Google Voice at this time. </p>

<p>I will update it to work with Voice as soon as I have time. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>It integrates into Address Book, Quicksilver, Automater, system services, supports &quot;tel&quot; URLs, and is fully AppleScriptable.  </p>

<p>  </p>

<p>All this integration makes it easy to have Vocito automatically dial your phone from just about any application that supports scripting, html, or Automator actions. For example, you can easily set up your iCal meeting appointment to automatically dial the conference call for you at the correct time. </p>

<p>Vocito also allows you to save little applets that will automatically dial the phone for you with a simple double click. </p>

<p>Since GrandCentral is currently in a limited beta, we don&#39;t have any more invites to hand out right now. So those of you without a GrandCentral number don&#39;t get to play just yet, but please reserve your number now to get in on the action as soon as more invites become available. </p>

<p>Vocito is available here for download. It works on Tiger and Leopard, is both PowerPC and Intel native, and is fully open sourced. There is a discussion group at vocito-discuss on Google Groups, and an FAQ. If you need help using Vocito, check out our ever growing documentation page at VocitoHelp. If you can&#39;t find what you are looking for, please post to vocito-discuss and we&#39;ll get back to you ASAP.</p>
 title : The volturnus Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Command line and graphical address book written in Python. Development is still in its early stages but all are welcome to test and provide feedback! </p>

<p>NewsDec 11, 2008 - Changes! </p>

<p>Only one change - I have switched to Mercurial and Bitbucket for my source control and hosting needs. The project is now hosted here: http://www.bitbucket.org/vansmith/volturnus/ </p>

<p>Apr. 10 2008 - Volturnus v2 </p>

<p>That&#39;s right, version 2. Version 2 is not so much an update but a remake. The GUI code and the associated CLI code have been moved into the volturnus_v1/ folder for &quot;storage&quot;. The GUI will be maintained by Richard and I will work exclusively on v2 which will be CLI focused. Thus, the project focus is now, like it was in the beginning, focused on producing a CLI address book first and then a GUI if time permits. Version 2 does not denote much new in terms of functions or concepts. The v2 code is a rewrite of v1 code as I thought the v1 code was getting a little sloppy and I saw it easier to rewrite than cleanup. In the beginning, v2 will look a lot like v1 (as v2 will be based off of v1) but it will shift dramatically as I clean up the code. In other words, it&#39;s not a rewrite from scratch. The lookup now doesn&#39;t depend on an exact match - if you are looking for &quot;Smith&quot; you don&#39;t have to search Smith, you can search &quot;smi&quot; or &quot;ith&quot; for instance. This was only a minor fix but will be one of many to come. I am hoping v2 will provide the base for a stable release. You may also notice that you input &quot;commands&quot; now to interact with contacts. For instance, if you want to delete a contact, you don&#39;t choose option &quot;b&quot;, you would type &quot;del&quot;. As a frequent user of the CLI in Linux, I appreciate commands as opposed to simply letters. There is a new snapshot available for download. It is revision 106. </p>

<p>Feb. 8 2008 - GUI design done </p>

<p>The design for the GUI is done. All focus now will be on cleaning up the code and fixing all outstanding errors.  </p>

<p>Jan. 18 2008 - New Features and Snapshot </p>

<p>It&#39;s been a while but I did much less with the program over the Christmas season than I had intended (in fact, I think I did nothing). Included with this snapshot (r65) is a new import/export feature that allows you to export your db so you can import it elsewhere. The new features lack comments right now but those will be added shortly. I&#39;m more interested to see if the code works. There are still some issues with the add and delete names if someone chooses not to enter details (pushes esc). The program will not quit but errors will be reported. I want the code to be clean so these are the next priority.</p>

 summary : <p>WordPod lets you convert plain text ebooks so they can be read from an iPod.</p>

 title : The xero1 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This is for all the Mac users having problems installing the PSPSDK. </p>

<p>Note: </p>

<p>This is only for Intel Mac&#39;s, because building a universal version is too hard, and Apple will stop supporting PowerPC Mac&#39;s once OS 10.6 is released. </p>

<p>About: </p>

<p>Full PS2Dev.org SVN PSPSDK up to date. </p>

<p>All the build tools are included, so updating is not a problem. </p>

<p>All libs up to date. </p>

<p>PRXTool included. </p>

<p>Scripts I added: </p>

<p>sudo update-sdk_full (Will build the hole SDK) </p>

<p>sudo update-sdk (Will only do a SDK update) </p>

<p>sudo update-libs (Will build all the SDK libs) </p>

<p>Also included: </p>

<p>sudo svn-sclean (To clean clean the .svn folder so updating is quicker) </p>

<p>sudo clean-work (To delete everything in the SDK work folder) </p>

<p>Note on the SDK scripts: </p>

<p>You only need to run &quot;update-sdk_full&quot; if GCC, or newlib is changed/updated. </p>

<p>Requirements </p>

<p>1. An Intel Mac :P </p>

<p>2. XCode 3 installed, 3.1 would be better. </p>

<p>3. 1.4GB of hard drive space for the SDK, and build tools. </p>

<p>    </p>

<p>New download v0.2b </p>

<p>2nd link for New download v0.2b  </p>

<p>v0.2b is 200MB smaller installed @ 1.2GB </p>

<p>v0.2a the install took 1.4GB</p>

 title : The zsh-templates-osx Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ZSH template filesThis is a collection of files that help the user to customize the zsh shell for the Mac OS X operating system. It is entirely optional and is not part of  the  zsh shell distribution. </p>

<p>It is designed to &quot;work out of the box&quot; but to be amenable to customization. </p>

<p>More details available at:  http://tinyurl.com/y3r4kp </p>

<p>To use the svn version on OS X:cd /Library 
<br/>sudo svn co http://zsh-templates-osx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Library/init 
<br/>cd /private 
<br/>sudo svn co http://zsh-templates-osx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/etc  
<br/>Then just start a new user shell (/bin/zsh -l) </p>

<p>To use the svn version on Linux:sudo mkdir /etc/zsh 
<br/>cd /etc/zsh 
<br/>sudo svn co http://zsh-templates-osx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Library/init 
<br/>cd /etc 
<br/>sudo svn co http://zsh-templates-osx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/etc zsh 
<br/>Then just start a new user shell (/bin/zsh -l)</p>

 title : The aaplot Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>aaplot</p>

<p> </p>

<p>old </p>

<p>Look Video   </p>

<p>aaplot is not stand-alone program. It is library/toolkit which help you to visualize (draw) your mathematical c-functions. </p>

<p>Advantages: No more syntax learning, just c. Some new functions and you are in. </p>

<p>NEW: sources can be used with windows too, see: http://code.google.com/p/aaplot/wiki/windows_MS </p>

<p>UsageWrite c-file: </p>

<p>#include &quot;aaplot.h&quot;</p>

<p>double f(double x) {
<br/>return 3*x*x + 4*x -5;
<br/>}</p>

<p>int main(){
<br/> addRFunction(0,&amp;f,0.01,&quot;My Function&quot;);
<br/> /* 0   = window number
<br/>   &amp;f   = pointer to predefined function
<br/>   0.01 = stepping of x 
<br/>   &quot;My Function&quot; = just some title
<br/>  */
<br/> drawAll();
<br/> return 0;
<br/>}Compile (gcc -lXpm -lpng -lGL) and run. You see your function on gl-rendered window. </p>

<p>Look API to see how add different kinds of functions/curves. http://code.google.com/p/aaplot/wiki/API </p>

<p>FeaturesScaling Rotating Zooming Screenshotting (with libpng) Menu Point selecting Coordinate planes (hide/unhide) Printing arrays (2D / 3D) Tables from files (2D / 3D) R-&gt;R functions (actually double, not real-number) R2-&gt;R functions R-&gt;R3 curves R2-&gt;R3 curves Functions and curves with or without parameters. </p>

<p>return a*x; /* line */
<br/>addRFunctionWithParameters(something);Unlimited functions in one window. Unlimited windows. </p>

<p>Browse sources online: http://lauta.dyndns.org/aaplot_src/index.html </p>

<p>(almost -ansi -Wall -pedantic)  </p>

<p>RequirementsI think easiest way to tell what you need is tell how to install them with Ubuntu. </p>

<p>If you want very latest version of aaplot, you need bazaar.  </p>

<p>sudo apt-get install bzr </p>

<p>get latest sources: bzr branch http://lauta.dyndns.org/aaplot  </p>

<p>You need libglu1-mesa-dev package (for gl.h) </p>

<p>sudo apt-get install libglu1-mesa-dev </p>

<p>If you want take screenshots, you need libpng. </p>

<p> sudo apt-get install libpng3-dev  (depending your ubuntu version, you might must select manually some other package of the given list) </p>

<p>If you want use very cool icon you need libXpm. </p>

<p> sudo apt-get install libxpm-dev  </p>

<p>Four parameterized curves (the red text is added with gimp).     Surface and curve.     aaplot 0.5     Menu: Hide/Unhide grid     Menu: All elements has own settings.</p>

 title : The borrow-direct-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Borrow-Direct provides a single, searchable catalog of the combined holdings of the Brown, Columbia, Cornell, Dartmouth, University of Pennsylvania, Princeton, and Yale libraries. </p>

<p>The catalog software provides a web-interface, but no API, which prevents allowing this terrific resource to be incorporated into an automated borrowing system. </p>

<p>We at the Brown University Library have developed a Java API to Borrow-Direct that allows us to search and initiate requests to Borrow-Direct. The really nice thing about this API is that it works as a web-service, so regardless of what language you primarily code in, you can automate ISBN-based searching and requesting simply by calling this API via a url. We at the Brown Library have used this API with great success for over six months as part of our &#39;easyBorrow&#39; system, documented at: </p>

<p>http://dl.lib.brown.edu/libweb/services/easyBorrow.php </p>

<p>and: </p>

<p>http://dl.lib.brown.edu/its/software/easyborrow/ </p>

<p>We intend to host this code at a Brown University Library Software subversion repository with anonymous checkout access, but while that is being set up we&#39;re offering it here. </p>

<p>Download: </p>

<p>http://code.google.com/p/borrow-direct-api/downloads/list </p>

<p>Info: </p>

<p>http://code.google.com/p/borrow-direct-api/w/list </p>

<p>Contact: </p>

<p>For questions about this code: birkin_diana@brown.edu For questions about how this code fits into our automated borrowing system: any of the team members listed here</p>

 title : The douban-api-examples Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Examples of douban-api </p>

<p>douban-api运行环境搭建及douban-api安装，请参考douban-api-installation </p>

<p>Examples of douban-php-client1，请先申请API_KEY，得到API_KEY和私钥。 </p>

<p>2，API认证授权。豆瓣API认证通过以下三个步骤完成： </p>

<p>a). 获取未授权的 Request Token 
<br/>b). 请求用户授权 Request Token 
<br/>c). 使用授权后的 Request Token 换取 Access Token 
<br/>Zend_Gdata_DouBan的方法programmaticLogin完成了上述过程，详细过程请参考代码。 </p>

<p>下列命令生成了一个Zend_Gdata_DouBan对象，并完成了豆瓣API认证过程： </p>

<p>$client = new Zend_Gdata_DouBan($api, $secret);
<br/>$client-&gt;programmaticLogin();运行上述代码时，输出如下提示信息： </p>

<p>please paste the url in your webbrowser, complete the authorization then come back:
<br/>http://www.douban.com/service/auth/authorize?oauth_token=5d6f7b964ef6f60c184e72c2ece4e224
<br/>将上述url连接拷贝到浏览器，进入到douban api认证授权页面，点击同意，即可完成对本次api访问的授权。 </p>

<p>3，正常的douban api操作。完成上述认证过程，即可使用Zend_Gdata_DouBan所提供各种接口进行操作，下面例举了几个简单应用： </p>

<p>$peopleEntry = $client-&gt;getPeople(&#39;ahbei&#39;);
<br/>assert ($peopleEntry-&gt;getId() == &#39;http://api.douban.com/people/1000001&#39;);
<br/>assert ($peopleEntry-&gt;getLocation()-&gt;getText() == &#39;北京&#39;);
<br/>assert ($peopleEntry-&gt;getTitle()-&gt;getText() == &#39;阿北&#39;);</p>

<p>$peopleFeed = $this-&gt;_client-&gt;searchPeople(&#39;boy&#39;, 2, 10);
<br/>$arr = $peopleFeed-&gt;getEntry();
<br/>$arr_title = array();
<br/>foreach ($arr as $entry) {
<br/>    if ($entry-&gt;getTitle()) {
<br/>        $arr_title[$entry-&gt;getTitle()-&gt;getText()] = 1;
<br/>    }
<br/>}
<br/>assert (array_key_exists(&#39;cow-boy&#39;, $arr_title));</p>

<p>$peopleEntry = $client-&gt;getAuthorizedUid();
<br/>assert ($peopleEntry-&gt;getUid()-&gt;getText() == &quot;2463802&quot;);</p>

<p>$peopleFeed = $this-&gt;_client-&gt;GetFriends(&quot;2463802&quot;);
<br/>$arr = $peopleFeed-&gt;getEntry();
<br/>$uid_arr = array();
<br/>foreach ($arr as $entry) {
<br/>    if ($entry-&gt;getUid()) {
<br/>        $uid_arr[$entry-&gt;getUid()-&gt;getText()] = 1;
<br/>    }
<br/>}
<br/>assert (array_key_exists(&quot;jili8&quot;, $uid_arr));更多使用示例，请参考test_douban.php </p>

<p>Examples of douban-python-client1，请先申请API_KEY，得到API_KEY和私钥。 </p>

<p>2，如下命令完成了API认证过程： </p>

<p>client = douban.service.DoubanService(server=SERVER, api_key=API_KEY,secret=SECRET)
<br/>client.ProgrammaticLogin(token_key=TOKEN_KEY,token_secret=TOKEN_SECRET)运行上述代码时，输出如下提示信息： </p>

<p>please paste the url in your webbrowser, complete the authorization then come back:
<br/>http://www.douban.com/service/auth/authorize?oauth_token=5d6f7b964ef6f60c184e72c2ece4e224
<br/>将上述url连接拷贝到浏览器，进入到douban api认证授权页面，点击同意，即可完成对本次api访问的授权。 </p>

<p>3，正常的api操作。下面例举了几个简单的应用： </p>

<p>people = client.GetPeople(&#39;/people/1000001&#39;)
<br/>assert people.uid.text == &#39;ahbei&#39;
<br/>assert people.title.text == &quot;阿北&quot;
<br/>assert people.location.text == &quot;北京&quot;</p>

<p>feed = client.SearchPeople(&quot;阿北&quot;)
<br/>assert any( e.title.text == &quot;阿北&quot; for e in feed.entry)</p>

<p>people = client.GetAuthorizedUID(&#39;/people/@me&#39;)
<br/>assert people.uid.text == &#39;2463802&#39;更多示例，请参考test_service.py</p>

I&#39;ve contacted them but at this time they don&#39;t want to change it. The API relies on FFFFOUND&#39;s RSS feeds but also on the site&#39;s pages&#39; HTML, so some functionalities might break at any time without warning. Use with caution.  title : The ffwd-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The FFWD API provides a RESTful way of interacting with the FFWD website from other applications or widgets. </p>

<p>The API will be designed to allow developers to: </p>

<p>Make requests from our site using a standard REST-based API that returns data in either XML or JSON formats Interact with your FFWD profile directly through other applications and widgets Get live updates on what people are watching on FFWD RequirementsBefore using our API, we require that you are an active Beta user, and that you have a valid developer API key. </p>

<p>If you&#39;re not already a FFWD member, you need to sign up for a Beta account first. </p>

<p>If you are already a member, you need to request a developer key. </p>

<p>DocumentationWe currently have documentation available for version 1 (beta) of our API and will be updating it as new API features are released. </p>

 summary : <p>Flickr::API::Rest is a simple Perl module for accessing the Flickr API. </p>

<p>NB: make test will fail right now - I&#39;ll fix that up some time. :-) </p>

<p>Synopsis
<br/>        my $api_key = &#39;api_key_here&#39;;
<br/>        my $secret  = &#39;secret_here&#39;;</p>

<p>        my $flickr = new Flickr::API::Rest($api_key, $secret);</p>

<p>        # call flickr.photos.getContactsPhotos
<br/>        my $args = {
<br/>                count =&gt; 6,
<br/>                single_photo =&gt; 1,      
<br/>        };
<br/>        my $response = $flickr-&gt;flickr_photos_getContactsPhotos($args, 1);</p>

<p>        # $response contains reference to hash containing parsed XML response</p>

 summary : <p>This project contains the .NET client for the Friendster API platform. For more information about the Friendster API platform, navigate to http://www.friendster.com/developer. </p>

<p>The .NET client has support for the following APIs: </p>

<p>/token POST Create a new token that can be exchanged for a session after the user logs in.  /session POST Create a new API Session.  /user GET Get User Information for the logged in user.  /user/:uids GET Get User Information for users in :uids list.  /application/friends GET Get friends who also installed the current application.  /fans/:uid GET Get a fan profile&#39;s fan list.  /friends/:uid GET Get user&#39;s friend list.  /depth/:uid1,:uid2 GET Get relation depth (distance) between two users.  /photos/:uid GET Get user&#39;s photos.  /photos/ GET Get photos for the current logged in user.  /photos/:uid POST Uploads a photo for the specified user.  /photos/ POST Uploads a photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:uid/:pid GET Get a user&#39;s photo.  /photo/:pid GET Get a photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:pid PUT Modify photo attributes.  /primaryphoto/:uid GET Get a user&#39;s primary photo.  /primaryphoto/ GET Get the primary photo for the current logged in user.  /photo/:pid DELETE Deletes a user&#39;s photos.  /albums/:uid GET Gets the user&#39;s albums.  /albums/ GET Gets the current user&#39;s albums.  /album/ POST Creates an album.  /album/:aid DELETE Deletes an album.  /shoutout/:uid GET Get a user&#39;s shoutout  /shoutout/ GET Get the shoutout for the current user.  /shoutout/ POST Update a user&#39;s shoutout.  /widget POST Update widget&#39;s profile content for the logged in user.  /widget GET Get widget content and title for the logged in user.  /notification POST Post a notification</p>
 title : The friendster-dotnet-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>FutureWidget is a modern JavaScript framework for widgets. Preference management is a core function as well as widget flipping and button creation. Every behavior and event has a callback for you to take advantage of.  All functions of the FutureWidget framework are highly optimized and designed for maximum reusability. </p>

<p>FutureWidget also allows you to simulate the Dashboard in any browser. This means you can replicate any behavior from the dashboard, right in your browser. This leads to easy JavaScript debugging and style tweaking right in the browser. </p>

<p>FutureWidget is build safely using the Singleton pattern with public and private methods and variables. This frame and development environment is not dependent on any JavaScript library.</p>

 title : The ideo-multitouch Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Multitouch Package for Flash &amp; Processing by labs.ideo.com </p>

<p>Created to enable designers to explore multitouch interactions quickly and easily, this package includes all requisite software to build a lightweight multitouch system. </p>

<p>This package is comprised of two parts: </p>

<p>Multitouch Client – A multitouch API for Flash including support for extensible touch actions, arbitrarily sized displays, and a limitless number of active fingers. Software simulated touch events are also supported to allow for software to be tested and developed on computers lacking multitouch hardware. The Multitouch Client API is built in ActionScript 2 and communicates with the Multitouch Server via network socket connection. </p>

<p>Multitouch Server – There are currently two alternatives for the back-end server: </p>

<p>FTIRA camera-based computer vision system that optically recognizes multitouch input, serializing it for transmission to the Multitouch Client. It has an interactive calibration routine to effectively overcome camera alignment and fisheye lens distortion. Implemented in Processing, it uses open source libraries and Processing&#39;s net library.  </p>

<p>Originally created for use with popular low-cost DIY FTIR setups (see nuigroup for information on assembling your own FTIR hardware), this software can also be easily modified to work with commercially available systems by implementing the Multitouch Server Protocol over a socket server.  </p>

<p>WiiMoteA wiiMote based multitouch server which uses the infrared camera in the wiiMote along with hand-held IR lights to track several points. Information on building suitable light pens is available here and here and here and you can buy readymade pens here for $8.    </p>

<p>Example Code (Client) </p>

<p>The following example illustrates how to enable a movieclip to be dragged using one finger or dragged, scaled, and rotated using two fingers. The screenshot below displays this example code as applied to a colored square. </p>

<p>import com.ideo.MultiTouch.*;
<br/>import com.ideo.MultiTouch.TouchActions.*;</p>

<p>// create finger manager
<br/>var fingerManager = new FingerManager(this);</p>

<p>// connect finger manager to finger server
<br/>var fingerClient = new FingerClient(fingerManager, &quot;localhost&quot;, 11000);</p>

<p>// create finger simulator
<br/>var fingerSimulator = new FingerSimulator(fingerManager);</p>

<p>// create touch manager
<br/>var touchManager = new TouchManager(fingerManager);</p>

<p>// make movieclip touchable
<br/>touchManager.makeTouchable(myMovieClip);</p>

<p>// assign touch actions for movieclip
<br/>new OneFingerDragger(myMovieClip);
<br/>new TwoFingerManipulator(myMovieClip);Refer to the project wiki for class documentation and more sample code.  Some more complex examples of interfaces built with this package are shown in this video. </p>

<p>Multitouch Simulator </p>

<p>Touch events can be simulated in the Flash environment to allow multitouch software to be developed without or while away from multitouch hardware. Touch events are simulated by way of keyboard chording. The number keys place virtual fingerprints on the stage that can be dragged with the mouse. Visible fingerprints are also useful for debugging multitouch hardware calibration and screen registration.</p>
 title : The ifile-api Open Source Project on Open Hub
