 summary : <p>&amp;nbsp; ap.php is a php5 framework to build rapid website prototypes. Main goals are to provide common design tools, as database access, authentication and debug helpers. apphp has essential built-in modules and can easily add more.   </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Features </p>

<p>Apphp is easy to deploy, it&#39;s just a single php file.  </p>

<p>A very clean and smart debug page, created for web dev, all plugins have explicit exceptions. All php standard errors are transformed into catchables exceptions, even FATAL ones. </p>

<p>&lt;?php</p>

<p>$a = 2;</p>

<p>App::start(array(
<br/>    &#39;/login/&#39;             =&gt; &#39;login&#39;,
<br/>    &#39;/logout/&#39;            =&gt; &#39;logout&#39;,
<br/>    &#39;/hello/$name:login/&#39; =&gt; &#39;hello#hello&#39;,
<br/>    &#39;/login/return/&#39;      =&gt; &#39;login_return&#39;,
<br/>    &#39;/say/$hello:&#39;        =&gt; &#39;text&#39;
<br/>));
<br/>?&gt;simple HTTP and file-based cache system, to keep performance over stream &amp; vars.  </p>

<p> if( in_cache($b = cache_get(&#39;bob&#39;,$bob))) print $bob;
<br/> else cache_set(&#39;bob&#39;,$bob); </p>

<p>No direct template engine, just PHP, but you can easy plug yours in. </p>

<p>Session based flash message </p>

<p> Flash::notice(&#39;Hello&#39;); // or say(&#39;Hello&#39;)
<br/> Flash::store($my_form_values,&#39;optionnal_key&#39;);
<br/> messages(); // or if(has_messages()) Flash::notice() </p>

<p>Easy DB connection via PDO string, build clean query, SQL free </p>

<p> $user = db(&#39;users&#39;)-&gt;get(&#39;id=&#39;,2);
<br/> $bad_users = db(&#39;users&#39;)-&gt;filter(&#39;mood !=&#39;,$mood)-&gt;all(); </p>

<p>A simple OO cURL interface to make HTTP requests </p>

<p> $url = new URL(&#39;http://example.com/api&#39;);
<br/> $url-&gt;post = true;
<br/> $url-&gt;postfields = array(&#39;key&#39;=&gt;&#39;782977987978&#39;);
<br/> $response = $url-&gt;exec();
<br/> // or simply 
<br/> $response = URL::POST(&#39;http://example.com&#39;,array(&#39;key&#39;=&gt;345224)); </p>

<p>Simple &amp; Modularap.php is a single php file, but with his simple module brigde, it&#39;s easy to add your own. A plugin file as SiteMap.php containing an exactly similar class SiteMap, associated with related exceptions SiteMapException, is a correct plugin.</p>
 title : The apphp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The applicant-doc-merge Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This project provides code that can be used in conjunction with other open source projects in order to merge HR job applicant attachments into a single PDF file. The following document formats are currently supported: </p>

<p>Microsoft Word (.doc) Rich Text Format (.rtf) Portable Document Format (.pdf) Open Office Writer (.odt) TIF image (.tif) JPG image (.jpg) This project would be used in conjunction with a Recruiting system (such as Oracle/PeopleSoft Human Capital Management).  Most Recruiting systems enable applicants to store attachments such as resumes, CV&#39;s, reference, transcripts and other miscellaneous documents.  One common complaint Human Resource users have of such systems is that it is difficult to review applicant applicants because they must open each attachment individually in order to review.  This project helps to streamline the process by providing a way to extract the various attachments, convert them to PDF format, and merge them into a single PDF document that a hiring team can review. </p>

<p>FAQ 
<br/>ProjectRoadmap 
<br/>Documentation</p>
 title : The arkinventory Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Beta Versionsensure you make a backup copy of your saved variables file before installing a beta version - you cannot revert back to an older version without that backup. </p>

<p>your saved variable file is normally located in \World of Warcraft\WTF\Account\yourwowaccountname\SavedVariables\ArkInventory.lua </p>

<p>a simple way to back it up is to just do a copy and paste then rename the new file (using the version number of AI is a good idea), eg ArkInventory-3-01-09.lua </p>

<p>AboutArkInventory (AI or ARKINV) is an inventory mod that was based off EngInventory when the BtS 2.0.0 patch came out and I needed a working replacement. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>AI&#39;s display windows are built from &quot;virtual bars&quot;, you assign categories (either the default ones or ones you create via rules) to bars so that items in that category are displayed on the specific bars you want. There is no limit to the number of bars you can have inside a window but obviously you only have so much screen real estate before it becomes &quot;too many&quot;. </p>

<p>AI uses several methods to assign a default category to an item such as what professions you have, tooltip scanning, basic type/subtype and PeriodicTable. You then assign those categories to a virtual bar. </p>

<p>As the default categories are not perfect, nor will they be correct for the way some people play, you can over-ride them by creating a rule that matches either a single or multiple items. </p>

<p>KeybindingsAI will toggle via B (the default backpack open) or any other key you have assigned to open the backpack (so long as the Blizzard Bag/Bank frames are being hidden).  There are also keybinding choices to various other parts and functions from AI. </p>

<p>To access your Keybindings; </p>

<p>Press ESCAPE to bring up the blizzard menu. click on Key Bindings. scroll down to ArkInventory. bind the keys you want to use (or unbind if required).  Reporting BugsBefore reporting a bug please check the FAQ and the issues list to see if the bug you are about to report has already been reported (or dealt with). </p>

<p>After checking that your bug hasn&#39;t been reported you can create a new issue. </p>

<p>When entering an issue please make sure that you include the following; </p>

<p>the AI version number (not the svn revision number). AI won&#39;t have mid version releases, except betas, and those will have beta version numbers. the version of WoW. what language (if not english). a screenshot for visual bugs (if you can&#39;t explain it clearly). the error message(s) (if you have an error mod installed then the entire stack trace would be even better). Known Issuesreplacing a larger bag with a smaller bag can leave some items highlighted (if bag highlight is enabled) moving an item from one guild bank tab to another will leave a ghost item behind until you view that tab again (it also increases the tooltip count for that ghost item). honor token icon displays the faction for the logged on character, not the displayed character Version HistoryIf you really want to see what got changed in each revision there is a VersionHistory.txt file included that has all those details. </p>

<p>To Do ListCurrently empty, or at least nothing major. ReadMe.txt may have some entries. </p>

<p>ScreenshotsAccessing the Options Menueither through the blizzard addon menu system or you can assign a keybinding to open ArkInventory&#39;s options menu directly. </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Bag </p>

<p>Title frame: consists of the main icon, clicking on which will bring up the main menu, then the current characters name is displayed (in green for online and red for offline), lastly followed by several smaller icons which allow you to toggle the other display windows (as well as the current one), the close icon is obvious - this frame can be hidden if not required Search frame: enter search text - this frame can be hidden if not required Container frame: where your bars and items are displayed Bag Changer frame: allows you to move, swap, add or remove a bag (it mirrors the same functionality that the Blizzard frame has) - note that while you have this frame displayed everything needs to be recalculated to cater for a lack of API functionality that can tell me when you&#39;ve moved a bag so it will be slightly slower with this opened.  when you move the mouse over one of the bags it will highlight all the slots in that bag (you can change the colour if you need to). this frame can be hidden if not required Status frame: is for showing how many empty slots you have remaining, if you only have normal bags you&#39;ll only have a single xx/yy (where xx is the number of empty slots and yy is the total number of slots), if you have profession, ammo or soulshard bags you will also see xx/yy variants for each type of bag, it also has the standard gold frame - this frame can be hidden if not required.  You can also format the emply slot status text via the config menus under Settings &gt; Empty Slots &gt; Display Format Keyring </p>

<p>It would appear we have 32 keyring slots even though the default Blizzard container only ever shows the smallest number of slots possible (rounded up to a factor of 4). Note that their may be internal code that restricts the number of keyring slots you can actually access but as the Blizzard API is currently telling AI that there are 32 slots that&#39;s what it displays. Bank (in offline mode) </p>

<p>The character name will be shown in red (instead of green) and the item icons are faded when you are viewing a bag, bank or keyring in offline mode. The item fading is an option that you can turn off if you want to see them at their normally displayed (alpha) level Guild Bank </p>

<p>The above shows a user with guild leader access. total guild gold is displayed in the status window. Mail </p>

<p>currently view only </p>

<p>Wearing </p>

<p>currently view only </p>

<p>Pets </p>

<p>Mounts </p>

<p>Tokens </p>

<p>SearchingLocally </p>

<p>ensure that the search frame is not hidden (config menu, settings page) </p>

<p>searching is done against an items name.  you can use LUA string patterns, see (link) </p>

<p>enter any text in the search field, as you enter a character any items that do not match are faded so that those that do are more obvious.  there is also a clear button on the right hand side that you can click on the clear the search text. (you can also just delete it manually) </p>

<p>Globallyrequires that the tooltip option to show item counts is enabled (otherwise all you get is a big list of items that you and all your alts have with no way of seeing whats where) </p>

<p>chat link and dressup clicks are functional </p>

<p> </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Custom Categories </p>

<p>Custom categories are easy, fast, and efficient.  You create a custom categories via the configuration menu, and then just assign items to that custom category. </p>

<p>They do have one downside and that is that they are very basic, they only match against an items ID and soulbound status so where you have an unbound item with an, eg, &quot;of the Wolf&quot; or &quot;of the Owl&quot; sufix, or the same soulbound item but with different enchants/jewels applied then both items would be assigned to the same custom category. </p>

<p>If you need that level of differentiation then you will need to create a Rule to handle it. </p>

<p>RulesWhat are rules? Rules let you to categorise your items exactly the way you want to by allowing you to use various bits of item data to write a formula that will match that item (and others like it). </p>

<p>Once you have your rule created you simply assign it to the bar of your choice so that the items that match the rule will are displayed on that bar.  Allowable rule functions can be found here and some example rules can be found here </p>

<p>Rules are global, that is every profile can see every rule you create, they can be enabled or disabled per profile and are set to disabled by default when you create a new profile. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>BasicsRule: the number assigned to this rule. you cannot modify this value. rule numbers are assigned sequentially. </p>

<p>Enabled: tick this if you want the rule to be used. disabled rules are ignored. default value is ticked. </p>

<p>Order: rules are processed in ascending numerical order based on this value. default value is 0. if you find that another rule keeps picking up an item you want elsewhere then you would create another rule with a lower order to place it in the proper location. rules with the same order number are processed in a potentially random sequence (or at least one that cannot be known beforehand) so only reuse the same order number if the rules would not have any overlapping items. </p>

<p>Description: a description of the rule. </p>

<p>Formula: a formula that defines which items match a rule, defaults to false. </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Data Broker Objectsif you have one of the display mods that can use LibDataBroker objects then you can add any of the objects provided by ArkInventory to it.  Bags, Ammo, Currency, Pets, Mounts.  see the LDB page for more info.</p>

 title : The bluntarchitecture Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Blunt Architecture project is a lightweight web application framework showcasing ALT.NET best practices such as: </p>

<p>Domain driven design Test driven development Inversion of control / dependency injection Model, view, controller The Blunt Architecture project is based off of the S#arp Architecture project.  Where the Blunt Architecture project differs is that it is meant to be used as a learning tool rather than a ready-for-production framework.  Because of this, the Blunt Architecture project strives to avoid outside dependencies wherever possible.  This allows the user to focus his or her attention on the concepts presented without the added distraction of also having to figure out the syntax and details of third party tools.  Although this constraint causes certain tasks to be more tedious (e.g. object relational mapping, dependency injection, etc.), it should make the project more approachable to users unfamiliar with the third party libraries commonly used for simplifying the implementation of these concepts (e.g. NHibernate, StructureMap, etc.). </p>

<p>The overall goal of the Blunt Architecture project is to present ALT.NET best practices in the easiest manner possible while allowing the user the flexibility to plug in whatever third party libraries they wish once they are comfortable with the framework. </p>

<p>Documentation for this project can be found here </p>

<p>To start playing around with the framework, you can download the latest release here or checkout the latest version of the code through Subversion at http://bluntarchitecture.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/</p>
 summary : <p>BSDRadiusBSDRadius is open source RADIUS server targeted for use in Voice over IP (VoIP) applications. While there are quite large number of Radius servers (including free) available in the world, little number of them (if any) are developed with !VoIP specific needs in mind. Typical !VoIP RADIUS server should be able to take high amount of AAA requests in short time periods, handle large databases, and respond timely to prevent time-outs and request retransmission cases. Most commonly used VoIP protocols (SIP and H.323) use small number of Authentication methods (e.g. CHAP and Digest), and this can allow reduce processing overhead and code size of server. </p>

<p>The server is released under the BSD license, which means that you are allowed to download, install, use and modify it at no charge. </p>

<p>Get the codeTo use the latest and greatest code of BSDRadius - use Subversion with command:    svn checkout https://bsdradius.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ bsdradius</p>

 title : The chartr Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>CharTr is an artistical software realized just for the fun of programming. It&#39;s a fork of labyrinth 0.3. Inspiration sources are vym and vim :). But apart from beeing artistic, it tries to give an answer to the problem of mind mapping, and aims to usability. </p>

<p>Quoting wikipedia : </p>

<p>A mind map is a diagram used to represent words, ideas, tasks, or other items linked to and arranged radially around a central key word or idea. It is used to generate, visualize, structure, and classify ideas, and as an aid in study, organization, problem solving, decision making, and writing. 
<br/>Prerequisites are python, pygtk (user interface), cairo (rendering), gstreamer (audio notes), python-plastex (math equations), and numpy. </p>

<p>basic mind map with curved links. folding of links. colors. outline box of several selected nodes. audio/text/images embedded as notes. automatic saving. svg,png,pdf,ps export. numerous keyboard shortcuts (with an eased keyboard navigation, vim like). bookmarking of ideas search for a text in nodes  More in the documentation page.</p>

 title : The contactsnearby Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Contacts Nearby application allows users to discover geographic locations of other people in their extended social network. Social networks or “friend graphs” are getting increasingly popular on the internet and allow applications to become aware of trust relationship between users. Combine this information with the geographical location of each user and you get a valuable tool in possible emergency situations.  </p>

<p>Imagine being on site at an emergency situation. You could well have the best aid workers or medical staff within a hands reach. The Contacts Nearby application gives you the ability to discover you have contacts in common and allows you to ask referrals from mutual contacts. This can accelerate finding useful contacts in your area and building trust with them.  </p>

<p>Key requirements:Allow you to specify your location via web, SMS, email - using a latitude and longitude or an address  Allow you to specify your privacy preferences for who is allowed see your current position.  Use an existing &quot;friend graph&quot; you might be maintaining on social networking sites like Facebook or LinkedIn  Allow you to query which contacts are nearby via the web, email or SMS, using maps and text messages  See &quot;contacts of contacts&quot; who are in the area  Ask the &quot;mutual contact&quot; for a referral or &quot;hookup&quot; email or message  You should receive updates when a contact enters your neighborhood.  This project takes advantage of the following technologies:Facebook as a provider for social information.  Google Maps for visualization of geographical information.  Google Maps Geocoding Services to translate addresses into positions.  InSTEDD’s Twitter Bot technology which enables communication over SMS messages.  An ASP.NET web application to integrate the application with Facebook.  Facebook.NET - an open source library for developing Facebook application with .NET.  Current Status:Currently the Friends Nearby application is available in beta and integrates with facebook’s social network capabilities. However future development should enable integration with any social network tool that supports the Open Social specification as well as tighter integration with InSTEDD’s directory and Identity store.  </p>

<p>Preview the Contacts Nearby application in facebook </p>

<p>About InSTEDD:As an independent, nonprofit organization, InSTEDD discovers, develops, evaluates, and distributes software and other technology-based tools to improve prediction, surveillance, preparedness, and response capabilities for those responding to global health threats, natural disasters, and human-caused emergencies. Visit our website at http://instedd.org. </p>

<p>Humanitarian aid workers:At InSTEDD we are continuously looking for feedback. Would you like to help us shape our requirements and stories from a humanitarian aid perspective? please visit our forum at http://instedd.org/techforums.</p>

 title : The cookcc Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>CookCC is a lexer and parser (LALR (1)) generator project, combined.  It is written in Java, but the target languages can vary. </p>

<p>CookCC comes with two unique features, which were the original motivations for this work. </p>

<p>CookCC uses a unique approach of storing and loading DFA tables in Java that significantly reduces the starting up time.  Many efforts have been made to maximize the generated Java lexer and parser performances, painstakingly line-by-line, case-by-case fine turning the lexer and parser code.  I believe that CookCC is the fastest lexer for Java (see the performance test). CookCC allows lexer/parser patterns and rules to be specified using Java annotation.  This feature greatly simplifies and eases the writing of lexer and parser for Java. Additionally, CookCC can produce highly compressed DFA tables. </p>

<p>CookCC requires JRE 1.5+ to run, but the generated Java code can be compiled and run with earlier versions of Java. </p>

<p>The current release is 0.3.3. </p>

<p>I am currently working on the island grammar on interfaces feature of 0.4, which is taking much longer than I anticipated. </p>

<p>Note: the BSD license only applies to CookCC itself.  The code generated belongs to you. </p>

<p>Road Map for 0.5add re2c-like direct code generation option for Lexer rather than only using table lookup (as of now). Possible mixed mode of execution to reduce table size (and code size), by reducing the number of states to be stored and possibly fewer equivalent classes. Performance gain for Java is questionable but I have thought out the way doing it. C and C++ code generation. More of the long term because right now I do not have need to do so.  The performance of flex for C is extremely difficult to beat anyways. What&#39;s New0.4 (Upcoming Release)added -extend option to set the parent class of the generated class updated debugLexer, debugLexerBackup, debugParser signature so that it is actually meaningful overload these debugging functions. &amp;nbsp;Issue 20&amp;nbsp;: allowed the start symbol to be specified in Java annotation input (by default it was the LHS of the first @Rule). Issue 19: allowed grammar on Java interfaces. &amp;nbsp;Issue 18&amp;nbsp;: added -generics option to generate Java code that use generics. &amp;nbsp;Issue 17&amp;nbsp;: added optional / optional list / list grammar shortcuts. Possible tree generator (grammar on Java annotations only) 0.3.3allowed the internal buffer to be automatically increased for long matches. &amp;nbsp;Issue 14&amp;nbsp;: added yyPushInput, yyPopInput, yyInputStackSize, yyWrap functions (and yywrap option). &amp;nbsp;Issue 13&amp;nbsp;: turn on backup lex state warning only when requested. &amp;nbsp;Issue 12&amp;nbsp;: added setBOL function to set the next token to be at BOL. &amp;nbsp;Issue 11&amp;nbsp;: yacc output does not have %start. &amp;nbsp;Issue 10&amp;nbsp;: yacc output fails on empty TokensDoc. 0.3.2added yacc grammar input and output. added yyPushLexerState and yyPopLexerState functions. added line number information for the error messages for Java input. added &quot;parserprolog&quot; section for the generated Java code. &amp;nbsp;Issue 9&amp;nbsp;: unable to handle &#39;\&#39;&#39; terminals in the grammar. &amp;nbsp;Issue 8&amp;nbsp;: incorrect lalr item lookahead calculation.  Now tested against bison using several major language grammars. &amp;nbsp;Issue 7&amp;nbsp;: disable APT compile for the CookCC Ant task to prevent class files from generated. &amp;nbsp;Issue 6&amp;nbsp;: erroneous warning of unreachable pattern when a lex pattern is shared among multiple lex states. &amp;nbsp;Issue 5&amp;nbsp;:  tag state attribute did not work. 0.3.1added single quoted literal string as lex patterns. 0.3added input using Java annotation. &amp;nbsp;Issue 2&amp;nbsp;: multiple incomplete state can cause internal lex error due to reassignment of the internal pattern case values. &amp;nbsp;Issue 1&amp;nbsp;: incorrectly generated parser if start non-terminal is not specified 0.2added parser generator. 0.1initial release.  Only includes lexer generator.</p>

 title : The datashelf Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>another bibliography manager, </p>
 summary : <p>jquery.datamaker.js provides an easy way to create Javascript Date objects using simple time interval indicators. Use datamaker to create Data objects to use with jQuery cookie plugin. </p>

<p>Time interval indicators are like those in Perl CGI::Cookie: &#39;+1M,&#39; &#39;-10d,&#39; etc., and Rails ActiveSupport-like time indicators: &#39;3.days.ago.&#39; A few named time indicators: &#39;midnight&#39; and &#39;now.&#39; Note that &#39;3.days.ago&#39; is a string, not a method on an integer. </p>

<p>Integrates with jQuery cookie plugin </p>

<p>$.cookie(&#39;cookie_name&#39;, &#39;cookie_value&#39;, { expires: $.datemaker(&#39;+1h&#39;) });</p>
 title : The datemaker Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The Outline Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Outline is a template engine for php.</p>

<p>Unlike other template engines, Outline is fast and light by design - rather than trying to reinvent the wheel, this engine tries to leverage the power of the template engine you already know: php.</p>

<p>Outline implements a practical, familiar template syntax, in about 1000 lines of code, giving you close to all of the functionality found in major template engines such as Smarty, Template Lite or Savant.</p>

<p>Many commands have a considerably shorter syntax than any of the major template engines - and a syntax that more closely resembles php.</p>

<p>Outline takes the practical, simple parts of php syntax, simplifies the more complex parts of php syntax, and adds the most common template syntax elements from large engines.</p>
 title : The dateslider Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This element enables you to pick dates with a simple slider bar. By dragging the bar over the time-line, the dates change instantly. Besides this, when the user decides to manually change the dates, the bar is automatically adjusted to the corresponding dates. As you are used to from us, the script is based on Prototype/Scriptaculous, but now combined with the DateJs library.</p>

 title : The evserver Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>EvServer is a lightweight http server, created especially to host python WSGI applications. Additionally, it supports little known Asynchronous WSGI extension, which was suggested by Christopher Stawarz. Using this extension it&#39;s possible to create an output html response in many data chunks, without blocking the main server process while your application waits for external resources. </p>

<p>EvServer is created on top of the battle tested libevent library. It should be bleeding fast and reasonably stable. </p>

<p>The long term goal for this project, is to create a tool that will allow to easily create scalable comet/http push web applications. </p>

<p>This server allows you to use comet in your WSGI applications.</p>

 title : The fdtkit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The goal of FDTKit is to help flash developers build and maintain a standard Eclipse/FDT environment through a centralized multi-platform toolkit of open source tools, libraries, scripts, templates and documentation. </p>

<p>While the toolkit is largely geared towards newcomers to Eclipse/FDT, and is some respects can be treated as a set of &#39;missing manuals and tools&#39;, the centralized collection of the various components that make up FDTKit should prove a worthwhile resource to anyone who desires a standardized central toolkit as a base for their IDE.  </p>

<p>In fact, FDTKit was created as I moved to (and learned) the Eclipse/FDT environment and desired to centralize the all the peripherals required to build a comfortable environment and keep them in sync between workstations via SVN. </p>

<p>FDTKit is distributed as an eclipse project via subversion which means you may Install FDTKit in to your existing eclipse/FDT environment or follow the Eclipse, FDT, Subclipse Install Guide to get your new environment up and running, and then Install FDTKit. </p>

<p>Additionally, because FDTKit is delivered thru subversion which eclipse supports via the Subclipse plugin - you can easily install and update FDTKit in just a few clicks of eclipse. </p>

<p>The FDTKit repository can also be viewed with a web browser.  </p>

<p>Important update notice: - FDT 3 has been released by powerflashers. FDTKit is currently waiting for an Open Source Project license to be granted by PowerFlashers in order to complete the porting and documentation to this new version. FDTKit is now fully FDT3 compatible; while most of the wiki pages still hold true slight modifications will be made to bring them up to date shortly. More coming soon ....</p>
 title : The fh3jsvalidator Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Look at http://fh3jsvalidator.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ for the latest version (0.5a)!! The downloadable zip file can be out of date. </p>

<p>I&#39;ve created a new javascript validation script which validates form fields. The validator methods are ported from the PHP Formhandler project </p>

<p>The javascript syntax is pretty simple: </p>

<p>window.onload = function(){
<br/>	// Add the elements to the validator
<br/>	Var Validator = new jsValidator();
<br/>	Validator.elmts = {
<br/>		name: {
<br/>			validator: &#39;IsString&#39;,
<br/>			msg: &#39;This field must be a valid string&#39;
<br/>		},
<br/>		age: {
<br/>			validator: &#39;IsDigit&#39;,
<br/>			msg: &#39;This field must be a digit&#39;
<br/>		},
<br/>		description: {
<br/>			validator: &#39;_IsText&#39;,
<br/>			msg: &#39;This textarea can be empty, or must be a valid text&#39;
<br/>		}	
<br/>	}
<br/>	// Fire the validator
<br/>	Validator.init();
<br/>}you can also create your own validate functions or your own regular expression </p>

<p>I&#39;ve also created an extend class for formhandler to auto generate the validation code.</p>

 title : The formup Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>O que é ?FormUp é uma classe em ActionScript 2.0 para tratamento de formulários em Flash sem o uso de componentes. </p>

<p>Por que?Criada para facilitar o desenvolvimento de formulários, visto que isso é muito trabalhoso em alguns casos. FormUp permite que você apenas crie a interface do formulário, e se preocupe com as animações e interações. Bastando especificar os tipos de campos utilizados, e ela faz a validação, cria máscaras e outras coisas. O principal objetivo é nos livrar da mão de obra de tratar os formulários com máscara, validação, tabIndex e todo o tramite de  enviar, pegar respostas e todas essas coisas. Ela trata formulários de qualquer tipo, os tornam seguros, nos deixando livre para cuidar de animações cores e efeitos. </p>

<p>Como?A class é apenas uma abstração do uso do objeto sendAndLoad para funcionar de maneira genérica, desde um simples formulário de contato até um grande form de cadastro com todos os tipos de dados comuns (file, passwd, radio, check, text...). Usando os eventos é possível definir qualquer ação pro form de acordo com a interação do usuário. E também é possível usar o AMFPHP, a class FormAmfUp dá o suporte para usarmos o amfphp, seguindo as regras de sua documentação. Também podemos usar qualquer outra linguagem de web server-side (PHP, ASP, JSP) etc. </p>

<p>ExemploImportando e iniciando o objeto </p>

<p>import FlashForm.FormUp;</p>

<p>var meuForm:FormUp = new FormUp();Definindo campos e outros parametros </p>

<p>meuForm._arrayField[0] = {mc:&#39;nome&#39;, required:true};
<br/>meuForm._arrayField[1] = {mc:&#39;email&#39;, fType:&#39;email&#39;, required:true};</p>

<p>meuForm._form = this;
<br/>meuForm._serverFile = &#39;cadastro.php&#39;;Ao iniciar </p>

<p>meuForm.onStart = function() {
<br/>    trace(&#39;Iniciado!&#39;);
<br/>};Após a validação, e antes do envio para o servidor </p>

<p>meuForm.onSend = function() {
<br/>    trace(&#39;Enviando...&#39;);
<br/>    this._afterSend.ready = true;
<br/>};Em caso de erro de preenchimento </p>

<p>meuForm.onError = function(arr) {
<br/>    trace(arr[0].mc);
<br/>    trace(arr[0].msg);
<br/>};Ao completar o envio </p>

<p>meuForm.onComplete = function() {
<br/>    trace(&#39;Concluído!&#39;);
<br/>};Iniciando o formulário </p>

<p>meuForm.init();Baixe exemplos com código.</p>

 title : The google-documentation-reader Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Reading web-based developer documentation is different than browsing typical web pages. As a developer, you probably refer to key technical doc many times per day, and you want it well-organized, easy to navigate, and -- above all -- fast. We&#39;re in the same boat! So we built a documentation viewer specially tailored for reading technical documentation. It works with any open source project hosted on Google Code. </p>

<p>You can use this documentation viewer as an easy way to read and author structured technical documentation. It builds on the existing wiki functionality available to every project hosted on Google Code. In addition to Google search, authors can easily define a table of contents and a list of index terms for their projects, providing readers with several ways to explore and understand complex technical material. </p>

<p>The structure of the documentation view helps readers quickly browse project documentation using a pleasant, unobtrusive user interface, designed with easy keyboard navigation, bookmarking and printing in mind. You can even combine projects together into a single documentation view by adjusting the URL to specify multiple projects, so you can look at several tables of contents, index entries, and search results all at once. </p>

<p>Drill down for more details. Happy reading and writing!</p>

 title : The gplotter Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>gplotter is a simple and light-weight graph plotting tool written in C++ using the GLUT API intended for programmers or students working with the graph data structure. It can visually plot graphs given the information about each edge. Weights are indicated over the edges. Selected edges may be highlighted. Nodes can be moved dynamically and snap/grid modes can be toggled to place nodes at fixed positions.</p>

 title : The hstemplate Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>HSTemplate is a web template system written in PHP. HSTemplate separates PHP, as a business logic, from HTML, a presentation logic. </p>

<p>This package implements a template engine with output caching support. </p>

<p>It can assign templates files a name so they can be referenced by that name. </p>

<p>The class loads from a given directory template files which are actual HTML files with embedded PHP code. </p>

<p>It can assign to each template, variables which are stored as class variables. </p>

<p>The templates are processed by turning template variables into local variables and then include the template file scripts. </p>

<p>The results of processed templates can be cached to avoid subsequent template processing overhead. </p>

<p>For more information see &#39;wiki&#39;</p>

 title : The informatica-powercenter-automation Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>GoalThe goal of this project is to provide a library that will allow automatic generation and automatic changing of Informatica Powercenter ETL Mappings. </p>

<p>Some of you may have noticed that after creating a handful of Informatica mappings, the process becomes very redundant. You may have also noticed that you&#39;re able to accomplish the task with little or no thought. The reason for this is that most mappings follow an existing pattern that you&#39;ve already learned, and are simply repeating with different inputs.  </p>

<p>The goal of this library is to provide the means to start to automate this mundane programming. If you&#39;re able to identify a pattern, you&#39;ll be able to code the pattern away reducing the cost of creating a mapping from days to minutes.  </p>

<p>Another common task is to change an Informatica Mapping. Something as simple as adding a column; can take hours or even days and may even prove error prone for large mappings. This library is able to read an existing Informatica Mapping, convert it into an object tree, allow your code to change it, and then spit it back out.  </p>

<p>As the library evolves, it will contain more and more patterns on top of the core automation library. Currently the only pattern included is adding a column to any mapping. If you build a pattern, and think it&#39;s reusable, send it to us, and we&#39;ll add it to the library.  </p>

<p>What about Mapfwk SDKSome of you maybe asking yourself, well, Informatica already provides a java automation library called mapfwk sdk. If you&#39;ve used it, you&#39;ll understand the need for a new  library. The mapfwk sdk is meant only for mapping generation, is quite obtuse, and not very well documented. Once you go beyond the obvious mapping, the SDK becomes extremely difficult to work with requiring, literally, decompiling of code.  </p>

<p>DesignThe core library consists of domain objects that represent the DTD provided by Informatica. The domain objects are mapped to the XML structure via JIBX. There is additional abstraction coded into the domain objects such as ability to treat target, source and transformation generically. On top of the core library, there are utility classes that codify common patterns, and actions.  </p>

<p>The library currently supports Informatica PowerCenter 8.1.1.</p>
 title : The Kylix Libs Packaging Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Applications developed with Kylix usually depend on some Kylix libraries. This project aims to create packages of these libraries for different distributions.</p>
 title : The insulatenoseplugin Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>When nosetests runs a sequence of tests and one of the tests crashes badly, i.e. causing python to terminate, all subsequent tests are aborted. </p>

<p>This plugin will run the tests in a master/slave model where the master starts a slave which actually runs the tests the master tells it to. If a test crashes the master will start a new slave and simply tell it to start at the test following the one that crashed. </p>

<p>See documentation for more info.</p>
 title : The iphucwin32 Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Jailbreak Not Working with Firmware 1.1.1  </p>

<p>WARNING The Current Binary has been tested with iTunesMobileDevice.dll thru 7.4.104 (iTunes 7.4.1 &amp; 7.4.2 use this dll) and iPhone firmware 1.0.2 if you are using an older binary or newer iTunes/iPhone software then something WILL go wrong. </p>

<p>This is a work project to port iphuc to Windows.  It is hoped that it will eventually fold into the iphuc project.</p>

 title : The itunes-overlay Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Objective/ProposalApple iTunes uses a service named Bonjour (formerly known as Rendez-Vous) to allow users on a local subnetwork to share their music. The purpose of this project is to allow users to share their music over greater distances, across networks, effectively creating an overlay network for iTunes. The project will not allow users to illegally download music, and is strictly a proof of concept. </p>

<p>Implementation:The implementation will be a P2P architecture with a central login/bootstrap server. It will consist of: </p>

<p>server: central login server client: the iTunes proxy server. A central buddy list will be available to everyone connected to the server, and the clients will use the server to establish direct connections between each other.</p>

 summary : <p>Works relatively well, although not much support for namespaces yet and most testcases are not implemented... Help needed! Important, NO preceeding axis is implemented (has to be reprogrammed to replace the missing ListIterator).</p>

<p>To use the package import the jar, and add  to your gwt.xml file.</p>

<p>Can be used like that:</p>

<p>String xmlString = &#39;success!&#39;;</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Document doc = XMLParser.parse(xmlString);</p>

<p>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;try {
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;BaseXPath xp = new GWTXPath(&#39;//b[@a=&#39;x&#39;]/text()&#39;);
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;List nodeList = xp.selectNodes(doc);
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Window.alert(((Text) nodeList.get(0)).getData());
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;} catch (JaxenException e) {
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;e.printStackTrace();
<br/>&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;}</p>

<br/>the directory for &#39;session.save_path&#39; parameter (php.ini) must be writeable

<br/>Not Compatible With Joomla! System Cache Enabled  </p>

<p>Системные требования Joomla Captcha: Joomla! 1.5.10, PHP 5 with GD 2, Apache or IIS, FireFox or IE.
<br/>каталог, указанный в параметре &#39;session.save_path&#39; (php.ini) должен быть доступен для записи
<br/>Примечание PHP 4 может работать стабильно, но не гарантировано во всех релизах) </p>

<p>Joomla Captcha - Why is that the best protection against bots and spam to your site?:Joomla Captcha - Почему это лучшая защита от роботов и спама?... Joomla Captcha - Warum ist das der beste Schutz gegen Spam-Bots geschutzt und auf Ihrer Website?:Joomla Captcha - Pourquoi est-ce la meilleure protection contre les robots et le spam de votre site?... Joomla Captcha - ???????????????,????????????????:Joomla Captcha - ????? ?? ?? ???? ????? ?? ?????? ?????? ?????? ??????? </p>

<p>Valid XHTML ( http://www.kupala.net/index.php?option=com_user&amp;view=login&amp;Itemid=2&amp;lang=en ) uses only two colors (hacking difficult); meets safety standards DIN 4 number of forms with a captcha on the same page is not restricted, each captcha working independently and for its form fully automatically; the source image does not have a stable size (hacking difficult); lets you control the size of the image visible on the page and lets you control the style and status for all elements using style sheets (css); allows you to set the real size using the parameters; maximum number of updates on current form no more than 10 (hacking difficult); does not contain characters that allow dual perception ( &quot;1&quot;, &quot;i&quot;, ...); number, size, and slope are easily installed in the parameters for all: code characters and noise characters; allows you to control the color of the text and background images to any site design simply change the settings; may use any fonts; interception captcha code impossible; is very very small, is super fast, AJAX; patch for Joomla! covers all components, and standard templates; does not contain direct call vulnerabilities that, if all installed patches for the components and modules; mode and place of use is easy to set in parameters; is simple for to include for other packages (To add to your form you need only two lines of code!); supports the current language and speaks in a language that matches the code page of the user...   Чистый XHTML ( http://www.kupala.net/index.php?option=com_user&amp;view=login&amp;Itemid=2&amp;lang=ru ) использует только два цвета и формат jpeg (взлом усложнен); соответствует стандартам безопасности DIN 4 количество форм с использованием каптчи на одной странице не ограничего, каждая каптча работает самостоятельно и для своей формы полностью автоматически; исходная картинка не имеет стабильного размера (взлом усложнен); позволяет устанавливать видимый размер картинки капчи на странице, а также стиль и положение всех элементов капчи при помощи таблицы стилей (css); позволяет устанавливать реальный размер с помощью параметров; максимальное количество обновлений на текущей форме не более 10 (взлом усложнен); не содержит символов, допускающих двоякое толкование ( &quot;1&quot;, &quot;i&quot;, ...); для символов кода и фона  их количество, размеры, и наклоны легко устанавливаются в параметрах; позволяет управлять цветом текста и фона картинки простой настройкой параметров плагина для любого дизайна сайта; возможно использовать любые шрифты; перехват кода каптчи невозможен; супер компактная и очень быстая, AJAX; патч для Joomla! охватывает все компоненты и стандартные шаблоны; не содержит уязвимостей прямого вызова, если установлены патчи для всех компонентов и модулей; режим и место использования легко устанавливаются в параметрах; очень легко включается в другие компоненты и модули (Чтобы добавить в вашу форму нужно всего лишь две строчки кода!); поддерживает текущий язык и разговаривает на языке, который соответствует кодовой странице пользователя...    </p>

<p>Attention !!! You must patch all components and modules for Joomla! and all templates. Because SPAM-ROBOTS uses direct URL! </p>

<p>SAMPLE: </p>

<p>http : // yourjoomlasite/index.php?option=com_user&amp;task=register </p>

<p>ОСТОРОЖНО!!! Вы должны установить патчи для всех модулей и компонент, которые используют формы для ввода данных. Так как роботы используют прямые ссылки. И, даже, если у вас не включено отображение модуля регистрации, то робот все равно будет обращаться к нему беспрепятственно. </p>

<p>Например: </p>

<p>http : // yourjoomlasite/index.php?option=com_user&amp;task=register </p>

 title : The jquery-domec Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>jQuery DOM Elements Creator (DOMEC)DOM Elements Creator is a simple plugin for creating DOM elements on-a-fly which can be used as part of jQuery statements. </p>

<p>When you want to create new DOM element in pure jQuery you must use document.createElement() method and then new element must be wrapped in $() before it can be used in jQuery context. You can also use HTML code as a selector to create a new object but this way requires writing HTML, which is rarely comfortable. And you must also remember to escape any quotes. This plugin provides more elegant way to achieve the same effect and requires writing less code. </p>

<p>1.1 version releaseVersion 1.1 of the plugin has been released. It has some heavy API changes so for a few weeks older version will be supported as well. You should consider moving to new version because it offers some important improvements (like possibility to assign events when creating DOM elements). </p>

<p>SupportYou can ask any question regarding DOMEC on our Support News Group. Posting comments on Wiki has been disabled. For posting issue information please use our Issue Tracker. </p>

<p>DocumentsDocumentation </p>

 title : The jquery-jec Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>jQuery Editable Combobox (jEC)jQuery Editable Combobox is a jQuery function that allows you to transform any  element into editable combobox. </p>

<p>Featureseasy-to-use - you need to include the sources and run only one command to enable editable combobox functionality on your site, there is also a couple of examples that demonstrates the most commonly used features of the plugin flexible - you can theme it just like you would do with the normal select box, there is a number of preferences that you can change to have combobox suited for your needs, powerful - you can dynamically enable or disable combobox features, use it&#39;s values in your scripts and easily modify preferences on runtime, if you find a feature that is not there let us know and we will try to add it soon browser and system independent - plugin will work with all browsers that are supported by jQuery library including Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer, Google Chrome, Apple Safari and Opera; plugin will also work on different operating systems including Windows, Unix (Linux) and MacOS X well-written - we&#39;ve prepared over 300 unit tests to ensure it works well, the code is validated against JSLint to ensure it&#39;s best quality up-to-date - we&#39;re updating plugin to work with alpha and beta version of jQuery to ensure it&#39;s compatibility as soon as new version of the framework is released SupportYou can ask any question regarding jEC on our Support News Group. Posting comments on Wiki has been disabled. For posting issue information please use our Issue Tracker. </p>

 title : The jquery-translate Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>This plugin integrates the Google Ajax Language API to jQuery. You can just call e.g. $(&#39;body&#39;).translate(&#39;en&#39;) but provides callbacks for each translated element too. Or you can pass an array to $.translate to get back a translated array. Currently you can only send a limited amount of characters with the raw API per request but this plugin calls them consecutively. It also reduces the number of requests by concatenating elements and doesn&#39;t send unnecessary html markup still providing access to each element as they&#39;ve got translated. </p>

<p>Please use the bug tracker on the Issues tab if you encounter any problem! </p>

<p>download builder for version 1.4: http://jquery-translate.appspot.com/ </p>

<p>The file in the download section is for testing only, it contains all the components, which is unnecessary in almost all cases. </p>

<p>Most important changes in 1.4: http://code.google.com/p/jquery-translate/wiki/Upgrading</p>
 title : The jquery-transmit Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Welcome!  Transmit (jquery-transmit) is a sophisticated jQuery plugin providing an elegant multi-file upload utility.  At the core of the plugin is a small SWF file which provides single or multiple file selection and upload services.  Getting started with the plugin couldn&#39;t be easier: </p>

<p>           $(document).ready(function() {
<br/>                $(&quot;#transmit&quot;).transmit(&quot;http://mysite.com/upload/&quot;);
<br/>            });Want to narrow the type of selected files to allow only images?  Here&#39;s how to do it: </p>

<p>           $(document).ready(function() {
<br/>                var options = {
<br/>                    allowedFileTypes: [{
<br/>                        description: &quot;Images&quot;,
<br/>                        extensions: &quot;*.jpg; *.gif; *.png&quot;
<br/>                    }]
<br/>                };
<br/>                $(&quot;#transmit&quot;).transmit(&quot;http://mysite.com/upload/&quot;, options);
<br/>            });For complete usage details, see the plugin documentation.</p>

 title : The jsamp Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>JSamp is a simple sampling CPU profiler for the JVM, written in Java.  It works by periodically taking a snapshot of each thread&#39;s stack. </p>

<p>JSamp can be attached/detached arbitrarily to/from a running JVM.  It can also be programmatically started/stopped, from within the application itself, when used as a library. </p>

<p>See the Documentation for more details.</p>

 title : The jsonhandlerdotnet Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Marketing StuffAn easy-to-use http handler that wraps a set of services in your web application. The handler allows web apps to consume JSON services without much additional code on the service layer. </p>

<p>The One Minute Guide to JsonHandlerDotNetWhat it doesEnables a class to be exposed as a service. Outputs results as a JSON object.  </p>

<p>How to use itAdd a reference to JsonHTTPHandler.dll Open your web.config and add the following entry 
<br/>     
<br/>     
<br/>        
<br/>      
<br/>    
<br/>Open the class you want to expose and add the JsonService and JsonMethod attributes [JsonService]
<br/>public class MyService 
<br/>{
<br/>  [JsonMethod]
<br/>  public Information GetInformation(int foo)
<br/>  {
<br/>  }
<br/>}Open your website&#39;s global.asax and register each one of your services (a.k.a. Classes that have the JsonService attribute) protected void Application_Start(object sender, EventArgs e)
<br/>{
<br/>  JSONHandler.RegisterService(typeof(MyService));
<br/>}Test the handler by surfing to this URL: http://your_site_directory/.json/MyService/GetInformation?foo=1Luke Venediger</p>

 title : The msnmago Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Msnmago is a python application which logs into Microsoft Messenger service (known as MSN or Windows Live Messenger) on a specified account letting you control your computer remotely by simply interacting with a bot through MSN from the other account  from anywhere you wish. Msnmago lets you: </p>

<p>execute any shell command send any file placed in its repository receive file see what is going on on the computer asking it to send a screenshot.  </p>

<p>You communicate with msnmago in very simple command mini-language, eg. to see a list of directories you would write shell ls or to get file test.jpg you would write downloads get test.jpg </p>

<p>It is highly customizable ... you may configure which MSN contacts may interact with a bot and even specify which commands are available to which users. </p>

<p>It maybe extened by defining new commands either as: </p>

<p>msnmago simple language&#39;s macros python code external application </p>

<p>Works on any system supporting Python, esp: </p>

<p>Windows  Mac OS Linux </p>

<p>Tested on Windows Vista and Mac OS Tiger. </p>

<p>It requires pyGTK for screenshots, however if not present, only this feature is not available.</p>

<p>Changelog0.4Alpha    </p>

<p>Fix some bugs. </p>

<p>0.3AlphaJTidy =&gt; htmlparser IF BLOCK =  FOR BLOCK =  INCLUDE =  (i&#39;m tired) 0.2AlphaChanging self::method() to this.method() in hrref / onclick Bug: templates/.file.htm crash (files generated by eclipse) FeaturesInformation about application in .JS Annotations. Generate javascript DOM code from HTML files.		var template = new osg.Template(&quot;bar.htm&quot;); 		 </p>

<br/>template.add(&quot;mensagem&quot;, &quot;Hello&quot;);

<p>RequirementsJRE 1.5&gt; apache-ant Know IssuesDon&#39;t use style=&quot;&quot; in tags.  Annotations works in anywhere on the jscode. ExamplesAnnotationsYou can use annotations to define some application settings. Exemple: (application code) </p>

<p>/**
<br/> * Some comments... 
<br/> * 
<br/> * 
<br/> * @id YOU_APP_ID__MODULE_ID__
<br/> * @title OSG Sample application
<br/> * @height 500
<br/> * @description This is a OSG Generated application 
<br/> * @singleton
<br/> * @thumbnail resources/thumbnail.jpg
<br/> * @require opensocial-0.5
<br/> * @require tabs
<br/> * @require flash 
<br/> * @initFunction onInit
<br/> * @include lib/mylib.js
<br/> * @include resources/another_file.css</p>

<p> *
<br/> */@id =&gt; The application instance name ($INSTANCE reference on js code) @initFunction =&gt; first function called on application object. @include &gt; add css and javascript. @js =&gt; include a external javascript @css =&gt; set the css file. (resources/default.css is added if exists and @css don&#39;t exists) Using if / loop in template.application code (javascript) </p>

<p>...

<br/>template.add(&quot;list&quot;, [&#39;item1&#39;, &#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;]);

 summary : <p>OpenStructOpenStruct – PHP framework for rapid web-development. Openstruct structures the code based on MVC pattern and lets developers concentrate on application logic.  title : The ormer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>ORMer is differs from other PHP ORM tools because it needs no XML config files and makes no assumptions about table/field names. Whenever possible it discovers row relations through foreign keys. </p>

<p>Before we begin: What&#39;s your ideal usage like for a supremely elegant PHP ORM tool? Be inspired, and perhaps give me feedback here. </p>

<p>FeaturesAutomatic relationship discovery through foreign keys (complete on SQLite2 and MySQL 5.1.10+) Give the coder the ability to specify relationships manually if he/she doesn&#39;t want to use foreign keys No assumptions about table or field names No requirements pertaining to table or field names; use your own conventions Simplest possible way of adding extra where clauses to use when pulling related data: method chaining (see examples) Step out of the way when you need to flex SQL skills that ORMer can&#39;t hack Act as if you&#39;re dealing with classes and objects rather than database records See it in actionWhat about: </p>

<p>$all_ordered_products = user::find()-&gt;orders-&gt;order_product-&gt;product;
<br/>foreach($all_ordered_products as $product) {
<br/>    echo $product-&gt;name;
<br/>}See some more examples </p>

<p>See the codeThere is a Mercurial repository available, so you can browse the code or checkout a copy. See the link to the right. </p>

<p>This project is seeking contributors. If you have some ideas about how ORM interaction should work, or want to dive into the nitty-gritty on a project whose code is intended to be readable and understandable by other developers, contact me. </p>

<p>Contact meGo here for now. Mention ORMer if it&#39;s about this project.</p>

 summary : <p>mooTree2 is an open-source javascript tree-control for use with the MooTools javascript framework.</p>

<p>The key features of mooTree are:</p>

<p>- works with IE 6.0 and newer, Firefox and Opera
<br/>- super lightweight - only 8 KB of javascript and a single GIF file
<br/>- fully dynamic, e.g. adding / removing items on-the-fly
<br/>- dynamically load nodes via XML (&quot;ajax&quot;)
<br/>- easily replace nested structures of  and  elements
<br/>- flexible node icons (supports &quot;strips&quot; of icons)
<br/>- tree- and node-level events on click, on select / deselect and on expand / collapse</p>

<p>http://mootree.mindplay.dk/examples.html</p>

 title : The packmanutil Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Introduction to PackManUtilPackManUtil is a command line application implemented through shell (BASH) scripts originally created for use with an x86_64 multilib Cross Linux from Scratch (CLFS) base system to simplify the build process for additional packages.  PackManUtil is written, tested, and used daily on x86_64 multilib, i586, and 32-bit PowerPC CLFS systems. </p>

<p>If you use PackManUtil, we&#39;d appreciate a quick e-mail letting us know what you think.  Even if you think PackManUtil stinks and is a waste of our time working on. </p>

<p>We&#39;ve also been picked up by Softpedia if you&#39;d like to write a review.  http://linux.softpedia.com/get/System/Software-Distribution/PackManUtil-41680.shtml </p>

<p>News2009-07-03 </p>

<p>Added the ability to strip installed binaries and libraries with the --stripit switch. Added new function to update build script directory using subversion with the --update switch. </p>

<p>2009-03-11 </p>

<p>Added md5sum checking capability for source tarballs. </p>

<p>2008-12-03 </p>

<p>Happy birthday to my wife.  Oh yeah, I also created a Google Group for PackManUtil.  Join us at http://groups.google.com/group/packmanutil?lnk=gcimh.  The mailing list is at packmanutil@googlegroups.com. </p>

<p>2008-11-08 </p>

<p>Released version 1.0.0.  This is considered the first stable release.  Please report any and all problems. </p>

<p>2008-10-13 </p>

<p>Please do not install NSPR using PackManUtil.  For some, as yet unknown, reason installing NSPR with PackManUtil may break your system&#39;s toolchain.  After installing NSPR the system reports a missing /lib64/libc.so.6 although the library is still there.  The NSPR build script has been removed from the SVN repository, but is part of the 0.9 release.  It will be removed from future releases if the problem cannot be fixed. </p>

<p>DependenciesRequired Dependencieswget or Aria2 which Recommended Dependencies  </p>

<p>paco InstallWatch rpm2targz </p>

<p>InstallationInstallation of PackManUtil is simple.  Most users will just execute the install.sh script found in the source directory.  For more details, visit our Installation Instructions. </p>

<p>ConfigurationAfter installing PackManUtil, configuration is accomplished by editing the build.cfg file.  There is a system-wide build.cfg file and each user can create their own in the ~/.packmanutil directory.  For more configuration details, visit our Configuration Instructions. </p>

<p>LoggingSeveral logs are created by PackManUtil during the build process.  One of these logs is /var/log/packmanutil/times.log.  This log keeps track of the time required to configure, make, make install, and total time for each package you install using PackManUtil.  If you set the SBU variable in build.cfg, then the SBU of each package will also be logged. </p>

<p>A database of build times is maintained by the PackManUtil developer.  We would appreciate you providing a copy of your times.log by e-mail so we can add your times to the database.  Once we have a sufficiently large data set, we will publish the information for everyone&#39;s use.  Of course, it is up to you. </p>

<p>See the Logging Wiki page for information we would request in addition to the file. </p>

<p>Change LogLatest release is 1.1.0. </p>

<p>July 3, 2009 - Release 1.1.0 </p>

<p>Additional build scripts added. Added ability to strip installed binaries and libraries. Added function to update build script directory using subversion. March 11, 2009 - Release 1.0.2 </p>

<p>Additional build scripts added. Support for md5sum checking of downloaded source tarballs added. January 25, 2009 - Release 1.0.1 </p>

<p>Additional build scripts added. November 08, 2008 - Release 1.0.0 </p>

<p>Additional build scripts added. Removed build scripts that don&#39;t build correctly (see issues). Added MD5SUMS file to release installs in doc directory. October 15, 2008 - Release 0.9.1 </p>

<p>Additional build scripts added. Removed NSPR build script (see News, above). September 19, 2008 - Release 0.9 </p>

<p>Added support for libnotify. Additional build scripts added. Tested on CLFS-1.1.0 multilib x86_64 system. August 24, 2008 - Release 0.8 </p>

<p>Minor fixes; no new functionality added. Additional build scripts added. August 12, 2008 - Release 0.7.2 </p>

<p>Fixed install script so it backs up build.cfg before installing the new build.cfg. (&amp;nbsp;Bug #5&amp;nbsp;) August 12, 2008 - Release 0.7.1 </p>

<p>Fixed install script so it installs in a versioned directory and creates a non-versioned symlink. Added PowerPC build options to build.cfg. August 11, 2008 - Release 0.7 </p>

<p>Fixed problem with blank file opening in editor when a new build script was created. (&amp;nbsp;Bug #1&amp;nbsp;) Fixed problem with build times being logged to times.log when build failed.  (&amp;nbsp;Bug #2&amp;nbsp;) July 13, 2008 - Release 0.6 </p>

<p>Initial public release.</p>
 title : The passworp-jcl Open Source Project on Open Hub

 title : The phpyahoo Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>phpYahoo is a class written in PHP5 that act&#39;s as a wrapper for Yahoo&#39;s! Web Search API. Methods process the response XML and return an array of data to make development easier. With this class you can search for Yahoo! Web content, Yahoo! Videos or Yahoo! Images. </p>

<p>Updated 2007-02-01New Expanded Version includes:  
<br/>I have reworked the phpYahoo class to be the base class that handles the REST request and caching and have created sub-classes for each Yahoo! Service.   
<br/>The class structure now looks like this: 
<br/>phpYahoo phpYahooWebSearch extends phpYahoo phpYahooSiteExplorer extends phpYahoo phpYahooMyWeb extends phpYahoo Now you can interface with Yahoo! Web, Video and Image Search, Yahoo! Site Explorer and Yahoo! My Web. 
<br/>Updated 2007-01-30Cleaned up code Added more documentation Updated 2007-01-29dded Caching via PDO or File System xpanded Search to searching for a word/phrase or a set of parameters</p>
 title : The pl-survey Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>What is this?Perl CGI survey script with little to no dependencies, implemented as a RESTful architecture. </p>

<p>Why building it?I needed a very light CGI script with no, or very few dependencies (had to run with no CPAN magic on a stock ActiveState Perl install on Windows).  I don&#39;t know enough and don&#39;t like ASP, I know Perl—here&#39;s the result.</p>
 title : The plosxom Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>IntroductionPlosxom is a blogsoftware written in PHP by Pali Dhar. It is a rewrite of phposxom. Blogposts are stored in textfiles, categories are simple directories. Plosxom has a comprehensive plugin api, which allows to add almost any functionality or to replace existing functionality. </p>

<p>DetailsPhposxom were itself a php rewrite of blosxom, but the developer has abandoned the project. I am using it, because I cannot run perl where my site is hosted and because it is small. However, the sourcecode of phposxom were nearly unmaintanable, inefficient and bad styled (sorry Robert). Since I use it on an every day basis, I decided to completely rewrite it. Plosxom was born. </p>

<p>Many of the blosxom forks out there have been abandoned too, especially the php ports (there are lots of it). None of them seemed to be a usefull base for me. Most of them justify their decision that if it were developed further it would become too far to existing projects like wordpress and they didn&#39;t want to re-invent the wheel. </p>

<p>While I share this view in general, I also see a lot of disadvantages with wordpress: its storage backend can&#39;t be replaced. It depends on MySQL, which is the worst database system on the planet. With plosxom you could write a sqlite backend or whatever you like, even a mysql backend. Wordpress is also a &quot;large biest&quot;, it contains a lot of source code and thus a lot of problems, especially from the security point of view. </p>

<p>Speaking of security - plosxom were developed with strong security in mind. Since there is almost no cgi input being used in the software, this goal were not difficult to achive. Everything which gets into the script will be filtered for bogus characters. Future attacks are hopefully prevented using this technique. </p>

<p>The plosxom core engine is very small. In fact, I wrote it in just two days. This sounds like a hell of a crap, but it isn&#39;t. Much functionality is provided by plugins, even core functions, such as text file management, is coded as a plugin. Since we are using smarty as our template engine there are endless possibilities to enhance plosxom. You can write a simple plugin along with a simple smarty function and that&#39;s it. </p>

<p>CommentsFor now, plosxom doesn&#39;t provide built-in comment support due to security reasons. Instead comments can be outsourced to Haloscan. However, perhaps someone will write a comment plugin some day, who knows. </p>

<p>Administering plosxomPlosxom can be maintained the traditional unix way on the commandline. Just ssh into your webservers shell account, cd to the data directory, mkdir a new one (viewed as category), cd into that new directory, vi a new file with .txt suffix, first line being the title, :x it and you&#39;re almost done. Of yourse you could also write a new posting on your local computer and upload it afterwards. </p>

<p>Adding images, installing templates or plugins - everything can be done from the commandline, you&#39;ll always keep full control over your blog. </p>

<p>However, for the lazy people out there, an administration webinterface exists as plugin too. From the admin webinterface you can add postings, install plugins or change the current template as easy as clicking the mouse. </p>

<p>For the curious - here is a screenshot of the admin backend in action </p>

<p>More InformationsDownload the latest version, Take a look at the documentation or browse the plugin-directory. </p>

<p>If you have questions post them to the Forum. </p>

<p>To get an idea of how it looks, visit the demo blog! </p>

<p>Update November 2008www.nonlogic.org, the site where I did most of the development work and also published my own blog, developer blog as well as the demo blog, is down for unknown reason. The only notice I could found was this topic that where set a while ago on ##nonlogic: </p>

<p>1259 &gt;&gt;[New Topic]&gt;&gt;  Nonlogic is dead, please do not contact shadowarts about it, he does
<br/>          not give a shit.  By shadowarts</p>

 title : The pockemul Open Source Project on Open Hub
 title : The pod2gcw Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>pod2gcwpod2gcw is a Perl script which converts Perl&#39;s POD documentation format into Google Code wiki markup. It is able, with a single invocation, to convert all the POD documentation in the trunk of a project into wiki pages. It is also able to generate cross-links between these pages using POD link markup. In other words, it wikifies your POD, giving you instant manpages! </p>

<p>For more detail, see the self-generated manual page for pod2gcw. </p>

<p>At this point, there is no official &quot;release&quot; of the software, thus no &quot;download&quot; tab. Instead, please check out the latest version from the trunk. There may never be an official &quot;release&quot; since the main target audience is people who are using Google Code, and they are already in a good position to check this file out and keep it up to date using subversion!</p>

 title : The Bin Packer Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Qvol is a plugin based application for volume processing. It is built with a C backend for creating specialized code such as tomographic reconstruction algorithms and segmentation algorithms. It is composed of the main application with a generic plugin interface for documents, views, and processes. </p>

<p>Examples of documents are volumes, histograms, and meshes. Volumes can also extend other documents for example a Dicom document extends a Volume Document. </p>

<p>Views are associated with documents and may also extend other views. For example ClinicalVolumeViewer contains 3 instances of volumeviewer. </p>

<p>Processes can extend the funcationality of a document or process multiple documents. An example is VolumeProjector which projects a volume onto an image (ie: a volume of size XxYx1). Another exmaple of a process is volumetomesh3dprocess which converts a volume to a 3D tetrahedral mesh. </p>

<p>The alpha release of qvol is planned for release in July or August of 2008</p>

 summary : <p>A simple desktop utility for putting the most amount of files onto a given set of CD/DVDs.Typically known as the Bin Packing or Knapsack problem.</p>

 title : The r4ss Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>R code for reading and plotting output from Stock SynthesisStock Synthesis is a fisheries stock assessment model written in ADMB by Dr. Rick Methot at the NMFS Northwest Fisheries Science Center. The R code presented here is based on the original work of Dr. Ian Stewart, also at NWFSC, and now includes contributions from various collaborators. This code makes use of the statistical software R to analyze and plot the output from Stock Synthesis version 3. Additional developments are planned, as described in Wishlist page in the Wiki section of this website. </p>

<p>InstallationThe R code is now in a package which can be installed within R using the commands </p>

<p>&gt; install.packages(&quot;r4ss&quot;) 
<br/>&gt; library(r4ss) 
<br/>After installing the package, you can use the function </p>

<p>&gt; update_r4ss_files() 
<br/>to have R source the latest development versions of the package files from the Source page of this website. </p>

<p>Important linksStock Synthesis version 3.10 is available for download at http://nft.nefsc.noaa.gov Anyone unfamiliar with R can learn more here: http://www.r-project.org Link to CRAN r4ss site: http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/r4ss/index.html DocumentationA PDF file for documentation associated with the new R Package for this code is at http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/r4ss/r4ss.pdf </p>

<p>Within this site, there is documentation of the main two functions, SSv3_output and SSv3_plots, on the Documentation page. Additional functions are described in Documentation_part2. See the full list of informational pages using the Wiki tab above. </p>

<p>Keeping up to dateTo sign up on an email list associated with this site, go to http://groups.google.com/group/r4ss/subscribe?hl=en. Note that this is different from becoming a project member on this site, which you are also welcome to do (see below). Click the &quot;updates&quot; link above to see a list of past changes to the code and this website.  Once the &#39;r4ss&#39; package is installed, you can source the latest files from this website (which may be newer than the package files) by running the function, </p>

<p>&gt; update_r4ss_files() 
<br/>Making contributionsGoogle Code websites require registration to make comments or add issues. To register, provide an email address and create a password at  http://www.google.com/accounts/NewAccount. If you would also like to edit the documentation in the wiki or post files for download, please register first and then email Ian Taylor  to be added as a project member.  </p>

<p>DisclaimerThis website was prepared by Dr. Ian Taylor under award NA17RJ1232 from NOAA Fisheries, Department of Commerce.  The statements, findings,conclusions and recommendations are those of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of NOAA Fisheries or the U.S. Department of Commerce. </p>

<p>Code available on this website comes with no warranty or guarantee of accuracy. It merely represents an ongoing attempt to integrate output plotting, statistics and diagnostics. It is absolutely necessary that prior to use with a new application, the user checks the output manually to verify that there are no plotting or statistical bugs which could incorrectly represent the output files being analyzed.</p>

 title : The Kungfu Master Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>A role-playing game which player will play role of a trainning-to-be kungfu master in a fantasy world.</p>
 summary : <p>Based on configuration file or command line parameters, offers the following functionality: </p>

<p>Encode - The program looks for .WAV files and will encode them using .FLAC Decode - The program looks for .FLAC files and will decode them to .WAV MP3    - The program looks for .FLAC files, intermediately decodes them to .WAV, then uses lame to encode the .WAV to .MP3 and removes the .WAV file ReFLAC - The program looks for .FLAC files and re-encodes them to .FLAC Test   - The program looks for .FLAC and tests the files for validity Taking the following types of input: </p>

<p>Directory - Command Line Parameter DIR.  If used, the program will look in this directory and all subdirectories for files and perform the Mode action on those files File List - Command Line Parameter FILELIST.  formatted as 1 file per line with full path and filename, the program will iterate through each file and perform the mode action. File      - Command Line Parameter FILE.  It will allow the program to act on an individual file. </p>

<p>This program is just a wrapper around functionality available in other programs.  It makes use of the following executables: </p>

<p>FLAC v1.2.1 Makes use of flac.exe and metaflac.exe, these programs can be obtained from http://flac.sourceforge.net/  on the Download page, click on the link to download FLAC for Windows (command-line tools only). </p>

<p>Tag v2.0.52 Makes use of Tag to identify and remove ID3v2 tags.  This program can be obtained from http://synthetic-soul.co.uk/tag/ </p>

<p>Lame v3.97 LAME is an MPEG Audio Layer III (MP3) encoder licensed under the LGPL.  It can be downloaded from http://lame.sourceforge.net </p>

<p>metamp3 v.092b5 MetaMP3 is used to copy tags from FLAC files to MP3 files when in MP3 mode http://www.hydrogenaudio.org/forums/index.php?showtopic=49751 </p>

<p>This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details.  </p>

<p>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;numberInteger&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;numberFloat&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;email&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;ssn&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;url&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;phoneNumberUS&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;zipCodeUS&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;currencyUS&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;htmlHexCode&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;dottedQuadIP&#39;));
<br/>someVar.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;macAddress&#39;));Example:
<br/>var quadIP = &#39;127.0.0.1&#39;;
<br/>if (quadIP.match($.regexpCommon(&#39;dottedQuadIP&#39;)) ) {
<br/>  message += quadIP + &quot; is a Dotted Quad IP Address&quot;;

So far I am the only consumer of the library, and it hasn&#39;t been that thouroughly tested in the real world. It works for me and I find RPX a great service to interact with, so it would be great if this library could grow to help RPX integration for the .Net community.</p>
 title : The samisays Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>Sami Says is an application designed to aid visually impaired children tell stories through sound.  As an alternative to writing by hand, students are able to use Sami Says to record themselves speaking their stories aloud.  The students can also choose from libraries of sound effects to insert into their story, so that they may better describe the characters and events.  Teachers will also be able to choose which sounds the students may use in a story, so that the children must find creative uses for the specific sounds as they write. </p>

<p>Sami Says exposes children to new technology and enables them to develop their creative writing abilities by creating something that would be difficult without this assistive technology.  And they&#39;ll have fun, too. </p>

 title : The satcontroller Open Source Project on Open Hub
 summary : <p>The Modular Ground Station Controller is an application built on an open framework that supports interactive or automated ground station control based on predicted satellite passes. The application consists of a number of independently operating modules communicating through a specific event bus. The cross-platform binary is available for any operating system which supports Mono or .NET.  </p>

<p>2007-11-19 Alpha release created! Just in time for the article I wrote for the AMSAT Journal. Binary and Installer packages available for windows. Linux and OS X versions to come as soon as I work through some mono inconsistencies. </p>

<p>Features </p>

<p>Flexible console or GUI based interface 24 hour AOS/LOS charts Doppler correction with passband tuning Automatic transverter offset tuning Automatic rotator control Automatic track initiation for selected satellites Multi-satellite polar plots Multi-platform binary with support for Windows and Linux </p>

<p> </p>

<p>Supported Hardware </p>

<p>The application is currently in prototype form and needs more hardware support, but I have little of my own. If you are interested in helping either by supplying specifications, testing, or writing some modules, please let me know. If you would like me to consider adding support for your hardware, simply log an issue and provide a link to the technical specifications. </p>

<p>Icom CI-V compatible tuners Yaesu GS-232B rotators</p>

<p>AlgorithmQuick video demo: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vIFCV2spKtg Site: http://www.faculty.idc.ac.il/arik/ Paper: http://www.faculty.idc.ac.il/arik/imret.pdf Video: http://www.faculty.idc.ac.il/arik/IMRet-All.mov ExampleThe following example was generated completely automatically.  The algorithm works best on exactly this type of image. </p>

<p>Note that the water mark was scaled without scaling its component letters.  Each letter is just moved closer to its neighbors. </p>
